children.hasDefinition: A type of computational resource used in bioinformatics.
children.label: Resource type

children.hasDefinition: A bioinformatics package or tool, e.g. a standalone application or web service.
children.label: Tool

children.hasDefinition: A digital data archive typically based around a relational model but sometimes using an object-oriented, tree or graph-based model.
children.label: Database

children.hasDefinition: A directory on disk from which files are read.
children.label: Directory metadata

children.hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary from National Library of Medicine. The MeSH thesaurus is used to index articles in biomedical journals for the Medline/PubMED databases.
children.label: MeSH vocabulary

children.hasDefinition: Controlled vocabulary for gene names (symbols) from HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
children.label: HGNC vocabulary

children.hasDefinition: Compendium of controlled vocabularies for the biomedical domain (Unified Medical Language System).
children.label: UMLS vocabulary

children.hasDefinition: An entry (retrievable via URL) from a biological database.
children.label: Database entry

children.hasDefinition: A raw molecular sequence (string of characters) which might include ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps and translation stop.
children.label: Raw sequence

children.hasDefinition: A character used to replace (mask) other characters in a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence mask character

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of sequence masking to perform.
children.comment: Sequence masking is where specific characters or positions in a molecular sequence are masked (replaced) with an another (mask character). The mask type indicates what is masked, for example regions that are not of interest or which are information-poor including acidic protein regions, basic protein regions, proline-rich regions, low compositional complexity regions, short-periodicity internal repeats, simple repeats and low complexity regions. Masked sequences are used in database search to eliminate statistically significant but biologically uninteresting hits.
children.label: Sequence mask type

children.hasDefinition: The strand of a DNA sequence (forward or reverse).
children.comment: The forward or 'top' strand might specify a sequence is to be used as given, the reverse or 'bottom' strand specifying the reverse complement of the sequence is to be used.
children.label: DNA sense specification

children.hasDefinition: A specification of sequence length(s).
children.label: Sequence length specification

children.hasDefinition: Basic or general information concerning molecular sequences.
children.comment: This is used for such things as a report including the sequence identifier, type and length.
children.label: Sequence metadata

children.hasDefinition: Data files used by motif or profile methods.
children.label: Sequence signature model

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of exact matches between subsequences (words) within two or more molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment (words)

children.hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a sequence alignment (or similar 'match') operation.
children.label: Sequence alignment parameter

children.hasDefinition: Report of general information on a sequence alignment, typically include a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.
children.label: Sequence alignment metadata

children.hasDefinition: A profile-profile alignment (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).
children.label: Profile-profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Predicted or actual protein topology represented as a string of protein secondary structure elements.
children.comment: The location and size of the secondary structure elements and intervening loop regions is usually indicated.
children.label: Protein topology

children.hasDefinition: Secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein.
children.label: Protein features report (secondary structure)

children.hasDefinition: Super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).
children.comment: Super-secondary structures include leucine zippers, coiled coils, Helix-Turn-Helix etc.
children.label: Protein features report (super-secondary)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.
children.label: Secondary structure alignment metadata (protein)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report of RNA secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.
children.label: Secondary structure alignment metadata (RNA)

children.hasDefinition: An entry from a molecular tertiary (3D) structure database.
children.label: Tertiary structure record

children.hasDefinition: Results (hits) from searching a database of tertiary structure.
children.label: Structure database search results

children.hasDefinition: An alignment of a sequence to a 3D profile (representing structures or a structure alignment).
children.label: Sequence-3D profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific amino acid.
children.label: Amino acid annotation

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific peptide.
children.label: Peptide annotation

children.hasDefinition: 3D structural motifs in a protein.
children.label: Protein structural motifs and surfaces

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).
children.label: Protein domain classification

children.hasDefinition: structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.
children.label: Protein features report (domains)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure) of a protein structure.
children.label: Protein architecture report

children.hasDefinition: A report on an analysis or model of protein folding properties, folding pathways, residues or sites that are key to protein folding, nucleation or stabilisation centers etc.
children.label: Protein folding report

children.hasDefinition: Data on the effect of (typically point) mutation on protein folding, stability, structure and function.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein features (mutation)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific nucleotide base.
children.label: Nucleotide base annotation

children.hasDefinition: A report on the classification of nucleic acid / gene sequences according to the functional classification of their gene products.
children.label: Gene classification

children.hasDefinition: stable, naturally occuring mutations in a nucleotide sequence including alleles, naturally occurring mutations such as single base nucleotide substitutions, deletions and insertions, RFLPs and other polymorphisms.
children.label: DNA variation

children.hasDefinition: PCR experiments, e.g. quantitative real-time PCR.
children.label: PCR experiment report

children.hasDefinition: microarray experiments including conditions, protocol, sample:data relationships etc.
children.label: Microarray experiment report

children.hasDefinition: Data on oligonucleotide probes (typically for use with DNA microarrays).
children.label: Oligonucleotide probe data

children.hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) experiment.
children.label: SAGE experimental data

children.hasDefinition: Massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) data.
children.label: MPSS experimental data

children.hasDefinition: Sequencing by synthesis (SBS) data.
children.label: SBS experimental data

children.hasDefinition: Tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.
children.label: Sequence tag profile (with gene assignment)

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on a structural 3D model (volume map) from electron microscopy.
children.label: Electron microscopy model

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific biological pathway or network, typically including a map (diagram) of the pathway.
children.label: Pathway or network annotation

children.hasDefinition: A map (typically a diagram) of a biological pathway.
children.label: Biological pathway map

children.hasDefinition: A definition of a data resource serving one or more types of data, including metadata and links to the resource or data proper.
children.label: Data resource definition

children.hasDefinition: Resource definition for an EMBOSS database.
children.label: EMBOSS database resource definition

children.hasDefinition: Information on a version of software or data, for example name, version number and release date.
children.comment: Development status / maturity may be part of the version information, for example in case of tools, standards, or some data records.
children.label: Version information

children.hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a submitted or completed job.
children.label: Job metadata

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific scent.
children.label: Scent annotation

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological entity or phenomenon.
children.label: Entity identifier

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a data resource.
children.label: Data resource identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a discrete entity (any biological thing with a distinct, discrete physical existence).
children.label: Discrete entity identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an entity feature (a physical part or region of a discrete biological entity, or a feature that can be mapped to such a thing).
children.label: Entity feature identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a collection of discrete biological entities.
children.label: Entity collection identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a physical, observable biological occurrence or event.
children.label: Phenomenon identifier

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type a molecule.
children.comment: For example, 'Protein', 'DNA', 'RNA' etc.
children.label: Molecule type

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a chemical compound.
children.label: Chemical identifier

children.hasDefinition: Code word for a ligand, for example from a PDB file.
children.label: Ligand identifier

children.hasDefinition: A specification (partial or complete) of one or more positions or regions of a molecular sequence or map.
children.label: Sequence position specification

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of an nucleic acid feature.
children.label: Nucleic acid feature identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a protein feature.
children.label: Protein feature identifier

children.hasDefinition: String of one or more ASCII characters representing a codon.
children.label: Codon name

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI RefSeq unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene identifier (NCBI RefSeq)

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI UniGene unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene identifier (NCBI UniGene)

children.hasDefinition: An Entrez unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene identifier (Entrez)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Sequence database name

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from a database where the same type of identifier is used for objects (data) of different semantic type.
children.comment: This concept is required for completeness. It should never have child concepts.
children.label: Database entry identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a sequence signature (motif or profile) for example from a database of sequence patterns.
children.label: Sequence signature identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic distance matrix.
children.label: Phylogenetic distance matrix identifier

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of molecular sequence.
children.comment: Sequence type might reflect the molecule (protein, nucleic acid etc) or the sequence itself (gapped, ambiguous etc).
children.label: Sequence type

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry. May contain version or isoform number.
children.label: UniProt accession (extended)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a TREMBL sequence database entry.
children.label: TREMBL accession

children.hasDefinition: The EMBOSS type of a molecular sequence.
children.comment: See the EMBOSS documentation (http://emboss.sourceforge.net/) for a definition of what this includes.
children.label: EMBOSS sequence type

children.hasDefinition: List of EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Addresses (EMBOSS listfile).
children.label: EMBOSS listfile

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a sequence alignment.
children.comment: Possible values include for example the EMBOSS alignment types, BLAST alignment types and so on.
children.label: Sequence alignment type

children.hasDefinition: The type of a BLAST sequence alignment.
children.label: BLAST sequence alignment type

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a phylogenetic tree.
children.comment: For example 'nj', 'upgmp' etc.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree type

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a comparison matrix.
children.comment: For example 'blosum', 'pam', 'gonnet', 'id' etc. Comparison matrix type may be required where a series of matrices of a certain type are used.
children.label: Comparison matrix type

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HIVDB database.
children.label: HIVDB identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the aMAZE database.
children.label: Pathway ID (aMAZE)

children.hasDefinition: A file of intermediate results from a PSIBLAST search that is used for priming the search in the next PSIBLAST iteration.
children.comment: A Psiblast checkpoint file uses ASN.1 Binary Format and usually has the extension '.asn'.
children.label: Psiblast checkpoint file

children.hasDefinition: Sequences generated by HMMER package in FASTA-style format.
children.label: HMMER synthetic sequences set

children.hasDefinition: File of sequence vectors used by EMBOSS vectorstrip application, or any file in same format.
children.label: vectorstrip cloning vector definition file

children.hasDefinition: A library of nucleotide sequences to avoid during hybridisation events. Hybridisation of the internal oligo to sequences in this library is avoided, rather than priming from them. The file is in a restricted FASTA format.
children.label: Primer3 internal oligo mishybridizing library

children.hasDefinition: A nucleotide sequence library of sequences to avoid during amplification (for example repetitive sequences, or possibly the sequences of genes in a gene family that should not be amplified. The file must is in a restricted FASTA format.
children.label: Primer3 mispriming library file

children.hasDefinition: File of one or more pairs of primer sequences, as used by EMBOSS primersearch application.
children.label: primersearch primer pairs sequence record

children.hasDefinition: Size of a sequence word.
children.comment: Word size is used for example in word-based sequence database search methods.
children.label: Word size

children.hasDefinition: Size of a sequence window.
children.comment: A window is a region of fixed size but not fixed position over a molecular sequence. It is typically moved (computationally) over a sequence during scoring.
children.label: Window size

children.hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of length of sequences.
children.label: Sequence length range

children.hasDefinition: Report on basic information about a molecular sequence such as name, accession number, type (nucleic or protein), length, description etc.
children.label: Sequence information report

children.hasDefinition: Comparative data on sequence features such as statistics, intersections (and data on intersections), differences etc.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Sequence features (comparative)

children.hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from protein sequence data.
children.label: Sequence property (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A report of general sequence properties derived from nucleotide sequence data.
children.label: Sequence property (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: A table of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence composition table

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of a molecular sequence in DAS format.
children.label: DAS sequence feature annotation

children.hasDefinition: Image of a sequence with matches to signatures, motifs or profiles.
children.label: Sequence signature map

children.hasDefinition: Image showing matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.
children.comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Each protein is represented as a scaled horizontal line with colored bars indicating the position of the matches.
children.label: InterPro compact match image

children.hasDefinition: Image showing detailed information on matches between protein sequence(s) and InterPro Entries.
children.comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself.
children.label: InterPro detailed match image

children.hasDefinition: Image showing the architecture of InterPro domains in a protein sequence.
children.comment: The sequence(s) might be screened against InterPro, or be the sequences from the InterPro entry itself. Domain architecture is shown as a series of non-overlapping domains in the protein.
children.label: InterPro architecture image

children.hasDefinition: SMART protein schematic in PNG format.
children.label: SMART protein schematic

children.hasDefinition: Images based on GlobPlot prediction of intrinsic disordered regions and globular domains in protein sequences.
children.label: GlobPlot domain image

children.hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more sequences.
children.label: Sequence motif matches

children.hasDefinition: Location of short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in (typically nucleotide) sequences.
children.comment: The report might include derived data map such as classification, annotation, organisation, periodicity etc.
children.label: Sequence features (repeats)

children.hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.
children.label: Gene and transcript structure (report)

children.hasDefinition: regions of a nucleic acid sequence containing mobile genetic elements.
children.label: Mobile genetic elements

children.hasDefinition: A report on quadruplex-forming motifs in a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (quadruplexes)

children.hasDefinition: Report on nucleosome formation potential or exclusion sequence(s).
children.label: Nucleosome exclusion sequences

children.hasDefinition: A report on exonic splicing enhancers (ESE) in an exon.
children.label: Gene features (exonic splicing enhancer)

children.hasDefinition: A report on microRNA sequence (miRNA) or precursor, microRNA targets, miRNA binding sites in an RNA sequence etc.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (microRNA)

children.hasDefinition: protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames.
children.label: Coding region

children.hasDefinition: A report on selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) element in a DNA sequence.
children.label: Gene features (SECIS element)

children.hasDefinition: transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) in a DNA sequence.
children.label: Transcription factor binding sites

children.hasDefinition: A report on predicted or known key residue positions (sites) in a protein sequence, such as binding or functional sites.
children.comment: Use this concept for collections of specific sites which are not necessarily contiguous, rather than contiguous stretches of amino acids.
children.label: Protein features (sites)

children.hasDefinition: signal peptides or signal peptide cleavage sites in protein sequences.
children.label: Protein features report (signal peptides)

children.hasDefinition: cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein features report (cleavage sites)

children.hasDefinition: post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.
children.label: Protein features (post-translation modifications)

children.hasDefinition: catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.
children.label: Protein features report (active sites)

children.hasDefinition: ligand-binding (non-catalytic) residues of a protein, such as sites that bind metal, prosthetic groups or lipids.
children.label: Protein features report (binding sites)

children.hasDefinition: A report on antigenic determinant sites (epitopes) in proteins, from sequence and / or structural data.
children.comment: Epitope mapping is commonly done during vaccine design.
children.label: Protein features (epitopes)

children.hasDefinition: RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.
children.label: Protein features report (nucleic acid binding sites)

children.hasDefinition: A report on epitopes that bind to MHC class I molecules.
children.label: MHC Class I epitopes report

children.hasDefinition: A report on predicted epitopes that bind to MHC class II molecules.
children.label: MHC Class II epitopes report

children.hasDefinition: A report or plot of PEST sites in a protein sequence.
children.comment: 'PEST' motifs target proteins for proteolytic degradation and reduce the half-lives of proteins dramatically.
children.label: Protein features (PEST sites)

children.hasDefinition: Scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
children.label: Sequence database hits scores list

children.hasDefinition: Alignments from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
children.label: Sequence database hits alignments list

children.hasDefinition: A report on the evaluation of the significance of sequence similarity scores from a sequence database search (for example a BLAST search).
children.label: Sequence database hits evaluation data

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for the motifs (patterns) that MEME will search for.
children.label: MEME motif alphabet

children.hasDefinition: MEME background frequencies file.
children.label: MEME background frequencies file

children.hasDefinition: File of directives for ordering and spacing of MEME motifs.
children.label: MEME motifs directive file

children.hasDefinition: Emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model, generated once HMM has been determined, for example after residues/gaps have been assigned to match, delete and insert states.
children.label: HMM emission and transition counts

children.hasDefinition: A nucleotide regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
children.label: Prosite nucleotide pattern

children.hasDefinition: A protein regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
children.label: Prosite protein pattern

children.hasDefinition: A protein signature of the type used in the EMBASSY Signature package.
children.label: Domainatrix signature

children.hasDefinition: NULL hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.
children.label: HMMER NULL hidden Markov model

children.hasDefinition: A protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: Protein family signatures cover all domains in the matching proteins and span >80% of the protein length and with no adjacent protein domain signatures or protein region signatures.
children.label: Protein family signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein domain signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: Protein domain signatures identify structural or functional domains or other units with defined boundaries.
children.label: Protein domain signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein region signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein region signature defines a region which cannot be described as a protein family or domain signature.
children.label: Protein region signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein repeat signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein repeat signature is a repeated protein motif, that is not in single copy expected to independently fold into a globular domain.
children.label: Protein repeat signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein site signature is a classifier for a specific site in a protein.
children.label: Protein site signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein conserved site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein conserved site signature is any short sequence pattern that may contain one or more unique residues and is cannot be described as a active site, binding site or post-translational modification.
children.label: Protein conserved site signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein active site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein active site signature corresponds to an enzyme catalytic pocket. An active site typically includes non-contiguous residues, therefore multiple signatures may be required to describe an active site. ; residues involved in enzymatic reactions for which mutational data is typically available.
children.label: Protein active site signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein binding site signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein binding site signature corresponds to a site that reversibly binds chemical compounds, which are not themselves substrates of the enzymatic reaction. This includes enzyme cofactors and residues involved in electron transport or protein structure modification.
children.label: Protein binding site signature

children.hasDefinition: A protein post-translational modification signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.comment: A protein post-translational modification signature corresponds to sites that undergo modification of the primary structure, typically to activate or de-activate a function. For example, methylation, sumoylation, glycosylation etc. The modification might be permanent or reversible.
children.label: Protein post-translational modification signature

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment (multiple)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment (nucleic acid pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two protein sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment (protein pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences of different types.
children.label: Hybrid sequence alignment (pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Multiple nucleotide sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of more than two protein sequences.
children.label: Multiple protein sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Whether end gaps are scored or not.
children.label: Score end gaps control

children.hasDefinition: Controls the order of sequences in an output sequence alignment.
children.label: Aligned sequence order

children.hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Terminal gap penalty

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap opening penalty (integer)

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap opening penalty (float)

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap extension penalty (integer)

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap extension penalty (float)

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
children.label: Gap separation penalty (integer)

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
children.label: Gap separation penalty (float)

children.hasDefinition: Data on molecular sequence alignment quality (estimated accuracy).
children.label: Sequence alignment metadata (quality report)

children.hasDefinition: Data on character conservation in a molecular sequence alignment.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
children.label: Sequence alignment report (site conservation)

children.hasDefinition: Data on correlations between sites in a molecular sequence alignment, typically to identify possible covarying positions and predict contacts or structural constraints in protein structures.
children.label: Sequence alignment report (site correlation)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a Domainatrix signature (representing a sequence alignment).
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment (Domainatrix signature)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequence(s) to a hidden Markov model(s).
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment (HMM)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of molecular sequences to a protein fingerprint from the PRINTS database.
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment (fingerprint)

children.hasDefinition: A report of data concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used  for example for reports on confidence, shape or stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
children.label: Phylogenetic report

children.hasDefinition: Data about the shape of a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree shape)

children.hasDefinition: Data on the confidence of a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree evaluation)

children.hasDefinition: Molecular clock and stratigraphic (age) data derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree stratigraphic)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for sequence comparison.
children.label: Comparison matrix (integers)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for sequence comparison.
children.label: Comparison matrix (floats)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for nucleotide comparison.
children.label: Nucleotide comparison matrix (integers)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.
children.label: Nucleotide comparison matrix (floats)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer numbers for amino acid comparison.
children.label: Amino acid comparison matrix (integers)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.
children.label: Amino acid comparison matrix (floats)

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
children.label: Protein structure (all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
children.label: Protein chain (all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a polypeptide chain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
children.label: Protein chain (C-alpha atoms)

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (all atoms).
children.label: Protein domain (all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein domain tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
children.label: Protein domain (C-alpha atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (multiple)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (protein pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two protein tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
children.label: Structure alignment (protein all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be considered.
children.label: Structure alignment (protein C-alpha atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
children.label: Pairwise protein tertiary structure alignment (all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
children.label: Pairwise protein tertiary structure alignment (C-alpha atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (all atoms considered).
children.label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment (all atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two protein tertiary (3D) structures (typically C-alpha atoms only considered).
children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
children.label: Multiple protein tertiary structure alignment (C-alpha atoms)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (nucleic acid pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of more than two nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Multiple nucleic acid tertiary structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: DaliLite hit table of protein chain tertiary structure alignment data.
children.comment: The significant and top-scoring hits for regions of the compared structures is shown. Data such as Z-Scores, number of aligned residues, root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) of atoms and sequence identity are given.
children.label: DaliLite hit table

children.hasDefinition: A score reflecting structural similarities of two molecules.
children.label: Molecular similarity score

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific enzyme.
children.label: Enzyme report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific restriction enzyme such as enzyme reference data.
children.comment: This might include name of enzyme, organism, isoschizomers, methylation, source, suppliers, literature references, or data on restriction enzyme patterns such as name of enzyme, recognition site, length of pattern, number of cuts made by enzyme, details of blunt or sticky end cut etc.
children.label: Restriction enzyme report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein subcellular localisation (nuclear, cytoplasmic, mitochondrial, chloroplast, plastid, membrane etc) or destination (exported / extracellular proteins).
children.label: Protein subcellular localisation

children.hasDefinition: A report on the immunogenicity of MHC class I or class II binding peptides.
children.label: MHC peptide immunogenicity report

children.hasDefinition: Data on inter-atomic or inter-residue contacts, distances and interactions in protein structure(s) or on the interactions of protein atoms or residues with non-protein groups.
children.label: Protein non-covalent interactions report

children.hasDefinition: Informative report on flexibility or motion of a protein structure.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein flexibility or motion report

children.hasDefinition: Data on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein surface report

children.hasDefinition: Non-canonical atomic interactions in protein structures.
children.label: Protein non-canonical interactions

children.hasDefinition: Information on a node from the CATH database.
children.comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/cathnode/1.10.10.10) includes CATH code (of the node and upper levels in the hierarchy), classification text (of appropriate levels in hierarchy), list of child nodes, representative domain and other relevant data and links.
children.label: CATH node

children.hasDefinition: Information on a node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP node

children.hasDefinition: An EMBASSY domain classification file (DCF) of classification and other data for domains from SCOP or CATH, in EMBL-like format.
children.label: EMBASSY domain classification

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'class' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH class

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'architecture' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH architecture

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'topology' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH topology

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'homologous superfamily' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH homologous superfamily

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'structurally similar group' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH structurally similar group

children.hasDefinition: Information on a protein 'functional category' node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH functional category

children.hasDefinition: A report on known protein structural domains or folds that are recognised (identified) in protein sequence(s).
children.comment: Methods use some type of mapping between sequence and fold, for example secondary structure prediction and alignment, profile comparison, sequence properties, homologous sequence search, kernel machines etc. Domains and folds might be taken from SCOP or CATH.
children.label: Protein fold recognition report

children.hasDefinition: protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.
children.label: Protein-protein interaction report

children.hasDefinition: protein-DNA/RNA interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-nucleic acid interactions report

children.hasDefinition: Melting temperature of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid melting temperature

children.hasDefinition: Stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid stitch profile

children.hasDefinition: RNA parameters used by the Vienna package.
children.label: Vienna RNA parameters

children.hasDefinition: Structure constraints used by the Vienna package.
children.label: Vienna RNA structure constraints

children.hasDefinition: RNA concentration data used by the Vienna package.
children.label: Vienna RNA concentration data

children.hasDefinition: RNA calculated energy data generated by the Vienna package.
children.label: Vienna RNA calculated energy

children.hasDefinition: A simple measure of synonymous codon usage bias often used to predict gene expression levels.
children.label: Codon adaptation index

children.hasDefinition: The effective number of codons used in a gene sequence.  This reflects how far codon usage of a gene departs from equal usage of synonymous codons.
children.label: Nc statistic

children.hasDefinition: A report on linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).
children.label: Linkage disequilibrium (report)

children.hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about which probes belong to which probe set.
children.label: Affymetrix probe sets library file

children.hasDefinition: Affymetrix library file of information about the probe sets such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated.
children.label: Affymetrix probe sets information library file

children.hasDefinition: Standard protonated molecular masses from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides, used in EMBOSS.
children.label: Molecular weights standard fingerprint

children.hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a metabolic pathway.
children.comment: This includes carbohydrate, energy, lipid, nucleotide, amino acid, glycan, PK/NRP, cofactor/vitamin, secondary metabolite, xenobiotics etc.
children.label: Metabolic pathway report

children.hasDefinition: genetic information processing pathways.
children.label: Genetic information processing pathway report

children.hasDefinition: environmental information processing pathways.
children.label: Environmental information processing pathway report

children.hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a signal transduction pathway.
children.label: Signal transduction pathway report

children.hasDefinition: Topic concernning cellular process pathways.
children.label: Cellular process pathways report

children.hasDefinition: disease pathways, typically of human disease.
children.label: Disease pathway or network report

children.hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of drug structure relationships.
children.label: Drug structure relationship map

children.hasDefinition: networks of protein interactions.
children.label: Protein interaction networks

children.hasDefinition: An entry (data type) from the Minimal Information Requested in the Annotation of Biochemical Models (MIRIAM) database of data resources.
children.comment: A MIRIAM entry describes a MIRIAM data type including the official name, synonyms, root URI, identifier pattern (regular expression applied to a unique identifier of the data type) and documentation. Each data type can be associated with several resources. Each resource is a physical location of a service (typically a database) providing information on the elements of a data type. Several resources may exist for each data type, provided the same (mirrors) or different information. MIRIAM provides a stable and persistent reference to its data types.
children.label: MIRIAM datatype

children.hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) version, for example name, version number and release date.
children.label: Database version information

children.hasDefinition: Information on an application version, for example name, version number and release date.
children.label: Tool version information

children.hasDefinition: Information on a version of the CATH database.
children.label: CATH version information

children.hasDefinition: Cross-mapping of Swiss-Prot codes to PDB identifiers.
children.label: Swiss-Prot to PDB mapping

children.hasDefinition: Cross-references from a sequence record to other databases.
children.label: Sequence database cross-references

children.hasDefinition: Metadata on the status of a submitted job.
children.comment: Values for EBI services are 'DONE' (job has finished and the results can then be retrieved), 'ERROR' (the job failed or no results where found), 'NOT_FOUND' (the job id is no longer available; job results might be deleted, 'PENDING' (the job is in a queue waiting processing), 'RUNNING' (the job is currently being processed).
children.label: Job status

children.hasDefinition: The (typically numeric) unique identifier of a submitted job.
children.label: Job ID

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of job, for example interactive or non-interactive.
children.label: Job type

children.hasDefinition: A report of tool-specific metadata on some analysis or process performed, for example a log of diagnostic or error messages.
children.label: Tool log

children.hasDefinition: DaliLite log file describing all the steps taken by a DaliLite alignment of two protein structures.
children.label: DaliLite log file

children.hasDefinition: STRIDE log file.
children.label: STRIDE log file

children.hasDefinition: NACCESS log file.
children.label: NACCESS log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS wordfinder log file.
children.label: EMBOSS wordfinder log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) domainatrix application log file.
children.label: EMBOSS domainatrix log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) sites application log file.
children.label: EMBOSS sites log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS (EMBASSY) supermatcher error file.
children.label: EMBOSS supermatcher error file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS megamerger log file.
children.label: EMBOSS megamerger log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS megamerger log file.
children.label: EMBOSS whichdb log file

children.hasDefinition: EMBOSS vectorstrip log file.
children.label: EMBOSS vectorstrip log file

children.hasDefinition: Number of iterations of an algorithm.
children.label: Number of iterations

children.hasDefinition: Number of entities (for example database hits, sequences, alignments etc) to write to an output file.
children.label: Number of output entities

children.hasDefinition: Controls the order of hits (reported matches) in an output file from a database search.
children.label: Hit sort order

children.hasDefinition: A term from the BioPax ontology.
children.label: BioPax term

children.hasDefinition: A term definition from The Gene Ontology (GO).
children.label: GO

children.hasDefinition: A term from the MeSH vocabulary.
children.label: MeSH

children.hasDefinition: A term from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.
children.label: HGNC

children.hasDefinition: A term from the NCBI taxonomy vocabulary.
children.label: NCBI taxonomy vocabulary

children.hasDefinition: A term from the Plant Ontology (PO).
children.label: Plant ontology term

children.hasDefinition: A term from the UMLS vocabulary.
children.label: UMLS

children.hasDefinition: A term from Foundational Model of Anatomy.
children.comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
children.label: FMA

children.hasDefinition: A term from the EMAP mouse ontology.
children.label: EMAP

children.hasDefinition: A term from the ChEBI ontology.
children.label: ChEBI

children.hasDefinition: A term from the MGED ontology.
children.label: MGED

children.hasDefinition: A term from the myGrid ontology.
children.comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
children.label: myGrid

children.hasDefinition: A term definition for a biological process from the Gene Ontology (GO).
children.comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
children.label: GO (biological process)

children.hasDefinition: A term definition for a molecular function from the Gene Ontology (GO).
children.comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
children.label: GO (molecular function)

children.hasDefinition: A term definition for a cellular component from the Gene Ontology (GO).
children.comment: Data Type is an enumerated string.
children.label: GO (cellular component)

children.hasDefinition: A relation type defined in an ontology.
children.label: Ontology relation type

children.hasDefinition: A comment on a concept from an ontology.
children.label: Ontology concept comment

children.hasDefinition: Reference for a concept from an ontology.
children.label: Ontology concept reference

children.hasDefinition: Information on a published article provided by the doc2loc program.
children.comment: The doc2loc output includes the url, format, type and availability code of a document for every service provider.
children.label: doc2loc document information

children.hasDefinition: Cartesian x coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
children.label: Atomic x coordinate

children.hasDefinition: Cartesian y coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
children.label: Atomic y coordinate

children.hasDefinition: Cartesian z coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
children.label: Atomic z coordinate

children.hasDefinition: Summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.
children.comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.
children.label: CATH domain report

children.hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on ATOM records in PDB) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).
children.label: CATH representative domain sequences (ATOM)

children.hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database (based on COMBS sequence data) for CATH domains (clustered at different levels of sequence identity).
children.label: CATH representative domain sequences (COMBS)

children.hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on PDB ATOM records).
children.label: CATH domain sequences (ATOM)

children.hasDefinition: FASTA sequence database for all CATH domains (based on COMBS sequence data).
children.label: CATH domain sequences (COMBS)

children.hasDefinition: Report on general functional properties of specific protein(s).
children.comment: For properties that can be mapped to a sequence, use 'Sequence report' instead.
children.label: Protein report (function)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Aspergillus Genome Database.
children.label: Gene name (ASPGD)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Candida Genome Database.
children.label: Gene name (CGD)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from dictyBase database.
children.label: Gene name (dictyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Primary name of a gene from EcoGene Database.
children.label: Gene name (EcoGene primary)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from MaizeGDB (maize genes) database.
children.label: Gene name (MaizeGDB)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Saccharomyces Genome Database.
children.label: Gene name (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from Tetrahymena Genome Database.
children.label: Gene name (TGD)

children.hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from E.coli Genetic Stock Center.
children.label: Gene name (CGSC)

children.hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
children.label: Gene name (HGNC)

children.hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from the Mouse Genome Database.
children.label: Gene name (MGD)

children.hasDefinition: Symbol of a gene from Bacillus subtilis Genome Sequence Project.
children.label: Gene name (Bacillus subtilis)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Glossina morsitans GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB Glossina morsitans)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Leishmania major GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB Leishmania major)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Plasmodium falciparum GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB Plasmodium falciparum)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Schizosaccharomyces pombe GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB Schizosaccharomyces pombe)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Trypanosoma brucei GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB Trypanosoma brucei)

children.hasDefinition: Any name (other than the recommended one) for a gene.
children.label: Gene synonym

children.hasDefinition: A component of a larger sequence assembly.
children.label: Sequence assembly component

children.hasDefinition: A report on a chromosome aberration such as abnormalities in chromosome structure.
children.label: Chromosome annotation (aberration)

children.hasDefinition: Data describing a set of multiple genetic or physical maps, typically sharing a common set of features which are mapped.
children.label: Map set data

children.hasDefinition: A feature which may mapped (positioned) on a genetic or other type of map.
children.comment: Mappable features may be based on Gramene's notion of map features; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/feature_type_info.
children.label: Map feature

children.hasDefinition: A designation of the type of map (genetic map, physical map, sequence map etc) or map set.
children.comment: Map types may be based on Gramene's notion of a map type; see http://www.gramene.org/db/cmap/map_type_info.
children.label: Map type

children.hasDefinition: An alternative for a word.
children.label: Synonym

children.hasDefinition: A common misspelling of a word.
children.label: Misspelling

children.hasDefinition: An abbreviation of a phrase or word.
children.label: Acronym

children.hasDefinition: A term which is likely to be misleading of its meaning.
children.label: Misnomer

children.hasDefinition: A controlled vocabulary for words and phrases that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.
children.label: UniProt keywords

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Maize database.
children.label: Gene ID (MIPS Maize)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS Medicago database.
children.label: Gene ID (MIPS Medicago)

children.hasDefinition: The name of an Antirrhinum Gene from the DragonDB database.
children.label: Gene name (DragonDB)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an Arabidopsis gene, which is an acronym or abbreviation of the gene name.
children.label: Gene name (Arabidopsis)

children.hasDefinition: Name of a gene from the GeneFarm database.
children.label: Gene name (GeneFarm)

children.hasDefinition: A stretch of DNA that is closely linked to the genes underlying a quantitative trait (a phenotype that varies in degree and depends upon the interactions between multiple genes and their environment).
children.comment: A QTL sometimes but does not necessarily correspond to a gene.
children.label: Quantitative trait locus

children.hasDefinition: A name for a genetic locus conforming to a scheme that names loci (such as predicted genes) depending on their position in a molecular sequence, for example a completely sequenced genome or chromosome.
children.label: Ordered locus name

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information which (typically) is generated or collated by hand and which describes a biological entity, phenomena or associated primary (e.g. sequence or structural) data, as distinct from the primary data itself and computer-generated reports derived from it.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Annotation

children.hasDefinition: Data used by the Vienna RNA analysis package.
children.label: Vienna RNA structural data

children.hasDefinition: Data used to replace (mask) characters in a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence mask parameter

children.hasDefinition: Raw data from or annotation on laboratory experiments.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Experimental data

children.hasDefinition: Information on a genome version.
children.label: Genome version information

children.hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
children.label: Sequence record lite

children.hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence record (lite)

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence and minimal metadata, typically an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
children.label: Protein sequence record (lite)

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning molecular structural data.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Structural data

children.hasDefinition: Some simple value controlling a search operation, typically a search of a database.
children.label: Search parameter

children.hasDefinition: The secondary structure assignment (predicted or real) of a nucleic acid or protein.
children.label: Secondary structure

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of molecular alignment of some type.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Alignment data

children.hasDefinition: A report on nucleic acid structure-derived data, describing structural properties of a DNA molecule, or any other annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s).
children.label: Nucleic acid structure data

children.hasDefinition: Information on a database (or ontology) entry version, such as name (or other identifier) or parent database, unique identifier of entry, data, author and so on.
children.label: Database entry version information

children.hasDefinition: single nucleotide polymorphism (SNP) in a DNA sequence.
children.label: SNP

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing the type of a thing, typically an enumerated string (a string with one of a limited set of values).
children.label: Type

children.hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the KEGG GENES database.
children.label: Gene name (KEGG GENES)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a trinucleotide sequence that encodes an amino acid including the triplet sequence, the encoded amino acid or whether it is a start or stop codon.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (codon)

children.hasDefinition: Frame for translation of DNA (3 forward and 3 reverse frames relative to a chromosome).
children.label: Translation frame specification

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence profile such as frequency matrix, Gribskov profile, hidden Markov model etc.
children.label: Sequence profile type

children.hasDefinition: A type of point or block mutation, including insertion, deletion, change, duplication and moves.
children.label: Mutation type

children.hasDefinition: A control of the order of data that is output, for example the order of sequences in an alignment.
children.comment: Possible options including sorting by score, rank, by increasing P-value (probability, i.e. most statistically significant hits given first) and so on.
children.label: Results sort order

children.hasDefinition: A simple parameter that is a toggle (boolean value), typically a control for a modal tool.
children.label: Toggle

children.hasDefinition: The width of an output sequence or alignment.
children.label: Sequence width

children.hasDefinition: Size of the incremental 'step' a sequence window is moved over a sequence.
children.label: Window step size

children.hasDefinition: An image of a graph generated by the EMBOSS suite.
children.label: EMBOSS graph

children.hasDefinition: An application report generated by the EMBOSS suite.
children.label: EMBOSS report

children.hasDefinition: An offset for a single-point sequence position.
children.label: Sequence offset

children.hasDefinition: A value that serves as a threshold for a tool (usually to control scoring or output).
children.label: Threshold

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a transcription factor protein.
children.comment: This might include conformational or physicochemical properties, as well as sequence information for transcription factor(s) binding sites.
children.label: Protein report (transcription factor)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a category of biological or bioinformatics database.
children.label: Database category name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a sequence profile.
children.label: Sequence profile name

children.hasDefinition: Specification of one or more colors.
children.label: Color

children.hasDefinition: A parameter that is used to control rendering (drawing) to a device or image.
children.label: Rendering parameter

children.hasDefinition: A temporal date.
children.label: Date

children.hasDefinition: Word composition data for a molecular sequence.
children.label: Word composition

children.hasDefinition: A plot of general physicochemical properties of a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein sequence properties plot

children.hasDefinition: A report on siRNA duplexes in mRNA.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (siRNA)

children.hasDefinition: A collection of multiple molecular sequences and (typically) associated metadata that is intended for sequential processing.
children.comment: This concept may be used for sequence sets that are expected to be read and processed a single sequence at a time.
children.label: Sequence set (stream)

children.hasDefinition: The number of a certain thing.
children.label: Cardinality

children.hasDefinition: A single thing.
children.label: Exactly 1

children.hasDefinition: One or more things.
children.label: 1 or more

children.hasDefinition: Exactly two things.
children.label: Exactly 2

children.hasDefinition: Two or more things.
children.label: 2 or more

children.hasDefinition: chemical modification of a protein.
children.label: Protein features report (chemical modifications)

children.hasDefinition: Data on an error generated by computer system or tool.
children.label: Error

children.hasDefinition: A cluster of similar genes.
children.label: Gene cluster

children.hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Sequence record full

children.hasDefinition: Information describing the mutation itself, the organ site, tissue and type of lesion where the mutation has been identified, description of the patient origin and life-style.
children.label: Mutation annotation (basic)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on the prevalence of mutation(s), including data on samples and mutation prevalence (e.g. by tumour type)..
children.label: Mutation annotation (prevalence)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on mutation prognostic data, such as information on patient cohort, the study settings and the results of the study.
children.label: Mutation annotation (prognostic)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on the functional properties of mutant proteins including transcriptional activities, promotion of cell growth and tumorigenicity, dominant negative effects, capacity to induce apoptosis, cell-cycle arrest or checkpoints in human cells and so on.
children.label: Mutation annotation (functional)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.
children.label: Tumor annotation

children.hasDefinition: Basic information about a server on the web, such as an SRS server.
children.label: Server metadata

children.hasDefinition: Raw SCOP domain classification data files.
children.comment: These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.
children.label: Raw SCOP domain classification

children.hasDefinition: Raw CATH domain classification data files.
children.comment: These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.
children.label: Raw CATH domain classification

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on the types of small molecules or 'heterogens' (non-protein groups) that are represented in PDB files.
children.label: Heterogen annotation

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic property values data.
children.label: Phylogenetic property values

children.hasDefinition: A collection of sequences output from a bootstrapping (resampling) procedure.
children.comment: Bootstrapping is often performed in phylogenetic analysis.
children.label: Sequence set (bootstrapped)

children.hasDefinition: A consensus phylogenetic tree derived from comparison of multiple trees.
children.label: Phylogenetic consensus tree

children.hasDefinition: A data schema for organising or transforming data of some type.
children.label: Schema

children.hasDefinition: A DTD (document type definition).
children.label: DTD

children.hasDefinition: An XML Schema.
children.label: XML Schema

children.hasDefinition: A relax-NG schema.
children.label: Relax-NG schema

children.hasDefinition: An XSLT stylesheet.
children.label: XSLT stylesheet

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of protein sequence(s) or protein sequence database entries.
children.label: Sequence identifier (protein)

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of nucleotide sequence(s) or nucleotide sequence database entries.
children.label: Sequence identifier (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the AceView genes database.
children.label: Gene name (AceView)

children.hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the NCBI genes database.
children.label: Gene name (NCBI)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific virus.
children.label: Virus annotation

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on the taxonomy of a specific virus.
children.label: Virus annotation (taxonomy)

children.hasDefinition: Phase for translation of DNA (0, 1 or 2) relative to a fragment of the coding sequence.
children.label: Translation phase specification

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of protein family signature (sequence classifier) from the InterPro database.
children.label: Protein signature type

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-DNA/RNA interaction(s).
children.label: Domain-nucleic acid interaction report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).
children.label: Domain-domain interactions

children.hasDefinition: Data on indirect protein domain-protein domain interaction(s).
children.label: Domain-domain interaction (indirect)

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning two-dimensional polygel electrophoresis.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: 2D PAGE data

children.hasDefinition: two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.
children.label: 2D PAGE report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on individual spot(s) from a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.
children.label: 2D PAGE spot report

children.hasDefinition: Data on the interaction of a protein (or protein domain) with specific structural (3D) and/or sequence motifs.
children.label: Protein-motif interaction

children.hasDefinition: Report of genotype experiment including case control, population, and family studies. These might use array based methods and re-sequencing methods.
children.label: Experiment report (genotyping)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus.
children.label: Fungi annotation

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific fungus anamorph.
children.label: Fungi annotation (anamorph)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific toxin.
children.label: Toxin annotation

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a membrane protein.
children.label: Protein report (membrane protein)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on tentative or known protein-drug interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-drug interaction report

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a map of molecular sequence(s).
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Map data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more protein molecules.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Protein data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more nucleic acid molecules.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Nucleic acid data

children.hasDefinition: Typically a simple numerical or string value that controls the operation of a tool.
children.label: Parameter

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific type of molecule.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Molecular data

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific molecule.
children.label: Molecule report

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning an alignment of two or more molecular sequences, structures or derived data.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  This includes entities derived from sequences and structures such as motifs and profiles.
children.label: Alignment data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning an index of data.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Data index data

children.hasDefinition: A simple summary of expressed genes.
children.label: Expressed gene list

children.hasDefinition: The name of a concept from the GO ontology.
children.label: GO concept name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a cellular component from the GO ontology.
children.label: GO concept name (cellular component)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of biological hierarchies.
children.label: Hierarchy identifier

children.hasDefinition: A type (represented as a string) of cancer.
children.label: Cancer type

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein secondary structure alignment-derived data or metadata.
children.label: Secondary structure alignment metadata

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on the physical, chemical or other information concerning the interaction of two or more molecules (or parts of molecules).
children.label: Molecule interaction report

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning one or more small molecules.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Small molecule data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a particular genotype, phenotype or a genotype / phenotype relation.
children.label: Genotype and phenotype data

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a report of molecular interactions from a database (typically).
children.label: Molecular interaction ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database (Homo sapiens division).
children.label: Ensembl ID (Homo sapiens)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Bos taurus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Bos taurus')

children.label: Ensembl ID ('Canis familiaris')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Cavia porcellus' division).

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Ciona intestinalis' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Ciona intestinalis')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Ciona savignyi' division).
