children.label: Ensembl ID ('Dasypus novemcinctus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Echinops telfairi' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Echinops telfairi')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Erinaceus europaeus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Erinaceus europaeus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Felis catus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Felis catus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Gallus gallus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Gallus gallus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Gasterosteus aculeatus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Gasterosteus aculeatus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Homo sapiens' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Homo sapiens')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Loxodonta africana' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Loxodonta africana')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Macaca mulatta' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Macaca mulatta')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Monodelphis domestica' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Monodelphis domestica')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Mus musculus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Mus musculus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Myotis lucifugus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Myotis lucifugus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Ornithorhynchus anatinus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ("Ornithorhynchus anatinus")

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Oryctolagus cuniculus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Oryctolagus cuniculus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Oryzias latipes' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Oryzias latipes')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Otolemur garnettii' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Otolemur garnettii')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Pan troglodytes' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Pan troglodytes')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Rattus norvegicus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Rattus norvegicus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Spermophilus tridecemlineatus' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Spermophilus tridecemlineatus')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Takifugu rubripes' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Takifugu rubripes')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Tupaia belangeri' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Tupaia belangeri')

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl 'core' database ('Xenopus tropicalis' division).
children.label: Ensembl ID ('Xenopus tropicalis')

children.hasDefinition: disordered structure in a protein.
children.label: Protein features report (disordered structure)

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on an embryo or concerning embryological development.
children.label: Embryo report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on one or more small molecules that are enzyme inhibitors.
children.label: Inhibitor annotation

children.hasDefinition: The name of a genus of viruses.
children.label: Genus name (virus)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a family of viruses.
children.label: Family name (virus)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a SwissRegulon database.
children.label: Database name (SwissRegulon)

children.hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the Genolist genes database.
children.label: Gene name (Genolist)

children.hasDefinition: Name of an entry (gene) from the HUGO database.
children.label: Gene name (HUGO)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a subdivision of the Collagen Mutation Database (CMD) database.
children.label: Database name (CMD)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a subdivision of the Osteogenesis database.
children.label: Database name (Osteogenesis)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a particular locus.
children.label: Locus annotation

children.hasDefinition: One or more terms from one or more controlled vocabularies which are annotations on an entity.
children.comment: The concepts are typically provided as a persistent identifier or some other link the source ontologies. Evidence of the validity of the annotation might be included.
children.label: Term ID list

children.hasDefinition: Basic information concerning an identifier of data (typically including the identifier itself).  For example, a gene symbol with information concerning its provenance.
children.label: Identifier with metadata

children.hasDefinition: Annotation about a gene symbol.
children.label: Gene symbol annotation

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of a sequence profile, such as its name, length, technical details about the profile or it's construction, the biological role or annotation, and so on.
children.label: Sequence profile data

children.hasDefinition: A flat-file (textual) data archive.
children.label: Databank

children.hasDefinition: A web site providing data (web pages) on a common theme to a HTTP client.
children.label: Web portal

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a proteomics experiment.
children.label: Experimental data (proteomics)

children.hasDefinition: Bibliographic data concerning scientific article(s).
children.label: Article metadata

children.hasDefinition: Northern Blot experiments.
children.label: Northern blot report

children.hasDefinition: A set of sub-sequences displaying some type of polymorphism, typically indicating the sequence in which they occur, their position and other metadata.
children.label: Sequence set (polymorphic)

children.hasDefinition: An entry (resource) from the DRCAT bioinformatics resource catalogue.
children.label: DRCAT resource

children.hasDefinition: Image of one or more molecular secondary structures.
children.label: Secondary structure image

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on general information, properties or features of one or more molecular secondary structures.
children.label: Secondary structure report

children.hasDefinition: DNA sequence-specific feature annotation (not in a feature table).
children.label: DNA features

children.hasDefinition: Features concerning RNA or regions of DNA that encode an RNA molecule.
children.label: RNA features report

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Protein sequence record (full)

children.hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and comprehensive metadata (such as a feature table), typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence record (full)

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of molecular sequence(s).
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Sequence data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning codon usage.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Codon usage

children.hasDefinition: Data derived from the analysis of a scientific text such as a full text article from a scientific journal.
children.label: Article report

children.hasDefinition: A melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid melting curve

children.hasDefinition: A probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid probability profile

children.hasDefinition: A temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid temperature profile

children.hasDefinition: A report typically including a map (diagram) of a gene regulatory network.
children.label: Gene regulatory network report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a two-dimensional (2D PAGE) gel.
children.label: 2D PAGE gel report

children.hasDefinition: General annotation on a set of oligonucleotide probes, such as the gene name with which the probe set is associated and which probes belong to the set.
children.label: Oligonucleotide probe sets annotation

children.hasDefinition: An image from a microarray experiment which (typically) allows a visualisation of probe hybridisation and gene-expression data.
children.label: Microarray image

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a computational workflow.
children.label: Workflow data

children.hasDefinition: A computational workflow.
children.label: Workflow

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning molecular secondary structure data.
children.label: Secondary structure data

children.hasDefinition: A raw protein sequence (string of characters).
children.label: Protein sequence (raw)

children.hasDefinition: A raw nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence (raw)

children.hasDefinition: An informative report concerning the classification of protein sequences or structures.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Protein classification

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Sequence motif data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning models representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Sequence profile data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a specific biological pathway or network.
children.label: Pathway or network data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Nucleic acid classification

children.hasDefinition: A report on a classification of molecular sequences, structures or other entities.
children.comment: This can include an entire classification, components such as classifiers, assignments of entities to a classification and so on.
children.label: Classification report

children.hasDefinition: key residues involved in protein folding.
children.label: Protein features report (key folding sites)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a biological process from the GO ontology.
children.label: GO concept name (biological process)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a concept for a molecular function from the GO ontology.
children.label: GO concept name (molecular function)

children.hasDefinition: A type of data that (typically) corresponds to entries from the primary biological databases and which is (typically) the primary input or output of a tool, i.e. the data the tool processes or generates, as distinct from metadata and identifiers which describe and identify such core data, parameters that control the behaviour of tools, reports of derivative data generated by tools and annotation.
children.comment: Core data entities typically have a format and may be identified by an accession number.
children.label: Core data

children.hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of protein sequence(s).
children.label: Protein sequence composition

children.hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of nucleic acid sequence(s).
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence composition (report)

children.hasDefinition: A node from a classification of protein structural domain(s).
children.label: Protein domain classification node

children.hasDefinition: Unique numerical identifier of chemicals in the scientific literature, as assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service.
children.label: CAS number

children.hasDefinition: Basic information concerning geographical location or time.
children.label: Geotemporal metadata

children.hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user.
children.label: Sequence feature name

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on laboratory and/or data processing protocols used in an microarray experiment.
children.comment: This might describe e.g. the normalisation methods used to process the raw data.
children.label: Microarray protocol annotation

children.hasDefinition: A report of regions in a molecular sequence that are biased to certain characters.
children.label: Sequence features (compositionally-biased regions)

children.hasDefinition: A report on features in a nucleic acid sequence that indicate changes to or differences between sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (difference and change)

children.hasDefinition: short repetitive subsequences (repeat sequences) in a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein features report (repeats)

children.hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more protein sequences.
children.label: Sequence motif matches (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches to profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) or other signatures in one or more nucleic acid sequences.
children.label: Sequence motif matches (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: A report on displacement loops in a mitochondrial DNA sequence.
children.comment: A displacement loop is a region of mitochondrial DNA in which one of the strands is displaced by an RNA molecule.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (d-loop)

children.hasDefinition: A report on stem loops in a DNA sequence.
children.comment: A stem loop is a hairpin structure; a double-helical structure formed when two complementary regions of a single strand of RNA or DNA molecule form base-pairs.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (stem loop)

children.hasDefinition: features of non-coding or functional RNA molecules, including tRNA and rRNA.
children.label: Non-coding RNA

children.hasDefinition: Features concerning transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.
children.comment: This includes promoters, CAAT signals, TATA signals, -35 signals, -10 signals, GC signals, primer binding sites for initiation of transcription or reverse transcription, enhancer, attenuator, terminators and ribosome binding sites.
children.label: Transcriptional features (report)

children.hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual immunoglobulin gene structure including constant, switch and variable regions and diversity, joining and variable segments.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (immunoglobulin gene structure)

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'class' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP class

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'fold' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP fold

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'superfamily' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP superfamily

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'family' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP family

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'protein' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP protein

children.hasDefinition: Information on a 'species' node from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP species

children.hasDefinition: mass spectrometry experiments.
children.label: Mass spectrometry experiment

children.hasDefinition: An alignment of protein sequences and/or structures.
children.label: Protein alignment

children.hasDefinition: sequencing experiment, including samples, sampling, preparation, sequencing, and analysis.
children.label: NGS experiment

children.hasDefinition: Report concerning genome-wide association study experiments.
children.label: GWAS report

children.hasDefinition: A label (text token) describing a type of sequence feature such as gene, transcript, cds, exon, repeat, simple, misc, variation, somatic variation, structural variation, somatic structural variation, constrained or regulatory.
children.label: Sequence feature type

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on gene homologues between species.
children.label: Gene homology (report)

children.hasDefinition: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.
children.label: Hidden Markov model

children.hasDefinition: Report concerning proteomics experiments.
children.label: Proteomics experiment report

children.hasDefinition: RNAi experiments.
children.label: RNAi report

children.hasDefinition: biological computational model experiments (simulation), for example the minimum information required in order to permit its correct interpretation and reproduction.
children.label: Simulation experiment report

children.hasDefinition: A sketch of a small molecule made with some specialised drawing package.
children.comment: Chemical structure sketches are used for presentational purposes but also as inputs to various analysis software.
children.label: Chemical structure sketch

children.hasDefinition: A raw RNA sequence.
children.label: RNA sequence (raw)

children.hasDefinition: A raw DNA sequence.
children.label: DNA sequence (raw)

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from UniGene.
children.comment: A UniGene entry includes a set of transcript sequences assigned to the same transcription locus (gene or expressed pseudogene), with information on protein similarities, gene expression, cDNA clone reagents, and genomic location.
children.label: UniGene entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the COG database of clusters of (related) protein sequences.
children.label: COG sequence cluster format

children.hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic property data.
children.label: Phylogenetic property values format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores used by the EMBOSS Domainatrix applications.
children.label: Domainatrix 3D-1D scoring matrix format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from IntEnz (The Integrated Relational Enzyme Database).
children.comment: IntEnz is the master copy of the Enzyme Nomenclature, the recommendations of the NC-IUBMB on the Nomenclature and Classification of Enzyme-Catalysed Reactions.
children.label: IntEnz enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the BRENDA enzyme database.
children.label: BRENDA enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG REACTION database of biochemical reactions.
children.label: KEGG REACTION enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG ENZYME database.
children.label: KEGG ENZYME enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the proto section of the REBASE enzyme database.
children.label: REBASE proto enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the withrefm section of the REBASE enzyme database.
children.label: REBASE withrefm enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of SMART domain assignment data.
children.comment: The SMART output file includes data on genetically mobile domains / analysis of domain architectures, including phyletic distributions, functional class, tertiary structures and functionally important residues.
children.label: SMART domain assignment report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the BIND database of protein interaction.
children.label: BIND entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the IntAct database of protein interaction.
children.label: IntAct entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the InterPro database of protein signatures (sequence classifiers) and classified sequences.
children.comment: This includes signature metadata, sequence references and a reference to the signature itself. There is normally a header (entry accession numbers and name), abstract, taxonomy information, example proteins etc. Each entry also includes a match list which give a number of different views of the signature matches for the sequences in each InterPro entry.
children.label: InterPro entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the textual abstract of signatures in an InterPro entry and its protein matches.
children.comment: References are included and a functional inference is made where possible.
children.label: InterPro entry abstract format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the Gene3D protein secondary database.
children.label: Gene3D entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the PIRSF protein secondary database.
children.label: PIRSF entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the PRINTS protein secondary database.
children.label: PRINTS entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the Panther library of protein families and subfamilies.
children.label: Panther Families and HMMs entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the Pfam protein secondary database.
children.label: Pfam entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the SMART protein secondary database.
children.label: SMART entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the Superfamily protein secondary database.
children.label: Superfamily entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the TIGRFam protein secondary database.
children.label: TIGRFam entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the ProDom protein domain classification database.
children.label: ProDom entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the FSSP database.
children.label: FSSP entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of Ensembl genome database.
children.label: Ensembl gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of DictyBase genome database.
children.label: DictyBase gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of Candida Genome database.
children.label: CGD gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of DragonDB genome database.
children.label: DragonDB gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of EcoCyc genome database.
children.label: EcoCyc gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of FlyBase genome database.
children.label: FlyBase gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of Gramene genome database.
children.label: Gramene gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of KEGG GENES genome database.
children.label: KEGG GENES gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Maize genetics and genomics database (MaizeGDB).
children.label: MaizeGDB gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Mouse Genome Database (MGD).
children.label: MGD gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Rat Genome Database (RGD).
children.label: RGD gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Saccharomyces Genome Database (SGD).
children.label: SGD gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Sanger GeneDB genome database.
children.label: GeneDB gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of The Arabidopsis Information Resource (TAIR) genome database.
children.label: TAIR gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the WormBase genomes database.
children.label: WormBase gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the Zebrafish Information Network (ZFIN) genome database.
children.label: ZFIN gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the TIGR genome database.
children.label: TIGR gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the dbSNP database.
children.label: dbSNP polymorphism report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the OMIM database of genotypes and phenotypes.
children.label: OMIM entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a record from the HGVbase database of genotypes and phenotypes.
children.label: HGVbase entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a record from the HIVDB database of genotypes and phenotypes.
children.label: HIVDB entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the KEGG DISEASE database.
children.label: KEGG DISEASE entry format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the ArrayExpress microarrays database.
children.label: ArrayExpress entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the Electron Microscopy DataBase (EMDB).
children.label: EMDB entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG PATHWAY database of pathway maps for molecular interactions and reaction networks.
children.label: KEGG PATHWAY entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the MetaCyc metabolic pathways database.
children.label: MetaCyc entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of a report from the HumanCyc metabolic pathways database.
children.label: HumanCyc entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the INOH signal transduction pathways database.
children.label: INOH entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the PATIKA biological pathways database.
children.label: PATIKA entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the reactome biological pathways database.
children.label: Reactome entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the aMAZE biological pathways and molecular interactions database.
children.label: aMAZE entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the CPDB database.
children.label: CPDB entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the Panther Pathways database.
children.label: Panther Pathways entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of mathematical models from the BioModel database.
children.comment: Models are annotated and linked to relevant data resources, such as publications, databases of compounds and pathways, controlled vocabularies, etc.
children.label: BioModel mathematical model format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG LIGAND chemical database.
children.label: KEGG LIGAND entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG COMPOUND database.
children.label: KEGG COMPOUND entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG PLANT database.
children.label: KEGG PLANT entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG GLYCAN database.
children.label: KEGG GLYCAN entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from PubChem.
children.label: PubChem entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from a database of chemical structures and property predictions.
children.label: ChemSpider entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from Chemical Entities of Biological Interest (ChEBI).
children.comment: ChEBI includes an ontological classification defining relations between entities or classes of entities.
children.label: ChEBI entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the MSDchem ligand dictionary.
children.label: MSDchem ligand dictionary entry format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the KEGG DRUG database.
children.label: KEGG DRUG entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an ATOM record (describing data for an individual atom) from a PDB file.
children.label: PDB atom record format

children.hasDefinition: Format of CATH domain classification information for a polypeptide chain.
children.comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/chain/1cukA) includes chain identifiers, domain identifiers and CATH codes for domains in a given protein chain.
children.label: CATH chain report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of CATH domain classification information for a protein PDB file.
children.comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/pdb/1cuk) includes chain identifiers, domain identifiers and CATH codes for domains in a given PDB file.
children.label: CATH PDB report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry (gene) format of the NCBI database.
children.label: NCBI gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for biological functions associated with a gene name and its alternative names (synonyms, homonyms), as generated by the GeneIlluminator service.
children.comment: This includes a gene name and abbreviation of the name which may be in a name space indicating the gene status and relevant organisation.
children.label: GeneIlluminator gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on the DNA and protein sequences for a given gene label from a bacterial chromosome maps from the BacMap database.
children.label: BacMap gene card format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on Escherichia coli genes, proteins and molecules from the CyberCell Database (CCDB).
children.label: ColiCard report format

children.hasDefinition: Data format for an individual atom.
children.label: Atomic data format

children.hasDefinition: Clustalw output format.
children.label: clustal sequence format

children.hasDefinition: Phylip interleaved sequence format.
children.label: phylip sequence format

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP non-interleaved sequence format.
children.label: phylipnon sequence format

children.hasDefinition: Selex sequence format.
children.label: selex sequence format

children.hasDefinition: Treecon output sequence format.
children.label: treecon sequence format

children.hasDefinition: Mega non-interleaved output sequence format.
children.label: meganon sequence format

children.hasDefinition: PIR feature format.
children.label: pir

children.hasDefinition: Swiss-Prot feature format.
children.label: swiss feature

children.hasDefinition: EMBL feature format.
children.label: EMBL feature

children.hasDefinition: Genbank feature format.
children.label: GenBank feature

children.hasDefinition: MSF format for (aligned) sequences.
children.label: msf alignment format

children.hasDefinition: Nexus/paup format for (aligned) sequences.
children.label: nexus alignment format

children.hasDefinition: Nexus/paup non-interleaved format for (aligned) sequences.
children.label: nexusnon alignment format

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a sequence-HMM profile alignment.
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment (HMM) format

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a biological model.
children.label: Biological model format

children.hasDefinition: Annotation format for electron microscopy models.
children.label: Electron microscopy model format

children.hasDefinition: Format for sequence polymorphism data.
children.label: Polymorphism report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on genotype / phenotype information.
children.label: Genotype and phenotype annotation format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific enzyme.
children.label: Protein report (enzyme) format

children.hasDefinition: Format used for report on coding regions in nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Gene features (coding region) format

children.hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of genes.
children.label: Gene cluster format

children.hasDefinition: UniProt entry sequence format.
children.label: UniProt format

children.hasDefinition: ipi sequence format.
children.label: ipi

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular sequence record, typically corresponding to a full entry from a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Sequence record full format

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular sequence record 'lite', typically molecular sequence and minimal metadata, such as an identifier of the sequence and/or a comment.
children.label: Sequence record lite format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on organism strain data / cell line.
children.label: Strain data format

children.hasDefinition: Format for a report of strain data as used for CIP database entries.
children.label: CIP strain data format

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for phylogenetic property data.
children.label: phylip property values

children.hasDefinition: Entry format (HTML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.
children.label: STRING entry format (HTML)

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the BioCyc enzyme database.
children.label: BioCyc enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the Enzyme nomenclature database (ENZYME).
children.label: ENZYME enzyme report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on a gene from the PseudoCAP database.
children.label: PseudoCAP gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on a gene from the GeneCards database.
children.label: GeneCards gene report format

children.hasDefinition: Typical textual representation of a URI.
children.label: URI format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the NCI-Nature pathways database.
children.label: NCI-Nature pathway entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on protein features (domain composition).
children.label: Protein features (domains) format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format for the STRING database of protein interaction.
children.label: STRING entry format

children.hasDefinition: Text format (representation) of amino acid residues.
children.label: Amino acid identifier format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a file of gene expression data, e.g. a gene expression matrix or profile.
children.label: Gene expression data format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a data index of some type.
children.label: Index format

children.hasDefinition: Search database to retrieve all relevant references to a particular entity or entry.
children.label: Data retrieval (database cross-reference)

children.hasDefinition: Analyse an index of biological data.
children.label: Data index analysis

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve basic information about a molecular sequence.
children.label: Annotation retrieval (sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Analyse the sequence, conformational or physicochemical properties of transcription regulatory elements in DNA sequences.
children.comment: For example transcription factor binding sites (TFBS) analysis to predict accessibility of DNA to binding factors.
children.label: Transcription regulatory sequence analysis

children.hasDefinition: Identify common, conserved (homologous) or synonymous transcriptional regulatory motifs (transcription factor binding sites).
children.label: Conserved transcription regulatory sequence identification

children.hasDefinition: Extract, calculate or predict non-positional (physical or chemical) properties of a protein from processing a protein (3D) structure.
children.label: Protein property calculation (from structure)

children.hasDefinition: Extract a sequence feature table from a sequence database entry.
children.label: Data retrieval (feature table)

children.hasDefinition: Query the features (in a feature table) of molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Feature table query

children.hasDefinition: Display basic information about a sequence alignment.
children.label: Data retrieval (sequence alignment)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) physicochemical property data of nucleic acids.
children.label: Nucleic acid property processing

children.hasDefinition: Predict tertiary structure of a molecular (biopolymer) sequence.
children.label: Structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: Analyse experimental protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.
children.label: Protein interaction raw data analysis

children.hasDefinition: Identify or predict protein-protein interactions, interfaces, binding sites etc in protein sequences.
children.label: Protein-protein interaction prediction (from protein sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Identify or predict protein-protein interactions, interfaces, binding sites etc in protein structures.
children.label: Protein-protein interaction prediction (from protein structure)

children.hasDefinition: Compare two or more biological pathways or networks.
children.label: Pathway or network comparison

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on restriction enzymes or restriction enzyme sites.
children.label: Data retrieval (restriction enzyme annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Identify genetic markers in DNA sequences.
children.comment: A genetic marker is any DNA sequence of known chromosomal location that is associated with and specific to a particular gene or trait. This includes short sequences surrounding a SNP, Sequence-Tagged Sites (STS) which are well suited for PCR amplification, a longer minisatellites sequence etc.
children.label: Genetic marker identification

children.hasDefinition: Align two or more molecular sequences of different types (for example genomic DNA to EST, cDNA or mRNA).
children.label: Hybrid sequence alignment construction

children.hasDefinition: Align sequence profiles (representing sequence alignments).
children.label: Profile-profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Align structural (3D) profiles or templates (representing structures or structure alignments).
children.label: 3D profile-to-3D profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Align molecular sequence(s) to structural (3D) profile(s) or template(s) (representing a structure or structure alignment).
children.label: Sequence-to-3D-profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Search for and retrieve data concerning or describing some core data, as distinct from the primary data that is being described.
children.comment: This includes documentation, general information and other metadata on entities such as databases, database entries and tools.
children.label: Metadata retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Standardize or normalize microarray data.
children.label: Microarray data standardisation and normalisation

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) SAGE, MPSS or SBS experimental data.
children.label: Sequencing-based expression profile data processing

children.hasDefinition: Interpret (in functional terms) and annotate gene expression data.
children.label: Functional profiling

children.hasDefinition: Analyse EST or cDNA sequences.
children.comment: For example, identify full-length cDNAs from EST sequences or detect potential EST antisense transcripts.
children.label: EST and cDNA sequence analysis

children.hasDefinition: Identify and select targets for protein structural determination.
children.comment: Methods will typically navigate a graph of protein families of known structure.
children.label: Structural genomics target selection

children.hasDefinition: Simulate the folding of a protein.
children.label: Protein folding simulation

children.hasDefinition: Predict the folding pathway(s) or non-native structural intermediates of a protein.
children.label: Protein folding pathway prediction

children.hasDefinition: Map and model the effects of single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs) on protein structure(s).
children.label: Protein SNP mapping

children.hasDefinition: Design molecules that elicit an immune response (immunogens).
children.label: Immunogen design

children.hasDefinition: Predict and optimise zinc finger protein domains for DNA/RNA binding (for example for transcription factors and nucleases).
children.label: Zinc finger prediction

children.hasDefinition: Search a secondary protein database (of classification information) to assign a protein sequence(s) to a known protein family or group.
children.label: Protein secondary database search

children.hasDefinition: Screen a sequence against a motif or pattern database.
children.label: Motif database search

children.hasDefinition: Search a database of sequence profiles with a query sequence.
children.label: Sequence profile database search

children.hasDefinition: Search a database of transmembrane proteins, for example for sequence or structural similarities.
children.label: Transmembrane protein database search

children.hasDefinition: Query a database and retrieve sequences with a given entry code or accession number.
children.label: Sequence retrieval (by code)

children.hasDefinition: Query a database and retrieve sequences containing a given keyword.
children.label: Sequence retrieval (by keyword)

children.hasDefinition: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences matching a given sequence motif or pattern, such as a Prosite pattern or regular expression.
children.label: Sequence database search (by motif or pattern)

children.hasDefinition: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences of a given amino acid composition.
children.label: Sequence database search (by amino acid composition)

children.hasDefinition: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences that are similar to a query sequence using a word-based method.
children.comment: Word-based methods (for example BLAST, gapped BLAST, MEGABLAST, WU-BLAST etc.) are usually quicker than alignment-based methods. They may or may not handle gaps.
children.label: Sequence database search (by sequence using word-based methods)

children.hasDefinition: Search a sequence database and retrieve sequences that are similar to a query sequence using a sequence profile-based method, or with a supplied profile as query.
children.comment: This includes tools based on PSI-BLAST.
children.label: Sequence database search (by sequence using profile-based methods)

children.hasDefinition: Search a sequence database for sequences that are similar to a query sequence using a local alignment-based method.
children.comment: This includes tools based on the Smith-Waterman algorithm or FASTA.
children.label: Sequence database search (by sequence using local alignment-based methods)

children.hasDefinition: Search sequence(s) or a sequence database for sequences that are similar to a query sequence using a global alignment-based method.
children.comment: This includes tools based on the Needleman and Wunsch algorithm.
children.label: Sequence database search (by sequence using global alignment-based methods)

children.hasDefinition: Search a DNA database (for example a database of conserved sequence tags) for matches to Sequence-Tagged Site (STS) primer sequences.
children.comment: STSs are genetic markers that are easily detected by the polymerase chain reaction (PCR) using specific primers.
children.label: Sequence database search (by sequence for primer sequences)

children.hasDefinition: Search sequence(s) or a sequence database for sequences which match a set of peptide masses, for example a peptide mass fingerprint from mass spectrometry.
children.label: Sequence database search (by molecular weight)

children.hasDefinition: Search sequence(s) or a sequence database for sequences of a given isoelectric point.
children.label: Sequence database search (by isoelectric point)

children.hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure database and retrieve entries with a given entry code or accession number.
children.label: Structure retrieval (by code)

children.hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure database and retrieve entries containing a given keyword.
children.label: Structure retrieval (by keyword)

children.hasDefinition: Search a tertiary structure database and retrieve structures with a sequence similar to a query sequence.
children.label: Structure database search (by sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate base frequency or word composition of a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Sequence composition calculation (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate amino acid frequency or word composition of a protein sequence.
children.label: Sequence composition calculation (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Analyse the hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of a protein structure.
children.label: Protein hydropathy calculation (from structure)

children.hasDefinition: Identify clusters of hydrophobic or charged residues in a protein structure.
children.label: Protein hydropathy cluster calculation

children.hasDefinition: Identify or predict catalytic residues, active sites or other ligand-binding sites in protein structures.
children.label: Protein binding site prediction (from structure)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate non-canonical atomic interactions in protein structures.
children.label: Residue non-canonical interaction detection

children.hasDefinition: Validate a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.
children.label: Ramachandran plot validation

children.hasDefinition: Hydropathy calculation on a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein hydropathy calculation (from sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Detect or predict signal peptides (and typically predict subcellular localisation) of eukaryotic proteins.
children.label: Protein signal peptide detection (eukaryotes)

children.hasDefinition: Detect or predict signal peptides (and typically predict subcellular localisation) of bacterial proteins.
children.label: Protein signal peptide detection (bacteria)

children.hasDefinition: Predict MHC class I or class II binding peptides, promiscuous binding peptides, immunogenicity etc.
children.label: MHC peptide immunogenicity prediction

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in protein sequences such as functional sites or regions and secondary structure.
children.comment: Methods typically involve scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.
children.label: Protein feature prediction (from sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Predict catalytic residues, active sites or other ligand-binding sites in protein sequences.
children.label: Protein binding site prediction (from sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Predict protein sites that are key to protein folding, such as possible sites of nucleation or stabilisation.
children.label: Protein folding site prediction

children.hasDefinition: Predict epitopes that bind to MHC class I molecules.
children.label: Epitope mapping (MHC Class I)

children.hasDefinition: Predict epitopes that bind to MHC class II molecules.
children.label: Epitope mapping (MHC Class II)

children.hasDefinition: Detect, predict and identify whole gene structure in DNA sequences. This includes protein coding regions, exon-intron structure, regulatory regions etc.
children.label: Whole gene prediction

children.hasDefinition: Detect, predict and identify genetic elements such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites, etc in DNA sequences.
children.comment: Methods for gene prediction might be ab initio, based on phylogenetic comparisons, use motifs, sequence features, support vector machine, alignment etc.
children.label: Gene component prediction

children.hasDefinition: Predict whole gene structure using a combination of multiple methods to achieve better predictions.
children.label: Integrated gene prediction

children.hasDefinition: Identify, predict or analyse cis-regulatory elements (for example riboswitches) in RNA sequences.
children.label: Transcriptional regulatory element prediction (RNA-cis)

children.hasDefinition: Predict nucleosome formation potential of DNA sequences.
children.label: Nucleosome formation potential prediction

children.hasDefinition: Predict secondary structure of protein sequence(s) using multiple methods to achieve better predictions.
children.label: Protein secondary structure prediction (integrated)

children.hasDefinition: Predict G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR).
children.label: GPCR prediction

children.hasDefinition: Analyse G-protein coupled receptor proteins (GPCRs).
children.label: GPCR analysis

children.hasDefinition: Map the genetic architecture of dynamic complex traits.
children.comment: This can involve characterisation of the underlying quantitative trait loci (QTLs) or nucleotides (QTNs).
children.label: Functional mapping

children.hasDefinition: Locally align exactly two molecular sequences.
children.comment: Local alignment methods identify regions of local similarity.
children.label: Pairwise sequence alignment generation (local)

children.hasDefinition: Globally align exactly two molecular sequences.
children.comment: Global alignment methods identify similarity across the entire length of the sequences.
children.label: Pairwise sequence alignment generation (global)

children.hasDefinition: Align two or more molecular sequences with user-defined constraints.
children.label: Constrained sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Align two or more molecular sequences using multiple methods to achieve higher quality.
children.label: Consensus-based sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Align molecular secondary structure (represented as a 1D string).
children.label: Secondary structure alignment generation

children.hasDefinition: Align protein secondary structures.
children.label: Protein secondary structure alignment generation

children.hasDefinition: Align protein tertiary structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Align RNA tertiary structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (RNA)

children.hasDefinition: Locally align (superimpose) exactly two molecular tertiary structures.
children.comment: Local alignment methods identify regions of local similarity, common substructures etc.
children.label: Pairwise structure alignment generation (local)

children.hasDefinition: Globally align (superimpose) exactly two molecular tertiary structures.
children.comment: Global alignment methods identify similarity across the entire structures.
children.label: Pairwise structure alignment generation (global)

children.hasDefinition: Align exactly two molecular profiles.
children.comment: Methods might perform one-to-one, one-to-many or many-to-many comparisons.
children.label: Profile-profile alignment (pairwise)

children.hasDefinition: Align two or more molecular profiles.
children.label: Sequence alignment generation (multiple profile)

children.hasDefinition: Align exactly two molecular Structural (3D) profiles.
children.label: 3D profile-to-3D profile alignment (pairwise)

children.hasDefinition: Align two or more molecular 3D profiles.
children.label: Structural profile alignment generation (multiple)

children.hasDefinition: Search and retrieve names of or documentation on bioinformatics tools, for example by keyword or which perform a particular function.
children.label: Data retrieval (tool metadata)

children.hasDefinition: Search and retrieve names of or documentation on bioinformatics databases or query terms, for example by keyword.
children.label: Data retrieval (database metadata)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers for large scale sequencing.
children.label: PCR primer design (for large scale sequencing)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers for genotyping polymorphisms, for example single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNPs).
children.label: PCR primer design (for genotyping polymorphisms)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers for gene transcription profiling.
children.label: PCR primer design (for gene transcription profiling)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers that are conserved across multiple genomes or species.
children.label: PCR primer design (for conserved primers)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers based on gene structure.
children.label: PCR primer design (based on gene structure)

children.hasDefinition: Predict primers for methylation PCRs.
children.label: PCR primer design (for methylation PCRs)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE) data.
children.label: SAGE data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) data.
children.label: MPSS data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) sequencing by synthesis (SBS) data.
children.label: SBS data processing

children.hasDefinition: Analyse one or more gene expression profiles, typically to interpret them in functional terms.
children.label: Gene expression profile analysis

children.hasDefinition: Assign secondary structure from protein coordinate data.
children.label: Protein secondary structure assignment (from coordinate data)

children.hasDefinition: Assign secondary structure from circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.
children.label: Protein secondary structure assignment (from CD data)

children.hasDefinition: Assign a protein tertiary structure (3D coordinates) from raw X-ray crystallography data.
children.label: Protein structure assignment (from X-ray crystallographic data)

children.hasDefinition: Assign a protein tertiary structure (3D coordinates) from raw NMR spectroscopy data.
children.label: Protein structure assignment (from NMR data)

children.hasDefinition: Predict and optimise peptide ligands that elicit an immunological response.
children.label: Immunogenicity prediction

children.hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Sequence formatting

children.hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) molecular sequence alignment(s).
children.label: Sequence alignment formatting

children.hasDefinition: Reformat a codon usage table.
children.label: Codon usage table formatting

children.hasDefinition: Visualise, format or print a molecular sequence alignment.
children.label: Sequence alignment visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Visualise RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.
children.label: RNA secondary structure visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Render and visualise protein secondary structure.
children.label: Protein secondary structure visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Identify and analyse networks of protein interactions.
children.label: Protein interaction network visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Render a sequence with motifs.
children.label: Sequence motif rendering

children.hasDefinition: Draw a linear maps of DNA.
children.label: DNA linear map rendering

children.hasDefinition: Identify folding families of related RNAs.
children.label: Nucleic acid folding family identification

children.hasDefinition: Compute energies of nucleic acid folding, e.g. minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences or energy landscape of RNA mutants.
children.label: Nucleic acid folding energy calculation

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve existing annotation (or documentation), typically annotation on a database entity.
children.comment: Use this concepts for tools which retrieve pre-existing annotations, not for example prediction methods that might make annotations.
children.label: Annotation retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Submit a molecular sequence to a database.
children.label: Sequence submission

children.hasDefinition: Query a sequence data resource (typically a database) and retrieve sequences and / or annotation.
children.comment: This includes direct retrieval methods (e.g. the dbfetch program) but not those that perform calculations on the sequence.
children.label: Sequence retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure data resource (typically a database) and retrieve structures, structure-related data and annotation.
children.comment: This includes direct retrieval methods but not those that perform calculations on the sequence or structure.
children.label: Structure retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for each atom in a structure.
children.comment: Waters are not considered.
children.label: Protein atom surface calculation (accessible)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for each atom in a structure.
children.comment: Waters are not considered.
children.label: Protein atom surface calculation (accessible molecular)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for each residue in a structure.
children.comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
children.label: Protein residue surface calculation (accessible)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('vacuum accessible surface') for each residue in a structure. This is the accessibility of the residue when taken out of the protein together with the backbone atoms of any residue it is covalently bound to.
children.comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
children.label: Protein residue surface calculation (vacuum accessible)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for each residue in a structure.
children.comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
children.label: Protein residue surface calculation (accessible molecular)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('vacuum molecular surface') for each residue in a structure. This is the accessibility of the residue when taken out of the protein together with the backbone atoms of any residue it is covalently bound to.
children.comment: Solvent accessibility might be calculated for the backbone, sidechain and total (backbone plus sidechain).
children.label: Protein residue surface calculation (vacuum molecular)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible molecular surface') for a structure as a whole.
children.label: Protein surface calculation (accessible molecular)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility ('accessible surface') for a structure as a whole.
children.label: Protein surface calculation (accessible)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate for each residue in a protein structure all its backbone torsion angles.
children.label: Backbone torsion angle calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate for each residue in a protein structure all its torsion angles.
children.label: Full torsion angle calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate for each cysteine (bridge) all its torsion angles.
children.label: Cysteine torsion angle calculation

children.hasDefinition: For each amino acid in a protein structure calculate the backbone angle tau.
children.comment: Tau is the backbone angle N-Calpha-C (angle over the C-alpha).
children.label: Tau angle calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate protein residue contacts with nucleic acids in a structure.
children.label: Residue contact calculation (residue-nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate ion contacts in a structure (all ions for all side chain atoms).
children.label: Residue contact calculation (residue-negative ion)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the number of symmetry contacts made by residues in a protein structure.
children.comment: A symmetry contact is a contact between two atoms in different asymmetric unit.
children.label: Residue symmetry contact calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate contacts between residues and ligands in a protein structure.
children.label: Residue contact calculation (residue-ligand)

children.hasDefinition: Predict rotamer likelihoods for all 20 amino acid types at each position in a protein structure.
children.comment: Output typically includes, for each residue position, the likelihoods for the 20 amino acid types with estimated reliability of the 20 likelihoods.
children.label: Rotamer likelihood prediction

children.hasDefinition: Calculate for each position in a protein structure the chance that a proline, when introduced at this position, would increase the stability of the whole protein.
children.label: Proline mutation value calculation

children.hasDefinition: Extract a molecular sequence from a PDB file.
children.label: PDB file sequence retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Identify HET groups in PDB files.
children.comment: A HET group usually corresponds to ligands, lipids, but might also (not consistently) include groups that are attached to amino acids. Each HET group is supposed to have a unique three letter code and a unique name which might be given in the output.
children.label: HET group detection

children.hasDefinition: Determine for residue the DSSP determined secondary structure in three-state (HSC).
children.label: DSSP secondary structure assignment

children.hasDefinition: Reformat (a file or other report of) tertiary structure data.
children.label: Structure formatting

children.hasDefinition: Identify poor quality amino acid positions in protein structures.
children.label: Residue validation

children.hasDefinition: Query a tertiary structure database and retrieve water molecules.
children.label: Structure retrieval (water)

children.hasDefinition: Process an EMBOSS listfile (list of EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Addresses).
children.label: Listfile processing

children.hasDefinition: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a sequence alignment file, such as copying or removal and ordering of sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment file processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) physicochemical property data for small molecules.
children.label: Small molecule data processing

children.hasDefinition: Search and retrieve documentation on a bioinformatics ontology.
children.label: Data retrieval (ontology annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Query an ontology and retrieve concepts or relations.
children.label: Data retrieval (ontology concept)

children.hasDefinition: Perform basic (non-analytical) operations on a file of molecular tertiary structural data.
children.label: Structure file processing

children.hasDefinition: Query a profile data resource and retrieve one or more profile(s) and / or associated annotation.
children.comment: This includes direct retrieval methods that retrieve a profile by, e.g. the profile name.
children.label: Data retrieval (sequence profile)

children.hasDefinition: An operation performing purely illustrative (pedagogical) purposes.
children.label: Demonstration

children.hasDefinition: Query a biological pathways database and retrieve annotation on one or more pathways.
children.label: Data retrieval (pathway or network)

children.hasDefinition: Query a database and retrieve one or more data identifiers.
children.label: Data retrieval (identifier)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein interaction data.
children.label: Protein interaction data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) annotation of some type, typically annotation on an entry from a biological or biomedical database entity.
children.label: Annotation processing

children.hasDefinition: Analyse features in molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence feature analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse gene expression and regulation data.
children.label: Gene expression analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) one or more structural (3D) profile(s) or template(s) of some type.
children.label: Structural profile processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) an index of (typically a file of) biological data.
children.label: Data index processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) some type of sequence profile.
children.label: Sequence profile processing

children.hasDefinition: Analyse protein function, typically by processing protein sequence and/or structural data, and generate an informative report.
children.label: Protein function analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) data on the physicochemical property of a molecule.
children.label: Physicochemical property data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) data of a specific type, for example applying analytical methods.
children.label: Operation (typed)

children.hasDefinition: Perform basic operations on some data or a database.
children.label: Data handling

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) microarray data.
children.label: Microarray data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a codon usage table.
children.label: Codon usage table processing

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve a codon usage table and / or associated annotation.
children.label: Data retrieval (codon usage table)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a gene expression profile.
children.label: Gene expression profile processing

children.hasDefinition: Generate, analyse or handle a biological pathway or network.
children.label: Pathway or network processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) RNA tertiary structure data.
children.label: Structure processing (RNA)

children.hasDefinition: Generate, process or analyse phylogenetic tree or trees.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein secondary structure data.
children.label: Protein secondary structure processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a network of protein interactions.
children.label: Protein interaction network processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) one or more molecular sequences and associated annotation.

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a protein sequence and associated annotation.

children.label: GPCR classification

children.hasDefinition: Predict G-protein coupled receptor (GPCR) coupling selectivity.
children.label: GPCR coupling selectivity prediction

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a protein tertiary structure.
children.label: Structure processing (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility for each atom in a structure.
children.comment: Waters are not considered.
children.label: Protein atom surface calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility for each residue in a structure.
children.label: Protein residue surface calculation

children.hasDefinition: Calculate the solvent accessibility of a structure as a whole.
children.label: Protein surface calculation

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular sequence alignment.
children.label: Sequence alignment processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular tertiary structure.
children.label: Structure processing

children.hasDefinition: Annotate a DNA map of some type with terms from a controlled vocabulary.
