children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a protein.
children.label: Data retrieval (protein annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve a phylogenetic tree from a data resource.
children.label: Data retrieval (phylogenetic tree)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a protein interaction.
children.label: Data retrieval (protein interaction annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a protein family.
children.label: Data retrieval (protein family annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on an RNA family.
children.label: Data retrieval (RNA family annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a specific gene.
children.label: Data retrieval (gene annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Retrieve information on a specific genotype or phenotype.
children.label: Data retrieval (genotype and phenotype annotation)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular secondary structure.
children.label: Secondary structure processing

children.hasDefinition: Calculate contacts between residues in a protein structure.
children.label: Residue contact calculation (residue-residue)

children.hasDefinition: Identify potential hydrogen bonds between amino acid residues.
children.label: Hydrogen bond calculation (inter-residue)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) codon usage data.
children.label: Codon usage data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a network of gene regulation.
children.label: Gene regulatory network processing

children.hasDefinition: Generate, process or analyse a biological pathway or network.
children.label: Pathway or network analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse SAGE, MPSS or SBS experimental data, typically to identify or quantify mRNA transcripts.
children.label: Sequencing-based expression profile data analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse raw microarray data.
children.label: Microarray raw data analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) nucleic acid sequence or structural data.
children.label: Nucleic acid analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) protein sequence or structural data.
children.label: Protein analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular sequence data.
children.label: Sequence data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular structural data.
children.label: Structural data processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) text.
children.label: Text processing

children.hasDefinition: Analyse a protein sequence alignment, typically to detect features or make predictions.
children.label: Protein sequence alignment analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse a protein sequence alignment, typically to detect features or make predictions.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence alignment analysis

children.hasDefinition: Compare two or more nucleic acid sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence comparison

children.hasDefinition: Compare two or more protein sequences.
children.label: Protein sequence comparison

children.hasDefinition: Edit or change a nucleic acid sequence, either randomly or specifically.
children.label: Sequence editing (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Edit or change a protein sequence, either randomly or specifically.
children.label: Sequence editing (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Generate a nucleic acid sequence by some means.
children.label: Sequence generation (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Generate a protein sequence by some means.
children.label: Sequence generation (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a nucleic acid sequence.
children.comment: Various nucleic acid sequence analysis methods might generate a sequence rendering but are not (for brevity) listed under here.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Visualise, format or render a protein sequence.
children.comment: Various protein sequence analysis methods might generate a sequence rendering but are not (for brevity) listed under here.
children.label: Protein sequence visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) nucleic acid tertiary structure data.
children.comment: http://edamontology.org/operation_2481
children.label: Structure processing (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a DNA map of some type.
children.label: Map data processing

children.hasDefinition: Compare two or more molecular secondary structures.
children.label: Secondary structure comparison

children.hasDefinition: Generate a Hopp and Woods plot of antigenicity of a protein.
children.label: Hopp and Woods plotting

children.hasDefinition: Generate a view of clustered quantitative data, annotated with textual information.
children.label: Cluster textual view generation

children.hasDefinition: Generate a dendrograph of raw, preprocessed or clustered expression (e.g. microarray) data.
children.label: Dendrograph plotting

children.hasDefinition: Visualise gene expression data where each band (or line graph) corresponds to a sample.
children.label: Whole microarray graph plotting

children.hasDefinition: Process or analyse an alignment of molecular sequences or structures.
children.label: Alignment analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse a body of scientific text (typically a full text article from a scientific journal.)
children.label: Article analysis

children.hasDefinition: Analyse the interactions of two or more molecules (or parts of molecules) that are known to interact.
children.label: Molecular interaction analysis

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) an alignment of two or more molecular sequences, structures or derived data.
children.label: Alignment processing

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) a molecular tertiary (3D) structure alignment.
children.label: Structure alignment processing

children.hasDefinition: Generate a codon usage bias plot.
children.label: Codon usage bias plotting

children.hasDefinition: Process (read and / or write) molecular interaction data.
children.label: Molecular interaction data processing

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of proteins.
children.label: Prediction and recognition (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise, detect or identify some properties of nucleic acids.
children.label: Prediction and recognition (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Render (visualise) a biological pathway or network.
children.label: Pathway or network visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Predict general (non-positional) functional properties of a protein from analysing its sequence.
children.comment: For functional properties that are positional, use 'Protein site detection' instead.
children.label: Protein function prediction (from sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify functional or other key sites within protein sequences, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.
children.label: Protein sequence feature detection

children.hasDefinition: Calculate (or predict) physical or chemical properties of a protein, including any non-positional properties of the molecular sequence, from processing a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein property calculation (from sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify positional features in proteins from analysing protein structure.
children.label: Protein feature prediction (from structure)

children.hasDefinition: Screen a molecular sequence(s) against a database (of some type) to identify similarities between the sequence and database entries.
children.label: Database search (by sequence)

children.hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove misleading ends.
children.comment: For example trim polyA tails, introns and primer sequence flanking the sequence of amplified exons, or other unwanted sequence.
children.label: Trim ends

children.hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove sequence-specific end regions, typically contamination from vector sequences.
children.label: Trim vector

children.hasDefinition: Trim sequences (typically from an automated DNA sequencer) to remove the sequence ends that extend beyond an assembled reference sequence.
children.label: Trim to reference

children.hasDefinition: Identify single nucleotide change in base positions in sequencing data that differ from a reference genome and which might, especially by reference to population frequency or functional data, indicate a polymorphism.
children.label: SNP calling

children.hasDefinition: Detect mutations in multiple DNA sequences, for example, from the alignment and comparison of the fluorescent traces produced by DNA sequencing hardware.
children.label: Polymorphism detection

children.hasDefinition: Determine cytosine methylation status of specific positions in a nucleic acid sequences.
children.label: Methylation calling

children.hasDefinition: Generate an index of a genome sequence using the Burrows-Wheeler algorithm.
children.comment: The Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) is a permutation of the genome based on a suffix array algorithm.
children.label: Genome indexing (Burrows-Wheeler)

children.hasDefinition: Generate an index of a genome sequence using a suffix arrays algorithm.
children.comment: A suffix array consists of the lexicographically sorted list of suffixes of a genome.
children.label: Genome indexing (suffix arrays)

children.hasDefinition: Analyse gene expression patterns (typically from DNA microarray datasets) to identify sets of genes that are associated with a specific trait, condition, clinical outcome etc.
children.label: Gene set testing

children.hasDefinition: Infer a transcriptome sequence without the aid of a reference genome, i.e. by comparing short sequences (reads) to each other.
children.label: Transcriptome assembly (de novo)

children.hasDefinition: Infer a transcriptome sequence by mapping short reads to a reference genome.
children.label: Transcriptome assembly (mapping)

children.hasDefinition: Search for and retrieve a data identifier of some kind, e.g. a database entry accession.
children.label: ID retrieval

children.hasDefinition: Compare two or more ontologies, e.g. identify differences.
children.label: Ontology comparison

children.hasDefinition: Predict, recognise and identify functional or other key sites within nucleic acid sequences, typically by scanning for known motifs, patterns and regular expressions.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence feature detection

children.hasDefinition: Construct some entity (typically a molecule sequence) from component pieces.
children.label: Assembly

children.hasDefinition: Predict a molecular pathway or network.
children.label: Pathway or network prediction

children.hasDefinition: The process of assembling many short DNA sequences together such thay they represent the original chromosomes from which the DNA originated.
children.label: Genome assembly

children.hasDefinition: Generate a graph, or other visual representation, of data, showing the relationship between two or more variables.
children.label: Plotting

children.hasDefinition: Predict RNA secondary structure by analysis, e.g. probabilistic analysis, of the shape of RNA folds.
children.label: RNA secondary structure prediction (shape-based)

children.hasDefinition: Prediction of nucleic-acid folding using sequence alignments as a source of data.
children.label: Nucleic acid folding prediction (alignment-based)

children.hasDefinition: Model some biological system using mathematical techniques including  dynamical systems, statistical models, differential equations, and game theoretic models.
children.label: Mathematical modelling

children.hasDefinition: Simulate the bevaviour of a biological pathway or network.
children.comment: Notions of pathway and network were mixed up, EDAM 1.24 disentangles them.
children.label: Network simulation

children.hasDefinition: Statistical estimation of false discovery rate from score distribution for peptide-spectrum-matches, following a peptide database search.
children.label: Validation of peptide-spectrum matches

children.hasDefinition: The analysis, using any of diverse techniques, to identify genes that are differentially expressed under a given experimental setup.
children.label: Differential gene expression analysis

children.hasDefinition: The structures of reactants or products of metabolism, for example small molecules such as including vitamins, polyols, nucleotides and amino acids.
children.label: Metabolites

children.hasDefinition: The alignment (equivalence between sites) of molecular sequences, structures or profiles (representing a sequence or structure alignment).
children.label: Alignment

children.hasDefinition: The search and query of data sources (typically databases or ontologies) in order to retrieve entries or other information.
children.label: Information retrieval

children.hasDefinition: The study of the thermodynamic properties of a nucleic acid.
children.label: Nucleic acid thermodynamics

children.hasDefinition: Topic for the study of restriction enzymes, their cleavage sites and the restriction of nucleic acids.
children.label: Nucleic acid restriction

children.hasDefinition: The study of codon usage in nucleotide sequence(s), genetic codes and so on.
children.label: Genetic codes and codon usage

children.hasDefinition: Methods that aims to identify, predict, model or analyse genes or gene structure in DNA sequences.
children.comment: This includes the study of promoters, coding regions, splice sites, etc. Methods for gene prediction might be ab initio, based on phylogenetic comparisons, use motifs, sequence features, support vector machine, alignment etc.
children.label: Gene finding

children.hasDefinition: The transcription of DNA into mRNA.
children.label: Transcription

children.hasDefinition: Promoters in DNA sequences (region of DNA that facilitates the transcription of a particular gene by binding RNA polymerase and transcription factor proteins).
children.label: Promoters

children.hasDefinition: The folding (in 3D space) of nucleic acid molecules.
children.label: Nucleic acid folding

children.hasDefinition: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis image and related data.
children.label: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis

children.hasDefinition: An analytical chemistry technique that measures the mass-to-charge ratio and abundance of ions in the gas phase.
children.label: Mass spectrometry

children.hasDefinition: Protein microarray data.
children.label: Protein microarrays

children.hasDefinition: The study of the hydrophobic, hydrophilic and charge properties of a protein.
children.label: Protein hydropathy

children.hasDefinition: Enzyme or chemical cleavage sites and proteolytic or mass calculations on a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein cleavage sites and proteolysis

children.hasDefinition: The comparison of two or more protein structures.
children.comment: Use this concept for methods that are exclusively for protein structure.
children.label: Protein structure comparison

children.hasDefinition: The processing and analysis of inter-atomic or inter-residue interactions in protein (3D) structures.
children.label: Protein residue interactions

children.hasDefinition: Protein-protein interactions, individual interactions and networks, protein complexes, protein functional coupling etc.
children.label: Protein-protein interactions

children.hasDefinition: Protein-ligand (small molecule) interactions.
children.label: Protein-ligand interactions

children.hasDefinition: Protein-DNA/RNA interactions.
children.label: Protein-nucleic acid interactions

children.hasDefinition: The design of proteins with specific properties, typically by designing changes (via site-directed mutagenesis) to an existing protein.
children.label: Protein design

children.hasDefinition: G-protein coupled receptors (GPCRs).
children.label: G protein-coupled receptors (GPCR)

children.hasDefinition: Edit, convert or otherwise change a molecular sequence, either randomly or specifically.
children.label: Sequence editing

children.hasDefinition: Conserved patterns (motifs) in molecular sequences, that (typically) describe functional or other key sites.
children.label: Sequence motifs

children.hasDefinition: The comparison of two or more molecular sequences, for example sequence alignment and clustering.
children.comment: The comparison might be on the basis of sequence, physico-chemical or some other properties of the sequences.
children.label: Sequence comparison

children.hasDefinition: Search and retrieve molecular sequences that are similar to a sequence-based query (typically a simple sequence).
children.comment: The query is a sequence-based entity such as another sequence, a motif or profile.
children.label: Sequence database search

children.hasDefinition: The comparison and grouping together of molecular sequences on the basis of their similarities.
children.comment: This includes systems that generate, process and analyse sequence clusters.
children.label: Sequence clustering

children.hasDefinition: The processing, analysis or use of some type of structural (3D) profile or template; a computational entity (typically a numerical matrix) that is derived from and represents a structure or structure alignment.
children.label: Structural (3D) profiles

children.hasDefinition: The prediction, modelling, recognition or design of protein secondary or tertiary structure or other structural features.
children.label: Protein structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: The folding of nucleic acid molecules and the prediction or design of nucleic acid (typically RNA) sequences with specific conformations.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: The prediction of three-dimensional structure of a (typically protein) sequence from first principles, using a physics-based or empirical scoring function and without using explicit structural templates.
children.label: Ab initio structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: The modelling of the three-dimensional structure of a protein using known sequence and structural data.
children.label: Homology modelling

children.hasDefinition: The modelling the structure of proteins in complex with small molecules or other macromolecules.
children.label: Molecular docking

children.hasDefinition: The prediction of secondary or supersecondary structure of protein sequences.
children.label: Protein secondary structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: The prediction of tertiary structure of protein sequences.
children.label: Protein tertiary structure prediction

children.hasDefinition: The recognition (prediction and assignment) of known protein structural domains or folds in protein sequence(s).
children.label: Protein fold recognition

children.hasDefinition: The alignment of molecular sequences or sequence profiles (representing sequence alignments).
children.comment: This includes the generation of alignments (the identification of equivalent sites), the analysis of alignments, editing, visualisation, alignment databases, the alignment (equivalence between sites) of sequence profiles (representing sequence alignments) and so on.
children.label: Sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: The superimposition of molecular tertiary structures or structural (3D) profiles (representing a structure or structure alignment).
children.comment: This includes the generation, storage, analysis, rendering etc. of structure alignments.
children.label: Structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: The alignment of molecular sequences to structures, structural (3D) profiles or templates (representing a structure or structure alignment).
children.label: Threading

children.hasDefinition: Sequence profiles; typically a positional, numerical matrix representing a sequence alignment.
children.comment: Sequence profiles include position-specific scoring matrix (position weight matrix), hidden Markov models etc.
children.label: Sequence profiles and HMMs

children.hasDefinition: The reconstruction of a phylogeny (evolutionary relatedness amongst organisms), for example, by building a phylogenetic tree.
children.comment: Currently too specific for the topic sub-ontology (but might be unobsoleted).
children.label: Phylogeny reconstruction

children.hasDefinition: Simulated polymerase chain reaction (PCR).
children.label: Virtual PCR

children.hasDefinition: Microarrays, for example, to process microarray data or design probes and experiments.
children.label: Microarrays

children.hasDefinition: Information on a specific fish genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.label: Fish

children.hasDefinition: Information on a specific fly genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.label: Flies

children.hasDefinition: Information on a specific mouse or rat genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a group of mice / rats or all mice / rats.
children.label: Mice or rats

children.hasDefinition: Information on a specific worm genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.label: Worms

children.hasDefinition: The processing and analysis of the bioinformatics literature and bibliographic data, such as literature search and query.
children.label: Literature analysis

children.hasDefinition: The management and manipulation of digital documents, including database records, files and reports.
children.label: Document, record and content management

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence annotation

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of a genome.
children.label: Genome annotation

children.hasDefinition: The classification of molecular sequences based on some measure of their similarity.
children.comment: Methods including sequence motifs, profile and other diagnostic elements which (typically) represent conserved patterns (of residues or properties) in molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence classification

children.hasDefinition: primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc.
children.label: Protein classification

children.hasDefinition: Sequence motifs, or sequence profiles derived from an alignment of molecular sequences of a particular type.
children.comment: This includes comparison, discovery, recognition etc. of sequence motifs.
children.label: Sequence motif or profile

children.hasDefinition: Data resources for the biological or biomedical literature, either a primary source of literature or some derivative.
children.label: Literature data resources

children.hasDefinition: General cell culture or data on a specific cell lines.
children.label: Cell and tissue culture

children.hasDefinition: The cell cycle including key genes and proteins.
children.label: Cell cycle

children.hasDefinition: The physicochemical, biochemical or structural properties of amino acids or peptides.
children.label: Peptides and amino acids

children.hasDefinition: A specific organelle, or organelles in general, typically the genes and proteins (or genome and proteome).
children.label: Organelles

children.hasDefinition: Ribosomes, typically of ribosome-related genes and proteins.
children.label: Ribosomes

children.hasDefinition: A database about scents.
children.label: Scents

children.hasDefinition: The structures of drugs, drug target, their interactions and binding affinities.
children.label: Drugs and target structures

children.hasDefinition: Study of chromosomes.
children.label: Chromosomes

children.hasDefinition: Gene expression e.g. microarray data, northern blots, gene-indexed expression profiles etc.
children.label: Gene expression and microarray

children.hasDefinition: A particular protein, protein family or other group of proteins.
children.label: Specific protein resources

children.hasDefinition: Archival, processing and analysis of protein sequences and sequence-based entities such as alignments, motifs and profiles.
children.label: Protein sequence analysis

children.hasDefinition: The archival, processing and analysis of nucleotide sequences and and sequence-based entities such as alignments, motifs and profiles.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence analysis

children.hasDefinition: The repetitive nature of molecular sequences.
children.label: Repeat sequences

children.hasDefinition: The (character) complexity of molecular sequences, particularly regions of low complexity.
children.label: Low complexity sequences

children.hasDefinition: A specific proteome including protein sequences and annotation.
children.label: Proteome

children.hasDefinition: Protein-coding regions including coding sequences (CDS), exons, translation initiation sites and open reading frames
children.label: Coding RNA

children.hasDefinition: One or more ribosomal RNA (rRNA) sequences.
children.label: rRNA

children.hasDefinition: One or more transfer RNA (tRNA) sequences.
children.label: tRNA

children.hasDefinition: Protein secondary structure or secondary structure alignments.
children.comment: This includes assignment, analysis, comparison, prediction, rendering etc. of secondary structure data.
children.label: Protein secondary structure

children.hasDefinition: RNA secondary or tertiary structure and alignments.
children.label: RNA structure

children.hasDefinition: Protein tertiary structures.
children.label: Protein tertiary structure

children.hasDefinition: Classification of nucleic acid sequences and structures.
children.label: Nucleic acid classification

children.hasDefinition: Primarily the classification of proteins (from sequence or structural data) into clusters, groups, families etc., curation of a particular protein or protein family, or any other proteins that have been classified as members of a common group.
children.label: Protein families

children.hasDefinition: Nucleotide sequence alignments.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Protein sequence alignments.
children.comment: A sequence profile typically represents a sequence alignment.
children.label: Protein sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: The archival, detection, prediction and analysis ofpositional features such as functional sites in nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid sites and features

children.hasDefinition: The detection, identification and analysis of positional features in proteins, such as functional sites.
children.label: Protein sites and features

children.hasDefinition: Protein phosphorylation and phosphorylation sites in protein sequences.
children.label: Phosphorylation sites

children.hasDefinition: Metabolic pathways.
children.label: Metabolic pathways

children.hasDefinition: Signaling pathways.
children.label: Signaling pathways

children.hasDefinition: Protein and peptide identification
children.label: Protein and peptide identification

children.hasDefinition: Structuring data into basic types and (computational) objects.
children.label: Data types and objects

children.hasDefinition: Theoretical biology
children.label: Theoretical biology

children.hasDefinition: Mitochondria, typically of mitochondrial genes and proteins.
children.label: Mitochondria

children.hasDefinition: Fungi and molds, e.g. information on a specific fungal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a fungus, a group of fungi or all fungi.
children.label: Fungi

children.hasDefinition: Pathogens, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a pathogen, a group of pathogens or all pathogens.
children.label: Pathogens

children.hasDefinition: Arabidopsis-specific data.
children.label: Arabidopsis

children.hasDefinition: Rice-specific data.
children.label: Rice

children.hasDefinition: Informatics resources that aim to identify, map or analyse genetic markers in DNA sequences, for example to produce a genetic (linkage) map of a chromosome or genome or to analyse genetic linkage and synteny.
children.label: Genetic mapping and linkage

children.hasDefinition: Human diseases, typically describing the genes, mutations and proteins implicated in disease.
children.label: Human disease

children.hasDefinition: PCR primers and hybridisation oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Primers

children.hasDefinition: Regions or sites in a eukaryotic and eukaryotic viral RNA sequence which directs endonuclease cleavage or polyadenylation of an RNA transcript.
children.label: PolyA signal or sites

children.hasDefinition: CpG rich regions (isochores) in a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: CpG island and isochores

children.hasDefinition: Restriction enzyme recognition sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Restriction sites

children.hasDefinition: Splice sites in a nucleotide sequence or alternative RNA splicing events.
children.label: Splice sites

children.hasDefinition: Matrix/scaffold attachment regions (MARs/SARs) in a DNA sequence.
children.label: Matrix/scaffold attachment sites

children.hasDefinition: Operons (operators, promoters and genes) from a bacterial genome.
children.label: Operon

children.hasDefinition: Whole promoters or promoter elements (transcription start sites, RNA polymerase binding site, transcription factor binding sites, promoter enhancers etc) in a DNA sequence.
children.label: Promoters

children.hasDefinition: Trans- or intra-membrane regions of a protein, typically describing physicochemical properties of the secondary structure elements.
children.label: Protein membrane regions

children.hasDefinition: The comparison of two or more molecular structures, for example structure alignment and clustering.
children.comment: This might involve comparison of secondary or tertiary (3D) structural information.
children.label: Structure comparison

children.hasDefinition: Specific bacteria or archaea, e.g. information on a specific prokaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a prokaryote, a group of prokaryotes or all prokaryotes.
children.label: Prokaryotes and Archaea

children.hasDefinition: Protein data resources.
children.label: Protein databases

children.hasDefinition: Experimental methods for biomolecular structure determination, such as X-ray crystallography, nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR), circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopy, microscopy etc., including the assignment or modelling of molecular structure from such data.
children.label: Structure determination

children.hasDefinition: Topic focused on identifying, grouping, or naming things in a structured way according to some schema based on observable relationships.
children.label: Classification

children.hasDefinition: Lipoproteins (protein-lipid assemblies).
children.label: Lipoproteins

children.hasDefinition: Visualise a phylogeny, for example, render a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogeny visualisation

children.hasDefinition: Search for and retrieve molecular structures that are similar to a structure-based query (typically another structure or part of a structure).
children.comment: The query is a structure-based entity such as another structure, a 3D (structural) motif, 3D profile or template.
children.label: Structure database search

children.hasDefinition: The prediction of functional properties of a protein.
children.label: Protein function prediction

children.hasDefinition: Single nucleotide polymorphisms (SNP) and associated data, for example, the discovery and annotation of SNPs.
children.label: SNP

children.hasDefinition: Predict transmembrane domains and topology in protein sequences.
children.label: Transmembrane protein prediction

children.hasDefinition: The comparison two or more nucleic acid (typically RNA) secondary or tertiary structures.
children.comment: Use this concept for methods that are exclusively for nucleic acid structures.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure comparison

children.hasDefinition: Exons in a nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Exons

children.hasDefinition: Transcription of DNA into RNA including the regulation of transcription.
children.label: Gene transcription

children.hasDefinition: Structural and associated data for toxic chemical substances.
children.label: Toxins and targets

children.hasDefinition: Introns in a nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Introns

children.hasDefinition: A topic concerning primarily bioinformatics software tools, typically the broad function or purpose of a tool.
children.label: Tool topic

children.hasDefinition: A general area of bioinformatics study, typically the broad scope or category of content of a bioinformatics journal or conference proceeding.
children.label: Study topic

children.hasDefinition: Biological nomenclature (naming), symbols and terminology.
children.label: Nomenclature

children.hasDefinition: The genes, gene variations and proteins involved in one or more specific diseases.
children.label: Disease genes and proteins

children.hasDefinition: Informatics resource (typically a database) primarily focussed on genes.
children.label: Gene resources

children.hasDefinition: Yeast, e.g. information on a specific yeast genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.label: Yeast

children.hasDefinition: Eukaryotes or data concerning eukaryotes, e.g. information on a specific eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a eukaryote, a group of eukaryotes or all eukaryotes.
children.label: Eukaryotes

children.hasDefinition: Invertebrates, e.g. information on a specific invertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to an invertebrate, a group of invertebrates or all invertebrates.
children.label: Invertebrates

children.hasDefinition: Vertebrates, e.g. information on a specific vertebrate genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a vertebrate, a group of vertebrates or all vertebrates.
children.label: Vertebrates

children.hasDefinition: Unicellular eukaryotes, e.g. information on a unicellular eukaryote genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.comment: The resource may be specific to a unicellular eukaryote, a group of unicellular eukaryotes or all unicellular eukaryotes.
children.label: Unicellular eukaryotes

children.hasDefinition: Protein secondary or tertiary structure alignments.
children.label: Protein structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Conceptualisation, categorisation and naming of entities or phenomena within biology or bioinformatics.
children.label: Ontologies, nomenclature and classification

children.hasDefinition: Specific molecules, including large molecules built from repeating subunits (macromolecules) and small molecules of biological significance.
children.label: Molecules

children.hasDefinition: Parallelised sequencing processes that are capable of sequencing many thousands of sequences simultaneously.
children.label: High-throughput sequencing

children.hasDefinition: Gene regulatory networks.
children.label: Gene regulatory networks

children.hasDefinition: Informatics resources dedicated to one or more specific diseases (not diseases in general).
children.label: Disease (specific)

children.hasDefinition: Variable number of tandem repeat (VNTR) polymorphism in a DNA sequence.
children.label: VNTR

children.hasDefinition: Microsatellite polymorphism in a DNA sequence.
children.label: Microsatellites

children.hasDefinition: Restriction fragment length polymorphisms (RFLP) in a DNA sequence.
children.label: RFLP

children.hasDefinition: Topic for the design of nucleic acid sequences with specific conformations.
children.label: Nucleic acid design

children.hasDefinition: The design of primers for PCR and DNA amplification or the design of molecular probes.
children.label: Primer or probe design

children.hasDefinition: Molecular secondary or tertiary (3D) structural data resources, typically of proteins and nucleic acids.
children.label: Structure databases

children.hasDefinition: Nucleic acid (secondary or tertiary) structure, such as whole structures, structural features and associated annotation.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure

children.hasDefinition: Molecular sequence data resources, including sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.
children.label: Sequence databases

children.hasDefinition: Nucleotide sequences and associated concepts such as sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequences

children.hasDefinition: Protein sequences and associated concepts such as sequence sites, alignments, motifs and profiles.
children.label: Protein sequences

children.hasDefinition: Protein interaction networks
children.label: Protein interaction networks

children.hasDefinition: Mammals, e.g. information on a specific mammal genome including molecular sequences, genes and annotation.
children.label: Mammals

children.hasDefinition: The comparison, grouping together and classification of macromolecules on the basis of sequence similarity.
children.comment: This includes the results of sequence clustering, ortholog identification, assignment to families, annotation etc.
children.label: Sequence clusters and classification

children.hasDefinition: Regulatory RNA sequences including microRNA (miRNA) and small interfering RNA (siRNA).
children.label: Regulatory RNA

children.hasDefinition: The documentation of resources such as tools, services and databases and how to get help.
children.label: Documentation and help

children.hasDefinition: The structural and functional organisation of genes and other genetic elements.
children.label: Genetic organisation

children.hasDefinition: The detection of the positional features, such as functional and other key sites, in molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence feature detection

children.hasDefinition: The detection of positional features such as functional sites in nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid feature detection

children.hasDefinition: The detection, identification and analysis of positional protein sequence features, such as functional sites.
children.label: Protein feature detection

children.hasDefinition: Topic for modelling biological systems in mathematical terms.
children.label: Biological system modelling

children.hasDefinition: Specific genes and/or their encoded proteins or a family or other grouping of related genes and proteins.
children.label: Genes and proteins resources

children.hasDefinition: Topological domains such as cytoplasmic regions in a protein.
children.label: Protein topological domains

children.hasDefinition: Regions within a nucleic acid sequence containing a signal that alters a biological function.
children.label: Expression signals

children.hasDefinition: Repetitive elements within a nucleic acid sequence.
children.comment: This includes long terminal repeats (LTRs); sequences (typically retroviral) directly repeated at  both ends of a defined sequence and other types of repeating unit.
children.label: Nucleic acid repeats

children.hasDefinition: Coding sequences for a signal or transit peptide.
children.label: Signal or transit peptide

children.hasDefinition: Sequence tagged sites (STS) in nucleic acid sequences.
children.label: Sequence tagged sites

children.hasDefinition: DNA methylation including bisulfite sequencing, methylation sites and analysis, for example of patterns and profiles of DNA methylation in a population, tissue etc.
children.label: DNA methylation

children.hasDefinition: A topic concerning high-throughput sequencing of randomly fragmented genomic DNA, for example, to investigate whole-genome sequencing and resequencing, SNP discovery, identification of copy number variations and chromosomal rearrangements.
children.label: DNA-Seq

children.hasDefinition: The alignment of sequences of (typically millions) of short reads to a reference genome.  This is a specialised topic within sequence alignment, especially because of complications arising from RNA splicing.
children.label: RNA-Seq alignment

children.hasDefinition: The study of metabolic diseases.
children.label: Metabolic disease

children.hasDefinition: The search and retrieval from a database on the basis of molecular sequence similarity.
children.label: Sequence search

children.hasDefinition: The branch of medicine that deals with the infectious diseases of the tropics.
children.label: Infectious tropical disease

children.hasDefinition: Protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-ligand interactions

children.hasDefinition: Protein-drug interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-drug interactions

children.hasDefinition: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis experiments, gels or spots in a gel.
children.label: 2D PAGE experiment

children.hasDefinition: Northern Blot experiments.
children.label: Northern blot experiment

children.hasDefinition: Protein-DNA/RNA interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-nucleic acid interactions

children.hasDefinition: Protein-protein interaction(s), including interactions between protein domains.
children.label: Protein-protein interactions

children.hasDefinition: Cellular process pathways.
children.label: Cellular process pathways

children.hasDefinition: Disease pathways, typically of human disease.
children.label: Disease pathways

children.hasDefinition: Environmental information processing pathways.
children.label: Environmental information processing pathways

children.hasDefinition: Genetic information processing pathways.
children.label: Genetic information processing pathways

children.hasDefinition: Super-secondary structure of protein sequence(s).
children.label: Protein super-secondary structure

children.hasDefinition: Catalytic residues (active site) of an enzyme.
children.label: Protein active sites

children.hasDefinition: RNA and DNA-binding proteins and binding sites in protein sequences.

children.hasDefinition: Cleavage sites (for a proteolytic enzyme or agent) in a protein sequence.

children.hasDefinition: Chemical modification of a protein.

children.hasDefinition: Structural domains or 3D folds in a protein or polypeptide chain.

children.hasDefinition: Key residues involved in protein folding.

children.hasDefinition: Post-translation modifications in a protein sequence, typically describing the specific sites involved.

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl protein ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a protein listed in the UCSD-Nature Signaling Gateway Molecule Pages database.
children.label: Signaling Gateway protein ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Ligand-gated ion channel (LGICdb) database.
children.label: LGICdb identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a target protein from the Therapeutic Target Database (TTD).
children.label: Target ID (TTD)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein complex from the CORUM database.
children.label: Protein ID (CORUM)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the CuticleDB database.
children.label: Protein ID (CuticleDB)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the DisProt database.
children.label: Protein ID (DisProt)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a membrane transport proteins from the transport classification database (TCDB).
children.label: TCID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a antibody from the HPA database.
children.label: HPA antibody id

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a human major histocompatibility complex (HLA) or other protein from the IMGT/HLA database.
children.label: IMGT/HLA ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a membrane protein from the TopDB database.
children.label: Protein ID (TopDB)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a peroxidase protein from the PeroxiBase database.
children.label: Protein ID (PeroxiBase)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a ligand-gated ion channel protein from the LGICdb database.
children.label: Protein ID (LGICdb)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the EcID database.
children.label: Protein ID (EcID)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a cone snail toxin protein from the ConoServer database.
children.label: Protein ID (ConoServer)

children.hasDefinition: EMBL/GENBANK/DDBJ coding feature protein identifier, issued by International collaborators.
children.comment: This qualifier consists of a stable ID portion (3+5 format with 3 position letters and 5 numbers) plus a version number after the decimal point. When the protein sequence encoded by the CDS changes, only the version number of the /protein_id value is incremented; the stable part of the /protein_id remains unchanged and as a result will permanently be associated with a given protein; this qualifier is valid only on CDS features which translate into a valid protein.
children.label: Protein ID (EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ)

children.hasDefinition: Accession of a protein deposited in a database.
children.label: Protein accession

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a glycan ligand from the KEGG GLYCAN database (a subset of KEGG LIGAND).
children.label: KEGG Glycan ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GlycomeDB database.
children.label: GlycomeDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GlycosciencesDB database.
children.label: GlycoMap ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GlycosciencesDB database.
children.label: Linucs ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of carbohydrates.
children.label: Carbohydrate accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the LIPID MAPS database.
children.label: LIPID MAPS ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the LipidBank database.
children.label: LipidBank ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of lipids.
children.label: Lipid accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a peptide from the PeptideAtlas peptide databases.
children.label: PeptideAtlas ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of a peptide deposited in a database.
children.label: Peptide ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an oligonucleotide probe from the dbProbe database.
children.label: dbProbe ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an dinucleotide property from the DiProDB database.
children.label: DiProDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an oligonucleotide from a database.
children.label: Oligonucleotide ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of a specific molecule (catalogued in a database).
children.label: Molecule accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the LIPID MAPS database.
children.label: LIPID MAPS ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the LipidBank database.
children.label: LipidBank ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of lipids.
children.label: Lipid accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a lipid.
children.label: Lipid identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of a molecule.
children.label: Molecule identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier (a string) of a specific atom from a PDB file for a molecular structure.
children.label: PDB atom name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an atom.
children.label: Atom name

children.hasDefinition: Identifier (e.g. character symbol) of a specific atom.
children.label: Atom ID

children.hasDefinition: A feature identifier as used in the SwissRegulon database.
children.comment: This can be name of a gene, the ID of a TFBS, or genomic coordinates in form "chr:start..end".
children.label: Sequence feature ID (SwissRegulon)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of molecular sequence feature, for example an ID of a feature that is unique within the scope of the GFF file.
children.label: Sequence feature ID

children.hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user. Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.
children.comment: A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.
children.label: Sequence feature label

children.hasDefinition: The name of a sequence feature-containing entity adhering to the standard feature naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
children.label: EMBOSS Uniform Feature Object

children.hasDefinition: Name or other identifier of molecular sequence feature(s).
children.label: Sequence feature identifier

children.hasDefinition: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.
children.label: Gene symbol

children.hasDefinition: The name of a gene, (typically) assigned by a person and/or according to a naming scheme. It may contain white space characters and is typically more intuitive and readable than a gene symbol. It (typically) may be used to identify similar genes in different species and to derive a gene symbol.
children.label: Gene name

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene ID (NCBI)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene or feature from the CGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (CGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from DictyBase.
children.label: Gene ID (DictyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl gene ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TIGR database.
children.label: TIGR identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an Arabidopsis thaliana gene from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (At gene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an gene from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (gene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from PlasmoDB Plasmodium Genome Resource.
children.label: Gene ID (PlasmoDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an E. coli K-12 gene from EcoGene Database.
children.label: Gene ID (ECK)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from EcoGene Database.
children.label: Gene ID (EcoGene)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from FlyBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (FlyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Gramene database.
children.label: Gene ID (Gramene)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Virginia Bioinformatics Institute microbial database.
children.label: Gene ID (Virginia microbial)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Sol Genomics Network.
children.label: Gene ID (SGN)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier used by WormBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (WormBase)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneFarm database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneFarm)

children.hasDefinition: The blattner identifier for a gene.
children.label: Blattner number

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a protein or gene used in the iHOP database.
children.label: iHOP symbol

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the KOME database.
children.label: Gene ID (KOME)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS database.
children.label: Gene ID (MIPS)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
children.label: Gene ID (HGNC)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Rouge or HUGE databases.
children.label: mFLJ/mKIAA number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the miRBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (miRBase)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the Zebrafish information network genome (ZFIN) database.
children.label: Gene ID (ZFIN)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the NMPDR database.
children.comment: A FIG ID consists of four parts: a prefix, genome id, locus type and id number.
children.label: FIG ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the Xenbase database.
children.label: Gene ID (Xenbase)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the Genolist database.
children.label: Gene ID (Genolist)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the VectorBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (VectorBase)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene cluster in the H-InvDB database.
children.label: HIX ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene assigned by the J. Craig Venter Institute (JCVI).
children.label: Gene ID (JCVI)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of gene in the MfunGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (MfunGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene from the VBASE2 database.
children.label: Gene ID (VBASE2)

children.hasDefinition: A unique (and typically persistent) identifier of a gene in a database, that is (typically) different to the gene name/symbol.
children.label: Gene ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a gene, such as a name/symbol or a unique identifier of a gene in a database.
children.label: Gene identifier

children.hasDefinition: A SCOP concise classification string (sccs) is a compact representation of a SCOP domain classification.
children.comment: An scss includes the class (alphabetical), fold, superfamily and family (all numerical) to which a given domain belongs.
children.label: SCOP concise classification string (sccs)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, for example 33229.
children.comment: A sunid uniquely identifies an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, including leaves (the SCOP domains) and higher level nodes including entries corresponding to the protein level.
children.label: SCOP sunid

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP domain identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain from CATH.
children.label: CATH domain ID

children.hasDefinition: A code number identifying a family from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH node ID (family)

children.hasDefinition: A code number identifying a node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH node ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a conserved domain from the Conserved Domain Database.
children.label: CDD ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein structural domain.
children.comment: This is typically a character or string concatenated with a PDB identifier and a chain identifier.
children.label: Protein domain ID

children.hasDefinition: The name of a biological or bioinformatics database.
children.label: Database name

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a biological or bioinformatics database.
children.label: Database ID

children.hasDefinition: Name of an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.
children.label: Ontology name

children.hasDefinition: Any arbitrary identifier of an ontology.
children.label: Ontology identifier

children.hasDefinition: Name of a QSAR descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor name

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular property.
children.label: Molecular property identifier

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of PIR sequence database entry.
children.label: PIR identifier

children.hasDefinition: Primary identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene primary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Secondary (internal) identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene secondary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein entry catalogued in the International Protein Index (IPI) database.
children.label: IPI protein ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniParc (protein sequence) database entry.
children.label: UniParc accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein sequence from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a UniProt (protein sequence) database entry.
children.label: UniProt accession

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein sequence database entry.
children.label: Sequence accession (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.
children.label: dbEST accession

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GenBank sequence database.
children.label: GenBank accession

children.hasDefinition: An accession number of an entry from the EMBL sequence database.
children.label: EMBL accession

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the DDBJ sequence database.
children.label: DDBJ accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a (nucleic acid) entry from the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
children.label: EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an exon from the ASTD database.
children.label: ASTD ID (exon)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an intron from the ASTD database.
children.label: ASTD ID (intron)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a polyA signal from the ASTD database.
children.label: ASTD ID (polya)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription start site from the ASTD database.
children.label: ASTD ID (tss)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the ASTD database.
children.label: ASTD ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UniSTS database.
children.label: UniSTS accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UNITE database.
children.label: UNITE accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the UTR database.
children.label: UTR accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the RNA editing database (REDIdb).
children.label: REDIdb ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the RNA central database of annotated human miRNAs.
children.comment: There are canonical and taxon-specific forms of RNAcentral ID. Canonical form e.g. urs_9or10digits identifies an RNA sequence (within the RNA central database) which may appear in multiple sequences. Taxon-specific form identifies a sequence in the specific taxon (e.g. urs_9or10digits_taxonID).
children.label: RNA central ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide sequence database entry.
children.label: Sequence accession (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene ID (NCBI)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein from the RefSeq database.
children.label: RefSeq accession (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a cDNA molecule catalogued in the RefSeq database.
children.label: Clone ID (RefSeq)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a RefSeq database entry.
children.label: RefSeq accession

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to NCBI protein sequence records.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
children.label: GI number (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A series of digits that are assigned consecutively to each sequence record processed by NCBI. The GI number bears no resemblance to the Accession number of the sequence record.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
children.label: GI number

children.hasDefinition: An identifier assigned to sequence records processed by NCBI, made of the accession number of the database record followed by a dot and a version number.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence version contains two letters followed by six digits, a dot, and a version number (or for older nucleotide sequence records, the format is one letter followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number). Protein sequence version contains three letters followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number.
children.label: NCBI version

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a nucleotide or protein sequence database entry.
children.label: Sequence accession (hybrid)

children.hasDefinition: A persistent, unique identifier of a molecular sequence database entry.
children.label: Sequence accession

children.hasDefinition: The name of a sequence-based entity adhering to the standard sequence naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
children.label: EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Address

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a polypeptide in the UniProt database.
children.label: UniProt ID

children.hasDefinition: Any arbitrary name of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence name

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of molecular sequence(s) or entries from a molecular sequence database.
children.label: Sequence identifier

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an entry (gene cluster) from the NCBI UniGene database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniGene)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the COG database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (COG)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the SYSTERS database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (SYSTERS)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef100 database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef100)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef90 database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef90)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef50 database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef50)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the UniRef database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniRef)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the CluSTr database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (CluSTr)

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a cluster of molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Sequence cluster ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of sequence assembly.
children.label: Sequence assembly ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a set of molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Sequence set ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular sequence alignment, for example a record from an alignment database.
children.label: Sequence alignment ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeBASE database.
children.label: TreeBASE study accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeFam database.
children.label: TreeFam accession number

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene tree from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl gene tree ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a phylogenetic tree for example from a phylogenetic tree database.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique name or identifier of a comparison matrix.
children.comment: See for example http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/help/matrix.
children.label: Comparison matrix name

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a comparison matrix.
children.label: Comparison matrix identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.
children.label: AAindex ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an index of amino acid physicochemical and biochemical property data.
children.label: Amino acid index ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an array of numerical values, such as a comparison matrix.
children.label: Matrix identifier

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the PDB database.
children.comment: A PDB identification code which consists of 4 characters, the first of which is a digit in the range 0 - 9; the remaining 3 are alpha-numeric, and letters are upper case only. (source: https://cdn.rcsb.org/wwpdb/docs/documentation/file-format/PDB_format_1996.pdf)
children.label: PDB ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the MMDB database.
children.label: MMDB ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique and persistent identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.
children.label: Structure ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a model structure from a PDB file.
children.label: PDB model number

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a molecular tertiary structure, typically an entry from a structure database.
children.label: Structure identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier or name of a structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).
children.label: Structural (3D) profile ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SISYPHUS database of tertiary structure alignments.
children.label: SISYPHUS ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of tertiary structure alignments.
children.label: Structure alignment ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.
children.label: AAindex ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an index of amino acid physicochemical and biochemical property data.
children.label: Amino acid index ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the BIND database.
children.label: BIND accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the IntAct database.
children.label: IntAct accession number

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the STRING database of protein-protein interactions.
children.label: STRING ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the MINT database of protein-protein interactions.
children.label: MINT ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the DIP database of protein-protein interactions.
children.label: DIP ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an interaction from the BioGRID database.
children.label: BioGRID interaction ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an interaction from the MatrixDB database.
children.label: MatrixDB interaction ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the iRefIndex database of protein-protein interactions.
children.label: iRefIndex ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a report of protein interactions from a protein interaction database (typically).
children.label: Protein interaction ID

children.hasDefinition: Name of an InterPro entry, usually indicating the type of protein matches for that entry.
children.label: InterPro entry name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the Pfam database.
children.label: Pfam domain name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the SMART database.
children.label: SMART domain name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a protein family.
children.label: Protein family name

children.hasDefinition: Secondary accession number of an InterPro entry.
children.label: InterPro secondary accession

children.hasDefinition: Primary accession number of an InterPro entry.
children.comment: Every InterPro entry has a unique accession number to provide a persistent citation of database records.
children.label: InterPro accession

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Gene3D database.
children.label: Gene3D ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the PIRSF database.
children.label: PIRSF ID

children.hasDefinition: The unique identifier of an entry in the PRINTS database.
children.label: PRINTS code

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam entry.
children.label: Pfam accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the SMART database.
children.label: SMART accession number

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of a hidden Markov model from the Superfamily database.
children.label: Superfamily hidden Markov model number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.
children.label: TIGRFam ID

children.hasDefinition: A ProDom domain family accession number.
children.comment: ProDom is a protein domain family database.
children.label: ProDom accession number

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a family from the transport classification database (TCDB) of membrane transport proteins.
children.comment: OBO file for regular expression.
children.label: TCDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.
children.label: Protein family ID (GeneFarm)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam clan.
children.label: Pfam clan ID

children.hasDefinition: Name of a protein family from the HAMAP database.
children.label: HAMAP ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the PANTHER database.
children.label: Protein family ID (PANTHER)

children.hasDefinition: Accession of a protein family (that is deposited in a database).
children.label: Protein family accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein family.
children.label: Protein family identifier

children.hasDefinition: Unique name of a codon usage table.
children.label: Codon usage table name

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a codon usage table, for example a genetic code.
children.label: Codon usage table ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TRANSFAC database.
children.label: TRANSFAC accession number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a predicted transcription factor from the DBD database.
children.label: DBD ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription factor from the AraC-XylS database.
children.label: AraC-XylS ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession of an entry from a database of transcription factors or binding sites.
children.label: Transcription factor accession

children.hasDefinition: The name of a transcription factor.
children.label: Transcription factor name

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a transcription factor (or a TF binding site).
children.label: Transcription factor identifier

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the ArrayExpress database.
children.label: ArrayExpress accession number

children.hasDefinition: PRIDE experiment accession number.
children.label: PRIDE experiment accession number

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of (typically a list of) gene expression experiments catalogued in the CleanEx database.
children.label: CleanEx dataset code

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the Gene Expression Atlas.
children.label: Gene Expression Atlas Experiment ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for mass spectrometry proteomics data in the proteomexchange.org repository.
children.label: ProteomeXchange ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of microarray data.
children.label: Experiment annotation ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMDB electron microscopy database.
children.label: EMDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of electron microscopy data.
children.label: Electron microscopy model ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GEO database.
children.label: GEO accession number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GermOnline database.
children.label: GermOnline ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMAGE database.
children.label: EMAGE ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a gene expression profile from the CleanEx database.
children.label: CleanEx entry name

children.hasDefinition: Accession of a report of gene expression (e.g. a gene expression profile) from a database.
children.label: Gene expression report ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HGVbase database.
children.label: HGVbase ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the OMIM database.
children.label: OMIM ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from a database of genotypes and phenotypes.
children.label: Genotype and phenotype annotation ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Reactome database.
children.label: Pathway ID (reactome)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.
children.label: Pathway ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the INOH database.
children.label: Pathway ID (INOH)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PATIKA database.
children.label: Pathway ID (PATIKA)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the CPDB (ConsensusPathDB) biological pathways database, which is an identifier from an external database integrated into CPDB.
children.comment: This concept refers to identifiers used by the databases collated in CPDB; CPDB identifiers are not independently defined.
children.label: Pathway ID (CPDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Panther Pathways database.
children.label: Pathway ID (Panther)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the KEGG pathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (KEGG)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the NCI-Nature pathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (NCI-Nature)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the ConsensusPathDB pathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (ConsensusPathDB)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier for pathways, reactions, complexes and small molecules from the cPath (Pathway Commons) database.
children.comment: These identifiers are unique within the cPath database, however, they are not stable between releases.
children.label: cPath ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Unipathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (Unipathway)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the pharmacogenetics and pharmacogenomics knowledge base (PharmGKB).
children.label: Pathway ID (PharmGKB)
