children.hasDefinition: The name of a sequence feature-containing entity adhering to the standard feature naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
children.label: EMBOSS Uniform Feature Object

children.hasDefinition: The short name of a gene; a single word that does not contain white space characters. It is typically derived from the gene name.
children.label: Gene symbol

children.hasDefinition: The name of a gene, (typically) assigned by a person and/or according to a naming scheme. It may contain white space characters and is typically more intuitive and readable than a gene symbol. It (typically) may be used to identify similar genes in different species and to derive a gene symbol.
children.label: Gene name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a biological kingdom (Bacteria, Archaea, or Eukaryotes).
children.label: Kingdom name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a species (typically a taxonomic group) of organism.
children.label: Species name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a genus of organism.
children.label: Genus name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a taxon from the NCBI taxonomy database.
children.label: NCBI taxon

children.hasDefinition: The name of a taxon using the controlled vocabulary of the UniGene database.
children.label: UniGene taxon

children.hasDefinition: The name of a taxon using the controlled vocabulary of the UTRdb database.
children.label: UTRdb taxon

children.hasDefinition: The name of a family of organism.
children.label: Family name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a group of organisms belonging to the same taxonomic rank.
children.comment: For a complete list of taxonomic ranks see https://www.phenoscape.org/wiki/Taxonomic_Rank_Vocabulary.
children.label: Taxon

children.hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
children.label: Cell line name (exact)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
children.label: Cell line name (truncated)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
children.label: Cell line name (no punctuation)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
children.label: Cell line name (assonant)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a cell line.
children.label: Cell line name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a strain of an organism variant, typically a plant, virus or bacterium.
children.label: Strain name

children.hasDefinition: The full name for a group of organisms, reflecting their biological classification and (usually) conforming to a standard nomenclature.
children.comment: Name components correspond to levels in a taxonomic hierarchy (e.g. 'Genus', 'Species', etc.) Meta information such as a reference where the name was defined and a date might be included.
children.label: Taxonomic classification

children.hasDefinition: Common name for an organism as used in the GenBank database.
children.label: Genbank common name

children.hasDefinition: A three-letter code used in the KEGG databases to uniquely identify organisms.
children.label: KEGG organism code

children.hasDefinition: The name of an organism (or group of organisms).
children.label: Organism name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a directory.
children.label: Directory name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a file (of any type) with restricted possible values.
children.label: Enumerated file name

children.hasDefinition: The extension of a file name.
children.comment: A file extension is the characters appearing after the final '.' in the file name.
children.label: File name extension

children.hasDefinition: The base name of a file.
children.comment: A file base name is the file name stripped of its directory specification and extension.
children.label: File base name

children.hasDefinition: The name (or part of a name) of a file (of any type).
children.label: File name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an ontology of biological or bioinformatics concepts and relations.
children.label: Ontology name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a biological or bioinformatics database.
children.label: Database name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a QSAR descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor name

children.hasDefinition: Unique name of a codon usage table.
children.label: Codon usage table name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an object from the WormBase database, usually a human-readable name.
children.label: WormBase name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a sequence-based entity adhering to the standard sequence naming scheme used by all EMBOSS applications.
children.label: EMBOSS Uniform Sequence Address

children.hasDefinition: Unique name or identifier of a comparison matrix.
children.comment: See for example http://www.ebi.ac.uk/Tools/webservices/help/matrix.
children.label: Comparison matrix name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an InterPro entry, usually indicating the type of protein matches for that entry.
children.label: InterPro entry name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the Pfam database.
children.label: Pfam domain name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a domain from the SMART database.
children.label: SMART domain name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a protein family.
children.label: Protein family name

children.hasDefinition: The primary name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
children.comment: The primary name of a MIRIAM data type is taken from a controlled vocabulary.
children.label: MIRIAM data type primary name

children.hasDefinition: A synonymous name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
children.comment: A synonymous name for a MIRIAM data type taken from a controlled vocabulary.
children.label: MIRIAM data type synonymous name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a data type from the MIRIAM database.
children.label: MIRIAM data type name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a data type.
children.label: Data resource definition name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a biological (mathematical) model.
children.label: Biological model name

children.hasDefinition: Identifier (a string) of a specific atom from a PDB file for a molecular structure.
children.label: PDB atom name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an atom.
children.label: Atom name

children.hasDefinition: The name of an open reading frame attributed by a sequencing project.
children.label: ORF name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a protein fold.
children.label: Protein fold name

children.hasDefinition: Informal name for a genetic code, typically an organism name.
children.label: Genetic code name

children.hasDefinition: Name of an OBO file format such as OBO-XML, plain and so on.
children.label: OBO file format name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a file format such as HTML, PNG, PDF, EMBL, GenBank and so on.
children.label: File format name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a computer operating system such as Linux, PC or Mac.
children.label: Operating system name

children.hasDefinition: A logical operator such as OR, AND, XOR, and NOT.
children.label: Logical operator

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a polypeptide in the UniProt database.
children.label: UniProt ID

children.hasDefinition: Any arbitrary name of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a field in a database.
children.label: Database field name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a concept in an ontology.
children.label: Ontology concept name

children.hasDefinition: The name of a catalogue of biological resources from the CABRI database.
children.label: CABRI catalogue name

children.hasDefinition: Name (not necessarily stable) an entry (RNA family) from the RFAM database.
children.label: RFAM name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a physical entity from the ConsensusPathDB database.
children.label: ConsensusPathDB entity name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a reference map gel from the SWISS-2DPAGE database.
children.label: Reference map name (SWISS-2DPAGE)

children.hasDefinition: The name of a type or group of cells.
children.label: Cell type name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a toxin.
children.label: Toxin name

children.hasDefinition: Name of a phenotype.
children.label: Phenotype name

children.hasDefinition: The name of some disease.
children.label: Disease name

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a flow cell of a sequencing machine.
children.comment: A flow cell is used to immobilise, amplify and sequence millions of molecules at once.  In Illumina machines, a flowcell is composed of  8 "lanes" which allows 8 experiments in a single analysis.
children.label: Flow cell identifier

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a lane within a flow cell of a sequencing machine, within which millions of sequences are immobilised, amplified and sequenced.
children.label: Lane identifier

children.hasDefinition: A number corresponding to the number of an analysis performed by a sequencing machine.  For example, if it's the 13th analysis, the run is 13.
children.label: Run number

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a sequencing experiment, that may be specified as an input to some tool.
children.label: Sequencing metadata name

children.hasDefinition: A name of a thing, which need not necessarily uniquely identify it.
children.label: Name

children.hasDefinition: CAS registry number of a chemical compound; a unique numerical identifier of chemicals in the scientific literature, as assigned by the Chemical Abstracts Service.
children.label: CAS number

children.hasDefinition: Beilstein registry number of a chemical compound.
children.label: Chemical registry number (Beilstein)

children.hasDefinition: Gmelin registry number of a chemical compound.
children.label: Chemical registry number (Gmelin)

children.hasDefinition: An Enzyme Commission (EC) number of an enzyme.
children.label: EC number

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene ID (NCBI)

children.hasDefinition: An NCBI unique identifier of a gene.
children.label: Gene ID (NCBI)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a protein from the RefSeq database.
children.label: RefSeq accession (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a cDNA molecule catalogued in the RefSeq database.
children.label: Clone ID (RefSeq)

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a RefSeq database entry.
children.label: RefSeq accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene or feature from the CGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (CGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from DictyBase.
children.label: Gene ID (DictyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl gene ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene (or other feature) from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl gene ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a protein from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl protein ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene transcript from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl transcript ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier for a gene tree from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl gene tree ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry (exon, gene, transcript or protein) from the Ensembl database.
children.label: Ensembl ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the SGD database.
children.label: Gene ID (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from SGD (Saccharomyces Genome Database).
children.label: Locus ID (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Saccharomyces genome database (SGD).
children.label: SGD ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneDB database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TIGR database.
children.label: TIGR identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an Arabidopsis thaliana gene from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (At gene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an gene from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (gene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein sequence from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TAIR database.
children.label: TAIR accession

children.hasDefinition: A SCOP concise classification string (sccs) is a compact representation of a SCOP domain classification.
children.comment: An scss includes the class (alphabetical), fold, superfamily and family (all numerical) to which a given domain belongs.
children.label: SCOP concise classification string (sccs)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, for example 33229.
children.comment: A sunid uniquely identifies an entry in the SCOP hierarchy, including leaves (the SCOP domains) and higher level nodes including entries corresponding to the protein level.
children.label: SCOP sunid

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the SCOP database.
children.label: SCOP domain identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain from CATH.
children.label: CATH domain ID

children.hasDefinition: A code number identifying a family from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH node ID (family)

children.hasDefinition: A code number identifying a node from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH node ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a protein domain (or other node) from the CATH database.
children.label: CATH identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a molecular sequence alignment, for example a record from an alignment database.
children.label: Sequence alignment ID

children.hasDefinition: Primary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
children.label: FlyBase primary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Secondary identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
children.comment: Secondary identifier are used to handle entries that were merged with or split from other entries in the database.
children.label: FlyBase secondary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from the FlyBase database.
children.label: FlyBase ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of PIR sequence database entry.
children.label: PIR identifier

children.hasDefinition: Primary identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene primary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Secondary (internal) identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene secondary identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a Gramene database entry.
children.label: Gramene identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.
children.label: dbEST accession

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GenBank sequence database.
children.label: GenBank accession

children.hasDefinition: An accession number of an entry from the EMBL sequence database.
children.label: EMBL accession

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the DDBJ sequence database.
children.label: DDBJ accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a (nucleic acid) entry from the EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ databases.
children.label: EMBL/GenBank/DDBJ ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of an entry (gene cluster) from the NCBI UniGene database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (UniGene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbEST database entry.
children.label: dbEST accession

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a dbSNP database entry.
children.label: dbSNP ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the COG database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (COG)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a HMMER hidden Markov model.
children.label: HMMER hidden Markov model ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier or name of a profile from the JASPAR database.
children.label: JASPAR profile ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeBASE database.
children.label: TreeBASE study accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the TreeFam database.
children.label: TreeFam accession number

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of an entry from the PDB database.
children.comment: A PDB identification code which consists of 4 characters, the first of which is a digit in the range 0 - 9; the remaining 3 are alpha-numeric, and letters are upper case only. (source: https://cdn.rcsb.org/wwpdb/docs/documentation/file-format/PDB_format_1996.pdf)
children.label: PDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the AAindex database.
children.label: AAindex ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the BIND database.
children.label: BIND accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the IntAct database.
children.label: IntAct accession number

children.hasDefinition: Secondary accession number of an InterPro entry.
children.label: InterPro secondary accession

children.hasDefinition: Primary accession number of an InterPro entry.
children.comment: Every InterPro entry has a unique accession number to provide a persistent citation of database records.
children.label: InterPro accession

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the Gene3D database.
children.label: Gene3D ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the PIRSF database.
children.label: PIRSF ID

children.hasDefinition: The unique identifier of an entry in the PRINTS database.
children.label: PRINTS code

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of a Pfam entry.
children.label: Pfam accession number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the SMART database.
children.label: SMART accession number

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier (number) of a hidden Markov model from the Superfamily database.
children.label: Superfamily hidden Markov model number

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry (family) from the TIGRFam database.
children.label: TIGRFam ID

children.hasDefinition: A ProDom domain family accession number.
children.comment: ProDom is a protein domain family database.
children.label: ProDom accession number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the TRANSFAC database.
children.label: TRANSFAC accession number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMDB electron microscopy database.
children.label: EMDB ID

children.hasDefinition: Accession number of an entry from the GEO database.
children.label: GEO accession number

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the GermOnline database.
children.label: GermOnline ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the EMAGE database.
children.label: EMAGE ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the HGVbase database.
children.label: HGVbase ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the OMIM database.
children.label: OMIM ID

children.hasDefinition: A three-letter code used in the KEGG databases to uniquely identify organisms.
children.label: KEGG organism code

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the KEGG pathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (KEGG)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a chemical compound from the KEGG database.
children.label: Compound ID (KEGG)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the KEGG reactions database.
children.label: Reaction ID (KEGG)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug from the KEGG Drug database.
children.label: Drug ID (KEGG)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a glycan ligand from the KEGG GLYCAN database (a subset of KEGG LIGAND).
children.label: KEGG Glycan ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an object from one of the KEGG databases (excluding the GENES division).
children.label: KEGG object identifier

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the Reactome database.
children.label: Pathway ID (reactome)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.
children.label: Pathway ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an pathway from the BioCyc biological pathways database.
children.label: Pathway ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a compound from the BioCyc chemical compounds database.
children.label: Compound ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the BioCyc reactions database.
children.label: Reaction ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the BioCyc enzymes database.
children.label: Enzyme ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an object from one of the BioCyc databases.
children.label: BioCyc ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the INOH database.
children.label: Pathway ID (INOH)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PATIKA database.
children.label: Pathway ID (PATIKA)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the CPDB (ConsensusPathDB) biological pathways database, which is an identifier from an external database integrated into CPDB.
children.comment: This concept refers to identifiers used by the databases collated in CPDB; CPDB identifiers are not independently defined.
children.label: Pathway ID (CPDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological pathway from the Panther Pathways database.
children.label: Pathway ID (Panther)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a MIRIAM data resource.
children.comment: This is the identifier used internally by MIRIAM for a data type.
children.label: MIRIAM identifier

children.hasDefinition: The URI (URL or URN) of a data entity from the MIRIAM database.
children.comment: A MIRIAM URI consists of the URI of the MIRIAM data type (PubMed, UniProt etc) followed by the identifier of an element of that data type, for example PMID for a publication or an accession number for a GO term.
children.label: MIRIAM URI

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a Taverna workflow.
children.label: Taverna workflow ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the BioModel database.
children.label: BioModel ID

children.hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in PubChem Compound Identification (CID), a non-zero integer identifier for a unique chemical structure.
children.label: PubChem CID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an assay from the PubChem database.
children.label: PubChem bioassay ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the PubChem database.
children.label: PubChem ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChemSpider database.
children.label: ChemSpider ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an entry from the ChEBI database.
children.label: ChEBI ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the BioPax ontology.
children.label: BioPax concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'biological process' concept from the the Gene Ontology.
children.label: GO concept ID (biological process)

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'molecular function' concept from the the Gene Ontology.
children.label: GO concept ID (molecular function)

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a 'cellular component' concept from the Gene Ontology.
children.label: GO concept ID (cellular component)

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from The Gene Ontology.
children.label: GO concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MeSH vocabulary.
children.label: MeSH concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the HGNC controlled vocabulary.
children.label: HGNC concept ID

children.hasDefinition: A stable unique identifier for each taxon (for a species, a family, an order, or any other group in the NCBI taxonomy database.
children.label: NCBI taxonomy ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the Plant Ontology (PO).
children.label: Plant Ontology concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the UMLS vocabulary.
children.label: UMLS concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from Foundational Model of Anatomy.
children.comment: Classifies anatomical entities according to their shared characteristics (genus) and distinguishing characteristics (differentia). Specifies the part-whole and spatial relationships of the entities, morphological transformation of the entities during prenatal development and the postnatal life cycle and principles, rules and definitions according to which classes and relationships in the other three components of FMA are represented.
children.label: FMA concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the EMAP mouse ontology.
children.label: EMAP concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the ChEBI ontology.
children.label: ChEBI concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the MGED ontology.
children.label: MGED concept ID

children.hasDefinition: An identifier of a concept from the myGrid ontology.
children.comment: The ontology is provided as two components, the service ontology and the domain ontology. The domain ontology acts provides concepts for core bioinformatics data types and their relations. The service ontology describes the physical and operational features of web services.
children.label: myGrid concept ID

children.hasDefinition: PubMed unique identifier of an article.
children.label: PubMed ID

children.hasDefinition: Digital Object Identifier (DOI) of a published article.
children.label: DOI

children.hasDefinition: Medline UI (unique identifier) of an article.
children.comment: The use of Medline UI has been replaced by the PubMed unique identifier.
children.label: Medline UI

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from PlasmoDB Plasmodium Genome Resource.
children.label: Gene ID (PlasmoDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an E. coli K-12 gene from EcoGene Database.
children.label: Gene ID (ECK)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from EcoGene Database.
children.label: Gene ID (EcoGene)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from FlyBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (FlyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Gramene database.
children.label: Gene ID (Gramene)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Virginia Bioinformatics Institute microbial database.
children.label: Gene ID (Virginia microbial)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier from Sol Genomics Network.
children.label: Gene ID (SGN)

children.hasDefinition: Gene identifier used by WormBase database.
children.label: Gene ID (WormBase)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier for an organism used in the iHOP database.
children.label: iHOP organism ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the GeneFarm database.
children.label: Gene ID (GeneFarm)

children.hasDefinition: The blattner identifier for a gene.
children.label: Blattner number

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a protein or gene used in the iHOP database.
children.label: iHOP symbol

children.hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Arabidopsis Genome Initiative (TAIR, TIGR and MIPS databases)
children.label: Locus ID (AGI)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from ASPGD (Aspergillus Genome Database).
children.label: Locus ID (ASPGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from Magnaporthe grisea Database at the Broad Institute.
children.label: Locus ID (MGG)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from CGD (Candida Genome Database).
children.label: Locus ID (CGD)

children.hasDefinition: Locus identifier for Comprehensive Microbial Resource at the J. Craig Venter Institute.
children.label: Locus ID (CMR)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from NCBI database.
children.label: NCBI locus tag

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for loci from SGD (Saccharomyces Genome Database).
children.label: Locus ID (SGD)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of loci from Maize Mapping Project.
children.label: Locus ID (MMP)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from DictyBase (Dictyostelium discoideum).
children.label: Locus ID (DictyBase)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from EntrezGene database.
children.label: Locus ID (EntrezGene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of locus from MaizeGDB (Maize genome database).
children.label: Locus ID (MaizeGDB)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a gene from the KOME database.
children.label: Gene ID (KOME)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a locus from the Tropgene database.
children.label: Locus ID (Tropgene)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a compound from the BioCyc chemical compounds database.
children.label: Compound ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the BioCyc reactions database.
children.label: Reaction ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the BioCyc enzymes database.
children.label: Enzyme ID (BioCyc)

children.hasDefinition: Protein identifier used by WormBase database.
children.label: WormBase wormpep ID

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier of a specific mutation catalogued in a database.
children.label: Mutation ID

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a sequence cluster from the SYSTERS database.
children.label: Sequence cluster ID (SYSTERS)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for genetic elements in MIPS database.
children.label: Gene ID (MIPS)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier for a gene approved by the HUGO Gene Nomenclature Committee.
children.label: Gene ID (HGNC)

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of an entry from the STRING database of protein-protein interactions.
children.label: STRING ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction (kinetics entry) from the SABIO-RK reactions database.
children.label: Reaction kinetics ID (SABIO-RK)

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a biological reaction from the SABIO-RK reactions database.
children.label: Reaction ID (SABIO-RK)

children.hasDefinition: A unique identifier assigned to NCBI protein sequence records.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
children.label: GI number (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A series of digits that are assigned consecutively to each sequence record processed by NCBI. The GI number bears no resemblance to the Accession number of the sequence record.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence GI number is shown in the VERSION field of the database record. Protein sequence GI number is shown in the CDS/db_xref field of a nucleotide database record, and the VERSION field of a protein database record.
children.label: GI number

children.hasDefinition: An identifier assigned to sequence records processed by NCBI, made of the accession number of the database record followed by a dot and a version number.
children.comment: Nucleotide sequence version contains two letters followed by six digits, a dot, and a version number (or for older nucleotide sequence records, the format is one letter followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number). Protein sequence version contains three letters followed by five digits, a dot, and a version number.
children.label: NCBI version

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of an enzyme from the REBASE enzymes database.
children.label: REBASE enzyme number

children.hasDefinition: Unique identifier of a drug from the DrugBank database.
children.label: DrugBank ID

children.hasDefinition: Identifier of a pathway from the KEGG pathway database.
children.label: Pathway ID (KEGG)

When the protein sequence encoded by the CDS changes, only the version number of the /protein_id value is incremented; the stable part of the /protein_id remains unchanged and as a result will permanently be associated with a given protein; this qualifier is valid only on CDS features which translate into a valid protein.

children.hasDefinition: An identifier that is re-used for data objects of fundamentally different types (typically served from a single database).
children.comment: This branch provides an alternative organisation of the concepts nested under 'Accession' and 'Name'. All concepts under here are already included under 'Accession' or 'Name'.
children.label: Identifier (hybrid)

children.hasDefinition: A Uniform Resource Locator (URL).
children.label: URL

children.hasDefinition: A Life Science Identifier (LSID) - a unique identifier of some data.
children.comment: LSIDs provide a standard way to locate and describe data. An LSID is represented as a Uniform Resource Name (URN) with the following format: URN:LSID:<Authority>:<Namespace>:<ObjectID>[:<Version>]
children.label: LSID

children.hasDefinition: A Uniform Resource Name (URN).
children.label: URN

children.hasDefinition: The URI (URL or URN) of a data entity from the MIRIAM database.
children.comment: A MIRIAM URI consists of the URI of the MIRIAM data type (PubMed, UniProt etc) followed by the identifier of an element of that data type, for example PMID for a publication or an accession number for a GO term.
children.label: MIRIAM URI

children.hasDefinition: A string of characters that name or otherwise identify a resource on the Internet.
children.label: URI

children.hasDefinition: A text token, number or something else which identifies an entity, but which may not be persistent (stable) or unique (the same identifier may identify multiple things).
children.label: Identifier

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence and associated metadata.
children.label: Protein sequence record

children.hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and associated metadata.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence record

children.hasDefinition: A molecular sequence and associated metadata.
children.label: Sequence record

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence and associated metadata.
children.label: Protein sequence record

children.hasDefinition: One or more protein sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
children.label: Protein sequence

children.hasDefinition: A nucleic acid sequence and associated metadata.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence record

children.hasDefinition: A DNA sequence.
children.label: DNA sequence

children.hasDefinition: An RNA sequence.
children.label: RNA sequence

children.hasDefinition: One or more nucleic acid sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence

children.hasDefinition: One or more molecular sequences, possibly with associated annotation.
children.comment: This concept is a placeholder of concepts for primary sequence data including raw sequences and sequence records.  It should not normally be used for derivatives such as sequence alignments, motifs or profiles.
children.label: Sequence

children.hasDefinition: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.
children.comment: This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.
children.label: Sequence trace

children.hasDefinition: An assembly of fragments of a (typically genomic) DNA sequence.
children.comment: Typically, an assembly is a collection of contigs (for example ESTs and genomic DNA fragments) that are ordered, aligned and merged. Annotation of the assembled sequence might be included.
children.label: Sequence assembly

children.hasDefinition: Restriction digest fragments from digesting a nucleotide sequence with restriction sites using a restriction endonuclease.
children.label: Restriction digest

children.hasDefinition: Oligonucleotide primer(s) for PCR and DNA amplification, for example a minimal primer set.
children.label: PCR primers

children.hasDefinition: A cluster of nucleotide sequences.
children.comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple nucleotide sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.
children.label: Sequence set (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence cleaved into peptide fragments (by enzymatic or chemical cleavage) with fragment masses.
children.label: Proteolytic digest

children.hasDefinition: A cluster of protein sequences.
children.comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A report on peptide fragments of certain molecular weight(s) in one or more protein sequences.
children.label: Peptide molecular weight hits

children.hasDefinition: Any collection of multiple protein sequences and associated metadata that do not (typically) correspond to common sequence database records or database entries.
children.label: Sequence set (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A cluster of protein sequences.
children.comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster (protein)

children.hasDefinition: A cluster of nucleotide sequences.
children.comment: The sequences are typically related, for example a family of sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: A set of sequences that have been clustered or otherwise classified as belonging to a group including (typically) sequence cluster information.
children.comment: The cluster might include sequences identifiers, short descriptions, alignment and summary information.
children.label: Sequence cluster

children.hasDefinition: A collection of one or typically multiple molecular sequences (which can include derived data or metadata) that do not (typically) correspond to molecular sequence database records or entries and which (typically) are derived from some analytical method.
comment: An example is an alignment reference; one or a set of reference molecular sequences, structures, or profiles used for alignment of genomic, transcriptomic, or proteomic experimental data.
This concept may be used for arbitrary sequence sets and associated data arising from processing.
children.label: Sequence set

children.hasDefinition: How the annotation of a sequence feature (for example in EMBL or Swiss-Prot) was derived.
children.comment: This might be the name and version of a software tool, the name of a database, or 'curated' to indicate a manual annotation (made by a human).
children.label: Sequence feature source

children.hasDefinition: The type of a sequence feature, typically a term or accession from the Sequence Ontology, for example an EMBL or Swiss-Prot sequence feature key.
children.comment: A feature key indicates the biological nature of the feature or information about changes to or versions of the sequence.
children.label: Sequence feature key

children.hasDefinition: Typically one of the EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature qualifiers.
children.comment: Feature qualifiers hold information about a feature beyond that provided by the feature key and location.
children.label: Sequence feature qualifier

children.hasDefinition: A name of a sequence feature, e.g. the name of a feature to be displayed to an end-user. Typically an EMBL or Swiss-Prot feature label.
children.comment: A feature label identifies a feature of a sequence database entry. When used with the database name and the entry's primary accession number, it is a unique identifier of that feature.
children.label: Sequence feature label

children.hasDefinition: Metadata on sequence features.
children.label: Sequence features metadata

children.hasDefinition: A report of sequence hits and associated data from searching a database of sequences (for example a BLAST search). This will typically include a list of scores (often with statistical evaluation) and a set of alignments for the hits.
children.comment: The score list includes the alignment score, percentage of the query sequence matched, length of the database sequence entry in this alignment, identifier of the database sequence entry, excerpt of the database sequence entry description etc.
children.label: Sequence search results

children.hasDefinition: A report of hits from searching a database of some type.
children.label: Database search results

children.hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches ("hits") between sequences, sequence profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) and other types of sequence signatures.
comment: A "profile-profile alignment" is an alignment of two sequence profiles, each profile typically representing a sequence alignment.
A "sequence-profile alignment" is an alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

This includes reports of hits from a search of a protein secondary or domain database. Data associated with the search or alignment might also be included, e.g. ranked list of best-scoring sequences, a graphical representation of scores etc.
children.label: Sequence signature matches

children.hasDefinition: A nucleotide sequence motif.
children.label: Sequence motif (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: An amino acid sequence motif.
children.label: Sequence motif (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Any specific or conserved pattern (typically expressed as a regular expression) in a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence motif

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
children.label: Position frequency matrix

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
children.comment: Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).
children.label: Position weight matrix

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.
children.label: Information content matrix

children.hasDefinition: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.
children.label: Fingerprint

children.hasDefinition: A simple matrix of numbers, where each value (or column of values) is derived derived from analysis of the corresponding position in a sequence alignment.
children.label: Position-specific scoring matrix

children.hasDefinition: A profile HMM is a variant of a Hidden Markov model that is derived specifically from a set of (aligned) biological sequences. Profile HMMs provide the basis for a position-specific scoring system, which can be used to align sequences and search databases for related sequences.
children.label: Profile HMM

children.hasDefinition: Some type of statistical model representing a (typically multiple) sequence alignment.
children.label: Sequence profile

children.hasDefinition: Data concering concerning specific or conserved pattern in molecular sequences and the classifiers used for their identification, including sequence motifs, profiles or other diagnostic element.
children.comment: This can include metadata about a motif or sequence profile such as its name, length, technical details about the profile construction, and so on.
children.label: Sequence signature data

children.hasDefinition: Report on the location of matches ("hits") between sequences, sequence profiles, motifs (conserved or functional patterns) and other types of sequence signatures.
comment: A "profile-profile alignment" is an alignment of two sequence profiles, each profile typically representing a sequence alignment.
A "sequence-profile alignment" is an alignment of one or more molecular sequence(s) to one or more sequence profile(s) (each profile typically representing a sequence alignment).

This includes reports of hits from a search of a protein secondary or domain database. Data associated with the search or alignment might also be included, e.g. ranked list of best-scoring sequences, a graphical representation of scores etc.
children.label: Sequence signature matches

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of exactly two molecular sequences.
children.label: Pair sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple protein sequences.
children.label: Protein sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences of different types.
children.comment: Hybrid sequence alignments include for example genomic DNA to EST, cDNA or mRNA.
children.label: Hybrid sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of multiple molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more proteins.
children.label: Protein secondary structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more RNA molecules.
children.label: RNA secondary structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment of the (1D representations of) secondary structure of two or more molecules.
children.label: Secondary structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of exactly two molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Structure alignment (pair)

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of protein tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Protein structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of RNA tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: RNA structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of DNA tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: DNA structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: Alignment (superimposition) of molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
children.comment: A tertiary structure alignment will include the untransformed coordinates of one macromolecule, followed by the second (or subsequent) structure(s) with all the coordinates transformed (by rotation / translation) to give a superposition.
children.label: Structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: A 3D profile-3D profile alignment (each profile representing structures or a structure alignment).
children.label: Structural (3D) profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: An alignment of molecular sequence to structure (from threading sequence(s) through 3D structure or representation of structure(s)).
children.label: Sequence-structure alignment

children.hasDefinition: An alignment of molecular sequences, structures or profiles derived from them.
children.label: Alignment

children.hasDefinition: Sequence identity is the number (%) of matches (identical characters) in positions from an alignment of two molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence identity

children.hasDefinition: A score derived from the alignment of two sequences, which is then normalised with respect to the scoring system.
children.comment: Bit scores are normalised with respect to the scoring system and therefore can be used to compare alignment scores from different searches.
children.label: Bit score

children.hasDefinition: Sequence similarity is the similarity (expressed as a percentage) of two molecular sequences calculated from their alignment, a scoring matrix for scoring characters substitutions and penalties for gap insertion and extension.
children.comment: Data Type is float probably.
children.label: Sequence similarity

children.hasDefinition: A value representing molecular sequence similarity.
children.label: Sequence similarity score

children.hasDefinition: Root-mean-square deviation (RMSD) is calculated to measure the average distance between superimposed macromolecular coordinates.
children.label: Root-mean-square deviation

children.hasDefinition: A measure of the similarity between two ligand fingerprints.
children.comment: A ligand fingerprint is derived from ligand structural data from a Protein DataBank file. It reflects the elements or groups present or absent, covalent bonds and bond orders and the bonded environment in terms of SATIS codes and BLEEP atom types.
children.label: Tanimoto similarity score

children.hasDefinition: A value representing molecular structure similarity, measured from structure alignment or some other type of structure comparison.
children.label: Structure similarity score

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the lower or upper limit of an expectation value (E-value).
children.comment: An expectation value (E-Value) is the expected number of observations which are at least as extreme as observations expected to occur by random chance. The E-value describes the number of hits with a given score or better that are expected to occur at random when searching a database of a particular size. It decreases exponentially with the score (S) of a hit. A low E value indicates a more significant score.
children.label: E-value

children.hasDefinition: The z-value is the number of standard deviations a data value is above or below a mean value.
children.comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
children.label: Z-value

children.hasDefinition: The P-value is the probability of obtaining by random chance a result that is at least as extreme as an observed result, assuming a NULL hypothesis is true.
children.comment: A z-value might be specified as a threshold for reporting hits from database searches.
children.label: P-value

children.hasDefinition: A score derived from the P-value to ensure correction for multiple tests. The Q-value provides an estimate of the positive False Discovery Rate (pFDR), i.e. the rate of false positives among all the cases reported positive: pFDR = FP / (FP + TP).
children.comment: Q-values are widely used in high-throughput data analysis (e.g. detection of differentially expressed genes from transcriptome data).
children.label: Q-value

children.hasDefinition: A value representing estimated statistical significance of some observed data; typically sequence database hits.
children.label: Statistical estimate score

children.hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for opening gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Terminal gap opening penalty

children.hasDefinition: A penalty for opening a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap opening penalty

children.hasDefinition: A number defining the penalty for extending gaps at the termini of an alignment, either from the N/C terminal of protein or 5'/3' terminal of nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Terminal gap extension penalty

children.hasDefinition: A penalty for extending a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap extension penalty

children.hasDefinition: A penalty for gaps that are close together in an alignment.
children.label: Gap separation penalty

children.hasDefinition: A penalty for introducing or extending a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Gap penalty

children.hasDefinition: The score for a 'match' used in various sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.
children.label: Match reward score

children.hasDefinition: The score (penalty) for a 'mismatch' used in various alignment and sequence database search applications with simple scoring schemes.
children.label: Mismatch penalty score

children.hasDefinition: This is the threshold drop in score at which extension of word alignment is halted.
children.label: Drop off score

children.hasDefinition: A simple floating point number defining the penalty for opening or extending a gap in an alignment.
children.label: Alignment score or penalty

children.hasDefinition: Score for localization of one or more post-translational modifications in peptide sequence measured by mass spectrometry.
children.label: Localisation score

children.hasDefinition: A numerical value, that is some type of scored value arising for example from a prediction method.
children.label: Score

children.hasDefinition: A dotplot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.
children.label: Dotplot

children.hasDefinition: A plot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.
children.comment: Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
children.label: Sequence similarity plot

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a DNA sequence assembly.
children.comment: This might include an overall quality assement of the assembly and summary statistics including counts, average length and number of bases for reads, matches and non-matches, contigs, reads in pairs etc.
children.label: Sequence assembly report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular sequence alignment-derived data or metadata.
children.comment: Use this for any computer-generated reports on sequence alignments, and for general information (metadata) on a sequence alignment, such as a description, sequence identifiers and alignment score.
children.label: Sequence alignment report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report of molecular tertiary structure alignment-derived data.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Structure alignment report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on a specific protein family or other classification or group of protein sequences or structures.
children.label: Protein family report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.
children.comment: This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.
children.label: Protein features

children.hasDefinition: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.
children.comment: Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.
children.label: Protein structural quality report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.
children.label: Protein structure report

children.hasDefinition: An informative human-readable report about one or more specific protein molecules or protein structural domains, derived from analysis of primary (sequence or structural) data.
children.label: Protein report

children.hasDefinition: A report on predicted or actual gene structure, regions which make an RNA product and features such as promoters, coding regions, splice sites etc.
hasExactSynonym: Nucleic acid features (gene and transcript structure)
children.comment: This includes any report on a particular locus or gene.  This might include the gene name, description, summary and so on. It can include details about the function of a gene, such as its encoded protein or a functional classification of the gene sequence along according to the encoded protein(s).
children.label: Gene report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific chromosome.
children.comment: This includes basic information. e.g. chromosome number, length, karyotype features, chromosome sequence etc.
children.label: Chromosome report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the linkage of alleles.
children.comment: This includes linkage disequilibrium; the non-random association of alleles or polymorphisms at two or more loci (not necessarily on the same chromosome).
children.label: Genetic linkage report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about RNA/DNA folding, minimum folding energies for DNA or RNA sequences, energy landscape of RNA mutants etc.
children.label: Nucleic acid folding report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific RNA family or other group of classified RNA sequences.
children.label: RNA family report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a particular family of genes, typically a set of genes with similar sequence that originate from duplication of a common ancestor gene, or any other classification of nucleic acid sequences or structures that reflects gene structure.
children.comment: This includes reports on on gene homologues between species.
children.label: Gene family report

children.comment: The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data, or any annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s) or such structures in general.
children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific nucleic acid molecules.
children.label: Nucleic acid report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the influence of genotype on drug response.
children.comment: The report might correlate gene expression or single-nucleotide polymorphisms with drug efficacy or toxicity.
children.label: Pharmacogenomic test report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific disease.
children.comment: For example, an informative report on a specific tumor including nature and origin of the sample, anatomic site, organ or tissue, tumor type, including morphology and/or histologic type, and so on.
children.label: Disease report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about the set of genes (or allelic forms) present in an individual, organism or cell and associated with a specific physical characteristic, or a report concerning an organisms traits and phenotypes.
children.label: Genotype/phenotype report

children.hasDefinition: Basic information, annotation or documentation concerning a workflow (but not the workflow itself).
children.label: Workflow metadata

children.hasDefinition: Basic information on bioinformatics database(s) or other data sources such as name, type, description, URL etc.
children.label: Database metadata

children.hasDefinition: Basic information about one or more bioinformatics applications or packages, such as name, type, description, or other documentation.
children.label: Tool metadata

children.hasDefinition: Textual metadata on a software author or end-user, for example a person or other software.
children.label: User metadata

children.hasDefinition: Basic information on any arbitrary database entry.
children.label: Database entry metadata

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a biological ontology.
children.label: Ontology metadata

children.hasDefinition: Metadata concerning the software, hardware or other aspects of a computer system.
children.label: System metadata

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on a biological sample, for example experimental factors and their values.
children.comment: This might include compound and dose in a dose response experiment.
children.label: Sample annotation

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning or describing some core computational resource, as distinct from primary data.  This includes metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Resource metadata

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning an analysis of an index of biological data.
children.label: Data index report

children.comment: A drug structure relationship map is report (typically a map diagram) of drug structure relationships.
children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific drug.
children.label: Drug report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific chemical compound.
children.label: Small molecule report

children.hasDefinition: Report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.
children.comment: Model validation might involve checks for atomic packing, steric clashes, agreement with electron density maps etc.
children.label: Protein structural quality report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific protein 3D structure(s) or structural domains.
children.label: Protein structure report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific carbohydrate 3D structure(s).
children.label: Carbohydrate report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more specific lipid 3D structure(s).
children.label: Lipid report

children.comment: The report may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data, or any annotation or information about specific nucleic acid 3D structure(s) or such structures in general.
children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about regions within a nucleic acid sequence which form secondary or tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.  It might include annotation on the structure, a computer-generated report of analysis of structural data, and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.
children.label: Structure report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a particular strain of organism cell line including plants, virus, fungi and bacteria. The data typically includes strain number, organism type, growth conditions, source and so on.
children.label: Cell line report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning a genome as a whole.
children.label: Genome report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about a specific organism.
children.label: Organism report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information resulting from text mining.
children.comment: A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.
children.label: Text mining report

children.hasDefinition: A report on sequence complexity, for example low-complexity or repeat regions in sequences.
children.label: Sequence complexity report

children.hasDefinition: A report on ambiguity in molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Sequence ambiguity report

children.hasDefinition: A plot of third base position variability in a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Base position variability plot

children.hasDefinition: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Base frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Base word frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.
children.label: Amino acid frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.
children.label: Amino acid word frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence composition plot

children.hasDefinition: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Nucleic acid density plot

children.hasDefinition: A report (typically a table) on character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence(s).
children.label: Sequence composition report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about non-positional sequence features, typically a report on general molecular sequence properties derived from sequence analysis.
children.label: Sequence property

children.hasDefinition: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Restriction map

children.hasDefinition: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).
children.label: Sequence trace image

children.hasDefinition: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.
children.label: Sequence image

children.hasDefinition: An informative report of information about molecular sequence(s), including basic information (metadata), and reports generated from molecular sequence analysis, including positional features and non-positional properties.
children.label: Sequence report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved protein sequence pattern.
children.label: Protein signature

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved nucleic acid sequence pattern.
children.label: Nucleic acid signature

children.hasDefinition: An informative report about a specific or conserved pattern in a molecular sequence, such as its context in genes or proteins, its role, origin or method of construction, etc.
children.label: Sequence signature report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about about how a scientific experiment or analysis was carried out that results in a specific set of data or results used for further analysis or to test a specific hypothesis.
children.label: Protocol

children.hasDefinition: An informative report concerning or derived from the analysis of a biological pathway or network, such as a map (diagram) or annotation.
children.label: Pathway or network report

children.hasDefinition: Any data concerning a specific biological or biomedical image.
children.comment: This can include basic provenance and technical information about the image, scientific annotation and so on.
children.label: Image metadata

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning a clinical trial.
children.label: Clinical trial report

children.hasDefinition: A report about a biosample.
children.label: Reference sample report

children.hasDefinition: Information about the ability of an organism to cause disease in a corresponding host.
children.label: Pathogenicity report

children.hasDefinition: Information about the biosafety classification of an organism according to corresponding law.
children.label: Biosafety classification

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information concerning biosafety data.
children.label: Biosafety report

children.hasDefinition: A report about localisation of the isolaton of biological material e.g. country or coordinates.
children.label: Geographic location

children.hasDefinition: A report about any kind of isolation source of biological material e.g. blood, water, soil.
children.label: Isolation source

children.hasDefinition: A report about any kind of isolation of biological material.
children.label: Isolation report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable systematic collection of patient (or population) health information in a digital format.
children.label: Electronic health record

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information about about how a scientific experiment or analysis was carried out that results in a specific set of data or results used for further analysis or to test a specific hypothesis.
children.label: Quality control report

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information including annotation on a biological entity or phenomena, computer-generated reports of analysis of primary data (e.g. sequence or structural), and metadata (data about primary data) or any other free (essentially unformatted) text, as distinct from the primary data itself.
children.comment: You can use this term by default for any textual report, in case you can't find another, more specific term. Reports may be generated automatically or collated by hand and can include metadata on the origin, source, history, ownership or location of some thing.
children.label: Report

children.hasDefinition: Gene frequencies data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
children.label: Phylogenetic gene frequencies data

children.hasDefinition: Continuous quantitative data that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
children.label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative data

children.hasDefinition: Character data with discrete states that may be read during phylogenetic tree calculation.
children.label: Phylogenetic discrete data

children.hasDefinition: Basic character data from which a phylogenetic tree may be generated.
children.comment: As defined, this concept would also include molecular sequences, microsatellites, polymorphisms (RAPDs, RFLPs, or AFLPs), restriction sites and fragments
children.label: Phylogenetic character data

children.hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that is an estimate of the character's phylogeny.
children.label: Gene tree

children.hasDefinition: A phylogenetic tree that reflects phylogeny of the taxa from which the characters (used in calculating the tree) were sampled.
children.label: Species tree

children.hasDefinition: The raw data (not just an image) from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted, such as topology, lengths (in time or in expected amounts of variance) and a confidence interval for each length.
children.comment: A phylogenetic tree is usually constructed from a set of sequences from which an alignment (or data matrix) is calculated. See also 'Phylogenetic tree image'.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree

children.hasDefinition: One or more cliques of mutually compatible characters that are generated, for example from analysis of discrete character data, and are used to generate a phylogeny.
children.label: Phylogenetic character cliques

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic invariants data for testing alternative tree topologies.
children.label: Phylogenetic invariants

children.hasDefinition: Distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree distances

children.hasDefinition: Independent contrasts for characters used in a phylogenetic tree, or covariances, regressions and correlations between characters for those contrasts.
children.label: Phylogenetic character contrasts

children.hasDefinition: Weights for sequence positions or characters in phylogenetic analysis where zero is defined as unweighted.
children.label: Phylogenetic character weights

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning phylogeny, typically of molecular sequences, including reports of information concerning or derived from a phylogenetic tree, or from comparing two or more phylogenetic trees.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Phylogenetic data

children.hasDefinition: A matrix of estimated evolutionary distance between molecular sequences, such as is suitable for phylogenetic tree calculation.
children.comment: Methods might perform character compatibility analysis or identify patterns of similarity in an alignment or data matrix.
children.label: Sequence distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.
children.label: Protein distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: Distances (values representing similarity) between a group of molecular structures.
children.label: Structural distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between molecular entities, where a value (distance) is (typically) derived from comparison of two entities and reflects their similarity.
children.label: Distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for nucleotide comparison.
children.label: Comparison matrix (nucleotide)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.
children.label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid or nucleotide sequence comparison.
children.comment: The comparison matrix might include matrix name, optional comment, height and width (or size) of matrix, an index row/column (of characters) and data rows/columns (of integers or floats).
children.label: Comparison matrix

children.hasDefinition: A matrix of 3D-1D scores reflecting the probability of amino acids to occur in different tertiary structural environments.
children.label: 3D-1D scoring matrix

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of values used for scoring sequence-structure compatibility.
children.label: Protein sequence-structure scoring matrix

children.hasDefinition: A table of base frequencies of a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Base frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of word composition of a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Base word frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of amino acid frequencies of a protein sequence.
children.label: Amino acid frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A table of amino acid word composition of a protein sequence.
children.label: Amino acid word frequencies table

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is a simple matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
children.label: Position frequency matrix

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) that is weighted matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position.
children.comment: Contributions of individual sequences to the matrix might be uneven (weighted).
children.label: Position weight matrix

children.hasDefinition: A profile (typically representing a sequence alignment) derived from a matrix of nucleotide (or amino acid) counts per position that reflects information content at each position.
children.label: Information content matrix

children.hasDefinition: One or more fingerprints (sequence classifiers) as used in the PRINTS database.
children.label: Fingerprint

children.hasDefinition: A simple matrix of numbers, where each value (or column of values) is derived derived from analysis of the corresponding position in a sequence alignment.
children.label: Position-specific scoring matrix

children.hasDefinition: Matrix to transform (rotate/translate) 3D coordinates, typically the transformation necessary to superimpose two molecular structures.
children.label: Structural transformation matrix

children.hasDefinition: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)

children.hasDefinition: Molecular weights of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (molecular weight)

children.hasDefinition: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)

children.hasDefinition: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)

children.hasDefinition: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.
children.label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)

children.hasDefinition: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index

children.hasDefinition: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.
children.comment: This combines data from all hybridisations.
children.label: Gene expression matrix

children.hasDefinition: A HMM transition matrix contains the probabilities of switching from one HMM state to another.
children.comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The transition matrix will hold the probabilities of switching from the AT-rich to the GC-rich state, and vica versa.
children.label: Transition matrix

children.hasDefinition: A HMM emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in each of the states of a HMM.
children.comment: Consider for example an HMM with two states (AT-rich and GC-rich).  The emission matrix holds the probabilities of choosing each of the four nucleotides (A, C, G and T) in the AT-rich state and in the GC-rich state.
children.label: Emission matrix

children.hasDefinition: Multiple gene identifiers in a specific order.
children.comment: Such data are often used for genome rearrangement tools and phylogenetic tree labeling.
children.label: Gene order

children.hasDefinition: A table of unnormalized values representing summarised read counts per genomic region (e.g. gene, transcript, peak).
children.label: Count matrix

children.hasDefinition: An array of numerical values.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Matrix

children.hasDefinition: An informative report of secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.
children.comment: This includes thermodynamically stable or evolutionarily conserved structures such as knots, pseudoknots etc.
children.label: RNA secondary structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a tRNA tertiary (3D) structure, including tmRNA, snoRNAs etc.
children.label: tRNA structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for an RNA tertiary (3D) structure.
children.label: RNA structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a DNA tertiary (3D) structure.
children.label: DNA structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a nucleic acid tertiary (3D) structure.
children.label: Nucleic acid structure

children.hasDefinition: The structure of a protein in complex with a ligand, typically a small molecule such as an enzyme substrate or cofactor, but possibly another macromolecule.
children.comment: This includes interactions of proteins with atoms, ions and small molecules or macromolecules such as nucleic acids or other polypeptides.  For stable inter-polypeptide interactions use 'Protein complex' instead.
children.label: Protein-ligand complex

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a polypeptide chain.
children.label: Protein chain

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the tertiary (3D) structure of a protein domain.
children.label: Protein domain

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure (typically C-alpha atoms only).
