children.comment: C-beta atoms from amino acid side-chains may be included.
children.label: C-alpha trace

children.hasDefinition: Data on a single atom from a protein structure.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein atom

children.hasDefinition: Data on a single amino acid residue position in a protein structure.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein residue

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a multi-protein complex; two or more polypeptides chains in a stable, functional association with one another.
children.label: Protein complex

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein (3D) structural motif; any group of contiguous or non-contiguous amino acid residues but typically those forming a feature with a structural or functional role.
children.label: Protein structural motif

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a protein tertiary (3D) structure, or part of a structure, possibly in complex with other molecules.
children.label: Protein structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a carbohydrate (3D) structure.
children.label: Carbohydrate structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a drug.
children.label: Drug structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a toxin.
children.label: Toxin structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for the (3D) structure of a small molecule, such as any common chemical compound.
children.label: Small molecule structure

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a lipid structure.
children.label: Lipid structure

children.hasDefinition: Structural 3D model (volume map) from electron microscopy.
children.label: 3D EM Map

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on a structural 3D EM Map from electron microscopy. This might include one or several locations in the map of the known features of a particular macromolecule.
children.label: 3D EM Mask

children.hasDefinition: 3D coordinate and associated data for a macromolecular tertiary (3D) structure or part of a structure.
children.comment: The coordinate data may be predicted or real.
children.label: Structure

children.hasDefinition: Some type of structural (3D) profile or template (representing a structure or structure alignment).
children.label: Structural profile

children.hasDefinition: Mass of a molecule.
children.label: Molecular mass

children.hasDefinition: Net charge of a molecule.
children.label: Molecular charge

children.hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure in SMILES format.
children.label: SMILES string

children.hasDefinition: A specification of a chemical structure.
children.label: Chemical formula

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR constitutional descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor (constitutional)

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR electronic descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor (electronic)

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR geometrical descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor (geometrical)

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR topological descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor (topological)

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR molecular descriptor.
children.label: QSAR descriptor (molecular)

children.hasDefinition: A QSAR quantitative descriptor (name-value pair) of chemical structure.
children.comment: QSAR descriptors have numeric values that quantify chemical information encoded in a symbolic representation of a molecule. They are used in quantitative structure activity relationship (QSAR) applications. Many subtypes of individual descriptors (not included in EDAM) cover various types of protein properties.
children.label: QSAR descriptor

children.hasDefinition: The concentration of a chemical compound.
children.label: Concentration

children.hasDefinition: General data for a molecule.
children.label: Molecular property (general)

children.hasDefinition: A matrix of distances between amino acid residues (for example the C-alpha atoms) in a protein structure.
children.label: Protein distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: An amino acid residue contact map for a protein structure.
children.label: Protein contact map

children.hasDefinition: Report on clusters of contacting residues in protein structures such as a key structural residue network.
children.label: Protein residue 3D cluster

children.hasDefinition: Patterns of hydrogen bonding in protein structures.
children.label: Protein hydrogen bonds

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on protein-ligand (small molecule) interaction(s).
children.label: Protein-ligand interaction report

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the interactions (predicted or known) within or between a protein, structural domain or part of a protein. This includes intra- and inter-residue contacts and distances, as well as interactions with other proteins and non-protein entities such as nucleic acid, metal atoms, water, ions etc.
children.label: Protein interaction data

children.hasDefinition: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.
children.label: Vmax

children.hasDefinition: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.
children.label: Km

children.hasDefinition: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.
children.label: Michaelis Menten plot

children.hasDefinition: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).
children.label: Hanes Woolf plot

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Enzyme kinetics data

children.hasDefinition: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.
children.label: Peptide identification

children.hasDefinition: List of molecular weight(s) of one or more proteins or peptides, for example cut by proteolytic enzymes or reagents.
children.comment: The report might include associated data such as frequency of peptide fragment molecular weights.
children.label: Peptide molecular weights

children.hasDefinition: Report on the hydrophobic moment of a polypeptide sequence.
children.comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
children.label: Peptide hydrophobic moment

children.hasDefinition: The aliphatic index of a protein.
children.comment: The aliphatic index is the relative protein volume occupied by aliphatic side chains.
children.label: Protein aliphatic index

children.hasDefinition: A protein sequence with annotation on hydrophobic or hydrophilic / charged regions, hydrophobicity plot etc.
children.comment: Hydrophobic moment is a peptides hydrophobicity measured for different angles of rotation.
children.label: Protein sequence hydropathy plot

children.hasDefinition: The solubility or atomic solvation energy of a protein sequence or structure.
children.label: Protein solubility

children.hasDefinition: Data on the crystallizability of a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein crystallizability

children.hasDefinition: Data on the stability, intrinsic disorder or globularity of a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein globularity

children.hasDefinition: A report on protein properties concerning hydropathy.
children.label: Protein hydropathy data

children.hasDefinition: A plot of the mean charge of the amino acids within a window of specified length as the window is moved along a protein sequence.
children.label: Protein charge plot

children.hasDefinition: The titration curve of a protein.
children.label: Protein titration curve

children.hasDefinition: The isoelectric point of one proteins.
children.label: Protein isoelectric point

children.hasDefinition: The pKa value of a protein.
children.label: Protein pKa value

children.hasDefinition: The hydrogen exchange rate of a protein.
children.label: Protein hydrogen exchange rate

children.hasDefinition: The extinction coefficient of a protein.
children.label: Protein extinction coefficient

children.hasDefinition: The optical density of a protein.
children.label: Protein optical density

children.hasDefinition: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.
children.label: Hopp and Woods plot

children.hasDefinition: An report on allergenicity / immunogenicity of peptides and proteins.
children.comment: This includes data on peptide ligands that elicit an immune response (immunogens), allergic cross-reactivity, predicted antigenicity (Hopp and Woods plot) etc. These data are useful in the development of peptide-specific antibodies or multi-epitope vaccines. Methods might use sequence data (for example motifs) and / or structural data.
children.label: Peptide immunogenicity data

children.hasDefinition: Data on the solvent accessible or buried surface area of a protein structure.
children.comment: This concept covers definitions of the protein surface, interior and interfaces, accessible and buried residues, surface accessible pockets, interior inaccessible cavities etc.
children.label: Protein solvent accessibility

children.hasDefinition: Phi/psi angle data or a Ramachandran plot of a protein structure.
children.label: Ramachandran plot

children.hasDefinition: Geometry data for a protein structure, for example bond lengths, bond angles, torsion angles, chiralities, planaraties etc.
children.label: Protein geometry data

children.hasDefinition: Data on the net charge distribution (dipole moment) of a protein structure.
children.label: Protein dipole moment

children.hasDefinition: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.
children.label: Protein ionisation curve

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the properties or features of one or more protein secondary structures.
children.label: Protein secondary structure

children.hasDefinition: Rate of association of a protein with another protein or some other molecule.
children.label: Rate of association

children.hasDefinition: A plot in which community data (e.g. species abundance data) is summarised.  Similar species and samples are plotted close together, and dissimilar species and samples are plotted placed far apart.
children.label: Ordination plot

children.hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a protein molecule or model.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  Data may be based on analysis of nucleic acid sequence or structural data, for example reports on the surface properties (shape, hydropathy, electrostatic patches etc) of a protein structure, protein flexibility or motion, and protein architecture (spatial arrangement of secondary structure).
children.label: Protein property

comment: Nucleic acid melting curve: a melting curve of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Shows the proportion of nucleic acid which are double-stranded versus temperature.

Nucleic acid probability profile: a probability profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Shows the probability of a base pair not being melted (i.e. remaining as double-stranded DNA) at a specified temperature

Nucleic acid stitch profile: stitch profile of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA). A stitch profile diagram shows partly melted DNA conformations (with probabilities) at a range of temperatures. For example, a stitch profile might show possible loop openings with their location, size, probability and fluctuations at a given temperature.
Nucleic acid temperature profile: a temperature profile of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or DNA/RNA). Plots melting temperature versus base position.
A melting (stability) profile calculated the free energy required to unwind and separate the nucleic acid strands, plotted for sliding windows over a sequence.
children.hasDefinition: Data on the dissociation characteristics of a double-stranded nucleic acid molecule (DNA or a DNA/RNA hybrid) during heating.
children.label: Nucleic acid melting profile

children.hasDefinition: Enthalpy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid enthalpy

children.hasDefinition: Entropy of hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA).
children.label: Nucleic acid entropy

children.hasDefinition: A temperature concerning nucleic acid denaturation, typically the temperature at which the two strands of a hybridised or double stranded nucleic acid (DNA or RNA/DNA) molecule separate.
children.label: Nucleic acid melting temperature

children.hasDefinition: A thermodynamic or kinetic property of a nucleic acid molecule.
children.label: Nucleic acid thermodynamic data

children.hasDefinition: DNA base pair stacking energies data.
children.label: DNA base pair stacking energies data

children.hasDefinition: DNA base pair twist angle data.
children.label: DNA base pair twist angle data

children.hasDefinition: DNA base trimer roll angles data.
children.label: DNA base trimer roll angles data

children.hasDefinition: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.
children.comment: Such as generated by the Vienna package.
children.label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot

children.hasDefinition: Physicochemical property data for one or more dinucleotides.
children.label: Dinucleotide property

children.hasDefinition: Structural data for DNA base pairs or runs of bases, such as energy or angle data.
children.label: DNA base structural data

comment: Nucleic acid structural properties stiffness, curvature, twist/roll data or other conformational parameters or properties.
This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.hasDefinition: A report of primarily non-positional data describing intrinsic physical, chemical or other properties of a nucleic acid molecule.
children.label: Nucleic acid property

children.hasDefinition: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.
children.comment: A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.
children.label: Peptide mass fingerprint

children.hasDefinition: Protein or peptide identifications with evidence supporting the identifications, for example from comparing a peptide mass fingerprint (from mass spectrometry) to a sequence database, or  the set of typical spectra one obtains when running a protein through a mass spectrometer.
children.label: Peptide identification

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning small peptides.
children.label: Peptide property

children.hasDefinition: Matrix of integer or floating point numbers for amino acid comparison.
children.label: Comparison matrix (amino acid)

children.hasDefinition: Chemical classification (small, aliphatic, aromatic, polar, charged etc) of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (chemical classes)

children.hasDefinition: Molecular weights of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (molecular weight)

children.hasDefinition: Hydrophobic, hydrophilic or charge properties of amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (hydropathy)

children.hasDefinition: Experimental free energy values for the water-interface and water-octanol transitions for the amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index (White-Wimley data)

children.hasDefinition: Van der Waals radii of atoms for different amino acid residues.
children.label: Amino acid index (van der Waals radii)

children.hasDefinition: A table of 20 numerical values which quantify a property (e.g. physicochemical or biochemical) of the common amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid index

children.hasDefinition: Statistical protein contact potentials.
children.label: Amino acid pair-wise contact potentials

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all amino acids.
children.label: Amino acid property

children.hasDefinition: Cartesian coordinate of an atom (in a molecular structure).
children.label: Atomic coordinate

children.hasDefinition: The fraction of an atom type present at a site in a molecular structure.
children.comment: The sum of the occupancies of all the atom types at a site should not normally significantly exceed 1.0.
children.label: Atomic occupancy

children.hasDefinition: Isotropic B factor (atomic displacement parameter) for an atom from a PDB file.
children.label: Isotropic B factor

children.hasDefinition: Data for an atom (in a molecular structure).
children.label: Atomic property

children.hasDefinition: A conformational energy map of the glycosidic linkages in a carbohydrate molecule.
children.label: Carbohydrate conformational map

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the intrinsic physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of one, more or all carbohydrates.
children.label: Carbohydrate property

children.hasDefinition: A report on the physical (e.g. structural) or chemical properties of molecules, or parts of a molecule.
children.label: Molecular property

children.hasDefinition: Protein-protein interaction data from for example yeast two-hybrid analysis, protein microarrays, immunoaffinity chromatography followed by mass spectrometry, phage display etc.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein interaction raw data

children.hasDefinition: Fluorescence trace data generated by an automated DNA sequencer, which can be interprted as a molecular sequence (reads), given associated sequencing metadata such as base-call quality scores.
children.comment: This is the raw data produced by a DNA sequencing machine.
children.label: Sequence trace

children.hasDefinition: Radiation hybrid scores (RH) scores for one or more markers.
children.comment: Radiation Hybrid (RH) scores are used in Radiation Hybrid mapping.
children.label: RH scores

children.hasDefinition: X-ray crystallography data.
children.label: Electron density map

children.hasDefinition: Nuclear magnetic resonance (NMR) raw data, typically for a protein.
children.label: Raw NMR data

children.hasDefinition: Protein secondary structure from protein coordinate or circular dichroism (CD) spectroscopic data.
children.label: CD spectra

children.hasDefinition: Raw data from experimental methods for determining protein structure.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Protein structure raw data

children.hasDefinition: Volume map data from electron microscopy.
children.label: Volume map

children.hasDefinition: Spectra from mass spectrometry.
children.label: Mass spectrum

children.hasDefinition: A set of peptide masses (peptide mass fingerprint) from mass spectrometry.
children.comment: A molecular weight standard fingerprint is standard protonated molecular masses e.g. from trypsin (modified porcine trypsin, Promega) and keratin peptides.
children.label: Peptide mass fingerprint

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a mass spectrometry measurement.
children.label: Mass spectrometry data

children.hasDefinition: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.
children.comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.
children.label: Raw microarray data

children.hasDefinition: Experimentally determined parameter of the physiology of an organism, e.g. substrate spectrum.
children.label: Physiology parameter

children.hasDefinition: Experimentally determined parameter of the morphology of an organism, e.g. size & shape.
children.label: Morphology parameter

children.hasDefinition: Experimental determined parameter for the cultivation of an organism.
children.label: Cultivation parameter

children.hasDefinition: Raw data such as measurements or other results from laboratory experiments, as generated from laboratory hardware.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types. It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation.
children.label: Experimental measurement

children.hasDefinition: Table of codon usage data calculated from one or more nucleic acid sequences.
children.comment: A codon usage table might include the codon usage table name, optional comments and a table with columns for codons and corresponding codon usage data. A genetic code can be extracted from or represented by a codon usage table.
children.label: Codon usage table

children.hasDefinition: A genetic code for an organism.
children.comment: A genetic code need not include detailed codon usage information.
children.label: Genetic code

children.hasDefinition: A plot of the synonymous codon usage calculated for windows over a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Codon usage bias plot

children.hasDefinition: The differences in codon usage fractions between two codon usage tables.
children.label: Codon usage fraction difference

children.hasDefinition: A numerical measure of differences in the frequency of occurrence of synonymous codons in DNA sequences.
children.label: Codon usage bias

children.hasDefinition: Data derived from analysis of codon usage (typically a codon usage table) of DNA sequences.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Codon usage data

children.hasDefinition: Output from a serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), massively parallel signature sequencing (MPSS) or sequencing by synthesis (SBS) experiment.  In all cases this is a list of short sequence tags and the number of times it is observed.
comment: SAGE, MPSS and SBS experiments are usually performed to study gene expression.  The sequence tags are typically subsequently annotated (after a database search) with the mRNA (and therefore gene) the tag was extracted from.
This includes tag to gene assignments (tag mapping) of SAGE, MPSS and SBS data. Typically this is the sequencing-based expression profile annotated with gene identifiers.
children.label: Sequence tag profile

children.hasDefinition: Data quantifying the level of expression of (typically) multiple genes, derived for example from microarray experiments.
children.label: Gene expression profile

children.hasDefinition: A graphical 2D tabular representation of expression data, typically derived from an omics experiment. A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different features and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell colour represents the level of expression of a gene that context.
children.label: Heat map

children.hasDefinition: Groupings of expression profiles according to a clustering algorithm.
children.label: Clustered expression profiles

children.hasDefinition: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.
children.label: Microarray spots image

children.hasDefinition: General annotation on an oligonucleotide probe, or a set of probes.
children.label: Oligonucleotide probe annotation

children.hasDefinition: Annotation on the array itself used in a microarray experiment.
children.comment: This might include gene identifiers, genomic coordinates, probe oligonucleotide sequences etc.
children.label: Microarray metadata

children.hasDefinition: Raw data (typically MIAME-compliant) for hybridisations from a microarray experiment.
children.comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix CEL or GPR files.
children.label: Raw microarray data

children.hasDefinition: Data generated from processing and analysis of probe set data from a microarray experiment.
children.comment: Such data as found in Affymetrix .CHP files or data from other software such as RMA or dChip.
children.label: Processed microarray data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the hybridisations measured during a microarray experiment.
children.label: Microarray hybridisation data

children.hasDefinition: The final processed (normalised) data for a set of hybridisations in a microarray experiment.
children.comment: This combines data from all hybridisations.
children.label: Gene expression matrix

children.hasDefinition: Image, hybridisation or some other data arising from a study of feature/molecule expression, typically profiling or quantification.
children.label: Expression data

children.hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution used by hidden Markov model analysis programs.
children.label: Dirichlet distribution

children.hasDefinition: A profile HMM is a variant of a Hidden Markov model that is derived specifically from a set of (aligned) biological sequences. Profile HMMs provide the basis for a position-specific scoring system, which can be used to align sequences and search databases for related sequences.
children.label: Profile HMM

children.hasDefinition: A statistical Markov model of a system which is assumed to be a Markov process with unobserved (hidden) states.  For example, a hidden Markov model representation of a set or alignment of sequences.
children.label: Hidden Markov model

children.hasDefinition: A model of DNA substitution that explains a DNA sequence alignment, derived from phylogenetic tree analysis.
children.label: DNA substitution model

children.hasDefinition: Mathematical model of a network, that contains biochemical kinetics.
children.label: Kinetic model

children.hasDefinition: A biological model represented in mathematical terms.
children.label: Mathematical model

children.hasDefinition: A mapping of the accession numbers (or other database identifier) of entries between (typically) two biological or biomedical databases.
children.comment: The cross-mapping is typically a table where each row is an accession number and each column is a database being cross-referenced. The cells give the accession number or identifier of the corresponding entry in a database. If a cell in the table is not filled then no mapping could be found for the database. Additional information might be given on version, date etc.
children.label: Database cross-mapping

children.hasDefinition: A URI along with annotation describing the data found at the address.
children.label: Annotated URI

children.hasDefinition: A simple list of data identifiers (such as database accessions), possibly with additional basic information on the addressed data.
children.label: ID list

children.hasDefinition: A mapping of supplied textual terms or phrases to ontology concepts (URIs).
children.label: Ontology mapping

children.hasDefinition: Reference to a dataset (or a cross-reference between two datasets), typically one or more entries in a biological database or ontology.
children.comment: A list of database accessions or identifiers are usually included.
children.label: Data reference

children.hasDefinition: An index of a genome sequence.
children.comment: Many sequence alignment tasks involving many or very large sequences rely on a precomputed index of the sequence to accelerate the alignment.
children.label: Genome index

children.hasDefinition: An index of data of biological relevance.
children.label: Data index

children.hasDefinition: A word or phrase that can appear in the keywords field (KW line) of entries from the UniProt database.
children.label: UniProt keyword

children.hasDefinition: Keyword(s) or phrase(s) used (typically) for text-searching purposes.
children.comment: Boolean operators (AND, OR and NOT) and wildcard characters may be allowed.
children.label: Keyword

children.hasDefinition: Bibliographic data that uniquely identifies a scientific article, book or other published material.
children.comment: A bibliographic reference might include information such as authors, title, journal name, date and (possibly) a link to the abstract or full-text of the article if available.
children.label: Citation

children.hasDefinition: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.
children.label: Article

children.hasDefinition: A scientific text, typically a full text article from a scientific journal.
children.label: Article

children.hasDefinition: A text (such as a scientific article), annotated with notes, data and metadata, such as recognised entities, concepts, and their relations.
children.label: Annotated text

children.hasDefinition: Any free or plain text, typically for human consumption and in English. Can instantiate also as a textual search query.
children.label: Text

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable collection of information resulting from text mining.
children.comment: A text mining abstract will typically include an annotated a list of words or sentences extracted from one or more scientific articles.
children.label: Text mining report

children.hasDefinition: An abstract of a scientific article.
children.label: Abstract

children.hasDefinition: A list of publications such as scientic papers or books.
children.label: Bibliography

children.hasDefinition: A text (such as a scientific article), annotated with notes, data and metadata, such as recognised entities, concepts, and their relations.
children.label: Annotated text

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning, extracted from, or derived from the analysis of a scientific text (or texts) such as a full text article from a scientific journal.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.  It is primarily intended to help navigation of EDAM and would not typically be used for annotation. It includes concepts that are best described as scientific text or closely concerned with or derived from text.
children.label: Text data

children.hasDefinition: A residue identifier (a string) from a PDB file.
children.label: PDB residue number

children.hasDefinition: An insertion code (part of the residue number) for an amino acid residue from a PDB file.
children.label: PDB insertion code

children.hasDefinition: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.
children.comment: Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.
children.label: Cytoband position

children.hasDefinition: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.
children.comment: This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.
children.label: Sequence coordinates

children.hasDefinition: The number of a codon, for instance, at which a mutation is located.
children.label: Codon number

children.hasDefinition: A position of one or more points (base or residue) in a sequence, or part of such a specification.
children.label: Sequence position

children.hasDefinition: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.
children.comment: Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.
children.label: Cytoband position

children.hasDefinition: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.
children.comment: This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.
children.label: Sequence coordinates

children.hasDefinition: Specification of range(s) of sequence positions.
children.label: Sequence range

children.hasDefinition: The size (length) of a sequence, subsequence or region in a sequence, or range(s) of lengths.
children.label: Sequence length

children.hasDefinition: Information on an molecular sequence version.
children.label: Sequence version

children.hasDefinition: A fixed-size datum calculated (by using a hash function) for a molecular sequence, typically for purposes of error detection or indexing.
children.label: Sequence checksum

children.hasDefinition: An attribute of a molecular sequence, possibly in reference to some other sequence.
children.label: Sequence attribute

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table.
children.label: Feature table

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on features of a messenger RNA (mRNA) molecules including precursor RNA, primary (unprocessed) transcript and fully processed molecules. This includes reports on a specific gene transcript, clone or EST.
children.comment: This includes 5'untranslated region (5'UTR), coding sequences (CDS), exons, intervening sequences (intron) and 3'untranslated regions (3'UTR).
children.label: Gene transcript report

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a nucleotide sequence, formatted to be machine-readable.
children.comment: This includes nucleotide sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of nucleic acid features.
children.label: Nucleic acid features

children.hasDefinition: An informative report on intrinsic positional features of a protein sequence.
children.comment: This includes protein sequence feature annotation in any known sequence feature table format and any other report of protein features.
children.label: Protein features

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of one particular positional feature on a biomolecular (typically genome) sequence, suitable for import and display in a genome browser.
children.label: Annotation track

children.hasDefinition: Annotation of positional features of molecular sequence(s), i.e. that can be mapped to position(s) in the sequence.
children.comment: This includes annotation of positional sequence features, organised into a standard feature table, or any other report of sequence features.  General feature reports are a source of sequence feature table information although internal conversion would be required.
children.label: Sequence features

children.hasDefinition: A gene map showing distances between loci based on relative cotransduction frequencies.
children.label: DNA transduction map

children.hasDefinition: A genetic map which shows the approximate location of quantitative trait loci (QTL) between two or more markers.
children.label: QTL map

children.hasDefinition: A map of haplotypes in a genome or other sequence, describing common patterns of genetic variation.
children.label: Haplotype map

children.hasDefinition: A map showing the relative positions of genetic markers in a nucleic acid sequence, based on estimation of non-physical distance such as recombination frequencies.
children.comment: A genetic (linkage) map indicates the proximity of two genes on a chromosome, whether two genes are linked and the frequency they are transmitted together to an offspring. They are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
children.label: Genetic map

children.hasDefinition: Sequence map of a single gene annotated with genetic features such as introns, exons, untranslated regions, polyA signals, promoters, enhancers and (possibly) mutations defining alleles of a gene.
children.label: Gene map

children.hasDefinition: Sequence map of a plasmid (circular DNA).
children.label: Plasmid map

children.hasDefinition: Sequence map of a whole genome.
children.label: Genome map

children.hasDefinition: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Restriction map

children.hasDefinition: A map of genetic markers in a contiguous, assembled genomic sequence, with the sizes and separation of markers measured in base pairs.
children.comment: A sequence map typically includes annotation on significant subsequences such as contigs, haplotypes and genes. The contigs shown will (typically) be a set of small overlapping clones representing a complete chromosomal segment.
children.label: Sequence map

children.hasDefinition: A cytogenetic map showing chromosome banding patterns in mutant cell lines relative to the wild type.
children.comment: A cytogenetic map is built from a set of mutant cell lines with sub-chromosomal deletions and a reference wild-type line ('genome deletion panel'). The panel is used to map markers onto the genome by comparing mutant to wild-type banding patterns. Markers are linked (occur in the same deleted region) if they share the same banding pattern (presence or absence) as the deletion panel.
children.label: Deletion map

children.hasDefinition: A map showing banding patterns derived from direct observation of a stained chromosome.
children.comment: This is the lowest-resolution physical map and can provide only rough estimates of physical (base pair) distances.  Like a genetic map, they are limited to genetic markers of traits observable only in whole organisms.
children.label: Cytogenetic map

children.hasDefinition: A map showing distance between genetic markers estimated by radiation-induced breaks in a chromosome.
children.comment: The radiation method can break very closely linked markers providing a more detailed map.  Most genetic markers and subsequences may be located to a defined map position and with a more precise estimates of distance than a linkage map.
children.label: Radiation hybrid map

children.hasDefinition: A map of DNA (linear or circular) annotated with physical features or landmarks such as restriction sites, cloned DNA fragments, genes or genetic markers, along with the physical distances between them.
children.comment: Distance in a physical map is measured in base pairs. A physical map might be ordered relative to a reference map (typically a genetic map) in the process of genome sequencing.
children.label: Physical map

children.hasDefinition: A map of (typically one) DNA sequence annotated with positional or non-positional features.
children.label: Map

children.hasDefinition: Regular expression pattern.
children.label: Regular expression

children.hasDefinition: The titration curve of a protein.
children.label: Protein titration curve

children.hasDefinition: Dotplot of RNA base pairing probability matrix.
children.comment: Such as generated by the Vienna package.
children.label: Base pairing probability matrix dotplot

children.hasDefinition: A plot of Fickett testcode statistic (identifying protein coding regions) in a nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Fickett testcode plot

children.hasDefinition: A plot of sequence similarities identified from word-matching or character comparison.
children.comment: Use this concept for calculated substitution rates, relative site variability, data on sites with biased properties, highly conserved or very poorly conserved sites, regions, blocks etc.
children.label: Sequence similarity plot

children.hasDefinition: A plot of pK versus pH for a protein.
children.label: Protein ionisation curve

children.hasDefinition: A plot of character or word composition / frequency of a molecular sequence.
children.label: Sequence composition plot

children.hasDefinition: Density plot (of base composition) for a nucleotide sequence.
children.label: Nucleic acid density plot

children.hasDefinition: A Hopp and Woods plot of predicted antigenicity of a peptide or protein.
children.label: Hopp and Woods plot

children.hasDefinition: A plot in which community data (e.g. species abundance data) is summarised.  Similar species and samples are plotted close together, and dissimilar species and samples are plotted placed far apart.
children.label: Ordination plot

children.hasDefinition: Visualization of distribution of quantitative data, e.g. expression data, by histograms, violin plots and density plots.
children.label: Histogram

children.hasDefinition: Biological data that has been plotted as a graph of some type, or plotting instructions for rendering such a graph.
children.label: Plot

children.hasDefinition: Two-dimensional gel electrophoresis image
children.label: 2D PAGE image

children.hasDefinition: An image of spots from a microarray experiment.
children.label: Microarray spots image

children.hasDefinition: An image arising from a Northern Blot experiment.
children.label: Northern blot image

children.hasDefinition: An imaging technique that uses magnetic fields and radiowaves to form images, typically to investigate the anatomy and physiology of the human body.
children.label: MRI image

children.hasDefinition: Raw DDD movie acquisition from electron microscopy.
children.label: EM Movie

children.hasDefinition: Raw acquistion from electron microscopy or average of an aligned DDD movie.
children.label: EM Micrograph

children.hasDefinition: Raw biological or biomedical image generated by some experimental technique.
children.label: Raw image

children.hasDefinition: Image of the restriction enzyme cleavage sites (restriction sites) in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Restriction map

children.hasDefinition: Image of a sequence trace (nucleotide sequence versus probabilities of each of the 4 bases).
children.label: Sequence trace image

children.hasDefinition: Image of a molecular sequence, possibly with sequence features or properties shown.
children.label: Sequence image

children.hasDefinition: A graphical 2D tabular representation of expression data, typically derived from an omics experiment. A heat map is a table where rows and columns correspond to different features and contexts (for example, cells or samples) and the cell colour represents the level of expression of a gene that context.
children.label: Heat map

children.hasDefinition: An image (for viewing or printing) of a phylogenetic tree including (typically) a plot of rooted or unrooted phylogenies, cladograms, circular trees or phenograms and associated information.
children.comment: See also 'Phylogenetic tree'
children.label: Phylogenetic tree image

children.hasDefinition: Image of RNA secondary structure, knots, pseudoknots etc.
children.label: RNA secondary structure image

children.hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence looking down the axis of the helix for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.
children.label: Helical wheel

children.hasDefinition: An image of peptide sequence sequence in a simple 3,4,3,4 repeating pattern that emulates at a simple level the arrangement of residues around an alpha helix.
children.comment: Useful for highlighting amphipathicity and other properties.
children.label: Helical net

children.hasDefinition: Image of protein secondary structure.
children.label: Protein secondary structure image

children.hasDefinition: An image of protein structure.
children.label: Protein structure image

children.hasDefinition: An image of a protein.
children.label: Protein image

children.hasDefinition: An image of the structure of a small chemical compound.
children.comment: The molecular identifier and formula are typically included.
children.label: Chemical structure image

children.hasDefinition: An image of protein structure.
children.label: Protein structure image

children.hasDefinition: Image of one or more molecular tertiary (3D) structures.
children.label: Structure image

children.hasDefinition: Image of two or more aligned molecular sequences possibly annotated with alignment features.
children.label: Sequence alignment image

children.hasDefinition: A fate map is a plan of early stage of an embryo such as a blastula, showing areas that are significance to development.
children.label: Fate map

children.hasDefinition: An image from a cell migration track assay.
children.label: Cell migration track image

children.hasDefinition: Data (typically biological or biomedical) that has been rendered into an image, typically for display on screen.
children.label: Image

children.hasDefinition: The position of a cytogenetic band in a genome.
children.comment: Information might include start and end position in a chromosome sequence, chromosome identifier, name of band and so on.
children.label: Cytoband position

children.hasDefinition: A position in a map (for example a genetic map), either a single position (point) or a region / interval.
children.comment: This includes positions in genomes based on a reference sequence. A position may be specified for any mappable object, i.e. anything that may have positional information such as a physical position in a chromosome. Data might include sequence region name, strand, coordinate system name, assembly name, start position and end position.
children.label: Sequence coordinates

children.hasDefinition: Data describing a molecular map (genetic or physical) or a set of such maps, including various attributes of, data extracted from or derived from the analysis of them, but exluding the map(s) themselves. This  includes metadata for map sets that share a common set of features which are mapped.
children.label: Map data

children.hasDefinition: The maximum initial velocity or rate of a reaction. It is the limiting velocity as substrate concentrations get very large.
children.label: Vmax

children.hasDefinition: Km is the concentration (usually in Molar units) of substrate that leads to half-maximal velocity of an enzyme-catalysed reaction.
children.label: Km

children.hasDefinition: A plot giving an approximation of the kinetics of an enzyme-catalysed reaction, assuming simple kinetics (i.e. no intermediate or product inhibition, allostericity or cooperativity). It plots initial reaction rate to the substrate concentration (S) from which the maximum rate (vmax) is apparent.
children.label: Michaelis Menten plot

children.hasDefinition: A plot based on the Michaelis Menten equation of enzyme kinetics plotting the ratio of the initial substrate concentration (S) against the reaction velocity (v).
children.label: Hanes Woolf plot

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning chemical reaction(s) catalysed by enzyme(s).
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Enzyme kinetics data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning a biochemical reaction, typically data and more general annotation on the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Reaction data

children.hasDefinition: Typically a human-readable summary of body of facts or information indicating why a statement is true or valid. This may include a computational prediction, laboratory experiment, literature reference etc.
children.label: Evidence

children.hasDefinition: Raw data on a biological hierarchy, describing the hierarchy proper, hierarchy components and possibly associated annotation.
children.label: Hierarchy

children.hasDefinition: Primary data about a specific biological pathway or network (the nodes and connections within the pathway or network).
children.label: Pathway or network

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning the classification, identification and naming of organisms.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Taxonomy

children.hasDefinition: Spectral information for a molecule from a nuclear magnetic resonance experiment.
children.label: NMR spectrum

children.hasDefinition: The spectrum of frequencies of electromagnetic radiation emitted from a molecule as a result of some spectroscopy experiment.
children.label: Spectrum

children.hasDefinition: Data on gene sequence variations resulting large-scale genotyping and DNA sequencing projects.
children.comment: Variations are stored along with a reference genome.
children.label: Sequence variations

children.hasDefinition: A training course available for use on the Web.
children.label: Online course

children.hasDefinition: Some material that is used for educational (training) purposes.
children.label: Training material

children.hasDefinition: The mean species diversity in sites or habitats at a local scale.
children.label: Alpha diversity data

children.hasDefinition: The ratio between regional and local species diversity.
children.label: Beta diversity data

children.hasDefinition: The total species diversity in a landscape.
children.label: Gamma diversity data

children.hasDefinition: Machine-readable biodiversity data.
children.label: Biodiversity data

children.hasDefinition: The mean species diversity in sites or habitats at a local scale.
children.label: Alpha diversity data

children.hasDefinition: The ratio between regional and local species diversity.
children.label: Beta diversity data

children.hasDefinition: The total species diversity in a landscape.
children.label: Gamma diversity data

children.hasDefinition: Machine-readable biodiversity data.
children.label: Biodiversity data

children.hasDefinition: Data concerning ecology; for example measurements and reports from the study of interactions among organisms and their environment.
children.comment: This is a broad data type and is used a placeholder for other, more specific types.
children.label: Ecological data

children.hasDefinition: A ranked list of Gene Ontology concepts, each associated with a p-value, concerning or derived from the analysis of e.g. a set of genes or proteins.
children.label: GO-term enrichment data

children.hasDefinition: A ranked list of pathways, each associated with z-score, p-value or similar, concerning or derived from the analysis of e.g. a set of genes or proteins.
children.label: Pathway overrepresentation data

children.hasDefinition: A ranked list of categories (usually ontology concepts), each associated with a statistical metric of over-/under-representation within the studied data.
children.label: Over-representation data

children.hasDefinition: A structured query, in form of a script, that defines a database search task.
children.label: Query script

children.hasDefinition: Data coming from molecular simulations, computer "experiments" on model molecules.
children.comment: Typically formed by two separated but indivisible pieces of information: topology data (static) and trajectory data (dynamic).
children.label: Molecular simulation data

children.hasDefinition: Dynamic information of a structure molecular system coming from a molecular simulation: XYZ 3D coordinates (sometimes with their associated velocities) for every atom along time.
children.label: Trajectory data

children.hasDefinition: Force field parameters: charges, masses, radii, bond lengths, bond dihedrals, etc. define the structural molecular system, and are essential for the proper description and simulation of a molecular system.
children.label: Forcefield parameters

children.hasDefinition: Static information of a structure molecular system that is needed for a molecular simulation: the list of atoms, their non-bonded parameters for Van der Waals and electrostatic interactions, and the complete connectivity in terms of bonds, angles and dihedrals.
children.label: Topology data

children.hasDefinition: Data coming from molecular simulations, computer "experiments" on model molecules. Tipically formed by two separated but indivisible pieces of information: topology data (static) and trajectory data (dynamic).
children.label: Simulation

children.hasDefinition: Information, represented in an information artefact (data record) that is 'understandable' by dedicated computational tools that can use the data as input or produce it as output.
children.label: Data

children.hasDefinition: SMILES ARbitrary Target Specification (SMARTS) format for chemical structure specification, which is a subset of the SMILES line notation.
children.label: smarts

children.hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in Simplified Molecular Input Line Entry System (SMILES) line notation.
children.label: SMILES

children.hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified in IUPAC International Chemical Identifier (InChI) line notation.
children.label: InChI

children.hasDefinition: Chemical structure specified by Molecular Formula (MF), including a count of each element in a compound.
children.comment: The general MF query format consists of a series of valid atomic symbols, with an optional number or range.
children.label: mf

children.hasDefinition: The InChIKey (hashed InChI) is a fixed length (25 character) condensed digital representation of an InChI chemical structure specification. It uniquely identifies a chemical compound.
children.comment: An InChIKey identifier is not human- nor machine-readable but is more suitable for web searches than an InChI chemical structure specification.
children.label: InChIKey

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity characters.
children.label: unambiguous sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.label: dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.label: rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps.
children.label: nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a protein sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for gaps and translation stop.
children.label: protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
children.label: consensus

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.
children.label: unpure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
children.label: consensus

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.
children.label: ambiguous

children.hasDefinition: Format for sequence positions (feature location) as used in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank database.
children.label: EMBL feature location

children.hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre quicktandem program).
children.label: quicktandem

children.hasDefinition: Report format for inverted repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre inverted program).
children.label: Sanger inverted repeats

children.hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a sequence (an EMBOSS report format).
children.label: EMBOSS repeat

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on exon-intron structure generated by EMBOSS est2genome.
children.label: est2genome format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restrict program.
children.label: restrict format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restover program.
children.label: restover format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by REBASE database.
children.label: REBASE restriction sites

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using FASTA.
children.comment: This includes (typically) score data, alignment data and a histogram (of observed and expected distribution of E values.)
children.label: FASTA search results format

children.hasDefinition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package
children.label: BLAST XML results format

children.hasDefinition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package v2.
children.label: BLAST XML v2 results format

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST.
children.comment: This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.
children.label: BLAST results

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of MSPCrunch.
children.label: mspcrunch

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of Smith Waterman.
children.label: Smith-Waterman format

children.hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY domain hits file (DHF) of hits (sequences) with domain classification information.
children.comment: The hits are relatives to a SCOP or CATH family and are found from a search of a sequence database.
children.label: dhf

children.hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY ligand hits file (LHF) of database hits (sequences) with ligand classification information.
children.comment: The hits are putative ligand-binding sequences and are found from a search of a sequence database.
children.label: lhf

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches of query protein sequence(s) to InterPro entries.
children.comment: The report includes a classification of regions in a query protein sequence which are assigned to a known InterPro protein family or group.
children.label: InterPro protein view report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches between protein sequence(s) and signatures for an InterPro entry.
children.comment: The table presents matches between query proteins (rows) and signature methods (columns) for this entry. Alternatively the sequence(s) might be from from the InterPro entry itself. The match position in the protein sequence and match status (true positive, false positive etc) are indicated.
children.label: InterPro match table format

children.hasDefinition: Results format for searches of the InterPro database.
children.label: InterPro hits format

children.hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution HMMER format.
children.label: HMMER Dirichlet prior

children.hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution MEME format.
children.label: MEME Dirichlet prior

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report from the HMMER package on the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.
children.label: HMMER emission and transition

children.hasDefinition: Format of a regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
children.label: prosite-pattern

children.hasDefinition: Format of an EMBOSS sequence pattern.
children.label: EMBOSS sequence pattern

children.hasDefinition: A motif in the format generated by the MEME program.
children.label: meme-motif

children.hasDefinition: Sequence profile (sequence classifier) format used in the PROSITE database.
children.label: prosite-profile

children.hasDefinition: A profile (sequence classifier) in the format used in the JASPAR database.
children.label: JASPAR format

children.hasDefinition: Format of the model of random sequences used by MEME.
children.label: MEME background Markov model

children.hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 2.x
children.label: HMMER2

children.hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 3.x
children.label: HMMER3

children.hasDefinition: Format of a hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.
children.label: HMMER format

children.hasDefinition: FASTA-style format for multiple sequences aligned by HMMER package to an HMM.
children.label: HMMER-aln

children.hasDefinition: FASTA-style format for multiple sequences aligned by HMMER package to an HMM.
children.label: HMMER-aln

children.hasDefinition: Fasta format variant with database name before ID.
children.label: dbid

children.hasDefinition: FASTA format including NCBI-style IDs.
children.label: FASTA

children.hasDefinition: FASTA sequence format including NCBI-style GIs.
children.label: giFASTA format

children.hasDefinition: Plain old FASTA sequence format (unspecified format for IDs).
children.label: Pearson format

children.hasDefinition: NCBI FASTA sequence format with NCBI-style IDs.
children.comment: There are several variants of this.
children.label: NCBI format

children.hasDefinition: Fasta format for (aligned) sequences.
children.label: FASTA-aln

children.hasDefinition: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.
children.label: A2M

children.hasDefinition: Color space FASTA format sequence variant.
children.comment: FASTA format extended for color space information.
children.label: csfasta

children.hasDefinition: The A2M format is used as the primary format for multiple alignments of protein or nucleic-acid sequences in the SAM suite of tools. It is a small modification of FASTA format for sequences and is compatible with most tools that read FASTA.
children.label: XMFA

children.hasDefinition: A text format resembling FASTA format.
children.comment: This concept may also be used for the many non-standard FASTA-like formats.
children.label: FASTA-like (text)

children.hasDefinition: Format of multiple sequences aligned by DIALIGN package.
children.label: DIALIGN format

children.hasDefinition: EMBASSY 'domain alignment file' (DAF) format, containing a sequence alignment of protein domains belonging to the same SCOP or CATH family.
children.comment: The format is clustal-like and includes annotation of domain family classification information.
children.label: daf

children.hasDefinition: Format for alignment of molecular sequences to MEME profiles (position-dependent scoring matrices) as generated by the MAST tool from the MEME package.
children.label: Sequence-MEME profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for an alignment of a sequence against a hidden Markov model database.
children.label: HMMER profile alignment (sequences versus HMMs)

children.hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for of an alignment of a hidden Markov model against a sequence database.
children.label: HMMER profile alignment (HMM versus sequences)

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP phylogenetic distance matrix data.
children.comment: Data Type must include the distance matrix, probably as pairs of sequence identifiers with a distance (integer or float).
children.label: Phylip distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: Dendrogram (tree file) format generated by ClustalW.
children.label: ClustalW dendrogram

children.hasDefinition: Raw data file format used by Phylip from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted.
children.label: Phylip tree raw

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for continuous quantitative character data.
children.label: Phylip continuous quantitative characters

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for phylogenetics character frequency data.
children.label: Phylip character frequencies format

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP discrete states data.
children.label: Phylip discrete states format

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP cliques data.
children.label: Phylip cliques format

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree data format used by the PHYLIP program.
children.label: Phylip tree format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeBASE database of phylogenetic data.
children.label: TreeBASE format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeFam database of phylogenetic data.
children.label: TreeFam format

children.hasDefinition: Format for distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees as used by the Phylip package.
children.label: Phylip tree distance format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the DSSP database (Dictionary of Secondary Structure in Proteins).
children.comment: The DSSP database is built using the DSSP application which defines secondary structure, geometrical features and solvent exposure of proteins, given atomic coordinates in PDB format.
children.label: dssp

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the HSSP database (Homology-derived Secondary Structure in Proteins).
children.label: hssp

children.hasDefinition: Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.label: Vienna local RNA secondary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Format of RNA secondary structure in dot-bracket notation, originally generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.label: Dot-bracket format

children.hasDefinition: Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.label: Vienna local RNA secondary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in PDB format.
children.label: PDB

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format.
children.label: mmCIF

children.hasDefinition: Amino acid index format used by the AAindex database.
children.label: aaindex

children.hasDefinition: Format of output of the Pcons Model Quality Assessment Program (MQAP).
children.comment: Pcons ranks protein models by assessing their quality based on the occurrence of recurring common three-dimensional structural patterns. Pcons returns a score reflecting the overall global quality and a score for each individual residue in the protein reflecting the local residue quality.
children.label: Pcons report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of output of the ProQ protein model quality predictor.
children.comment: ProQ is a neural network-based predictor that predicts the quality of a protein model based on the number of structural features.
children.label: ProQ report format

children.hasDefinition: A report format for the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction(s) in a format generated by EMBOSS findkm. This includes Michaelis Menten plot, Hanes Woolf plot, Michaelis Menten constant (Km) and maximum velocity (Vmax).
children.label: findkm

children.hasDefinition: Report format on PCR primers and hybridisation oligos as generated by Whitehead primer3 program.
children.label: Primer3 primer

children.hasDefinition: Format of MIRA sequence trace information file.
children.label: mira

children.hasDefinition: Common Assembly Format (CAF). A sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata.
children.label: CAF

children.hasDefinition: Sequence assembly project file EXP format.
children.label: EXP

children.hasDefinition: PHD sequence trace format to store serialised chromatogram data (reads).
children.label: PHD

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of raw image data.
children.label: dat

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (raw) expression levels of the individual probes.
children.label: cel

children.hasDefinition: Format of affymetrix gene cluster files (hc-genes.txt, hc-chips.txt) from hierarchical clustering.
children.label: affymetrix

children.hasDefinition: Affymetrix data file format for information about experimental conditions and protocols.
children.hasExactSynonym: Affymetrix experimental conditions data file format
children.label: affymetrix-exp

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (normalised) expression levels of the individual probes.
children.label: CHP

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the HET group dictionary (HET groups from PDB files).
children.label: HET group dictionary entry format

children.hasDefinition: Format of bibliographic reference as used by the PubMed database.
children.label: PubMed citation

children.hasDefinition: Format for abstracts of scientific articles from the Medline database.
children.comment: Bibliographic reference information including citation information is included
children.label: Medline Display Format

children.hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'core' citation format including title, journal, authors and abstract.
children.label: CiteXplore-core

children.hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'all' citation format includes all known details such as Mesh terms and cross-references.
children.label: CiteXplore-all

children.hasDefinition: Article format of the PubMed Central database.
children.label: pmc

children.hasDefinition: OSCAR format of annotated chemical text.
children.comment: OSCAR (Open-Source Chemistry Analysis Routines) software performs chemistry-specific parsing of chemical documents. It attempts to identify chemical names, ontology concepts, and chemical data from a document.
children.label: OSCAR format

children.hasDefinition: Map of a plasmid (circular DNA) in PlasMapper TextMap format.
children.label: PlasMapper TextMap

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree Newick (text) format.
children.label: newick

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree TreeCon (text) format.
children.label: TreeCon format

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree Nexus (text) format.
children.label: Nexus format

children.hasDefinition: ACEDB sequence format.
children.label: acedb

children.hasDefinition: Codata entry format.
children.label: codata

children.hasDefinition: EMBL entry format.
children.label: EMBL format

children.hasDefinition: Geneseq sequence format.
children.label: geneseq

children.hasDefinition: A text format resembling EMBL entry format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for the many non-standard EMBL-like text formats.
children.label: EMBL-like (text)

children.hasDefinition: Staden experiment file format.
children.label: Staden experiment format

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format ignoring quality scores.
children.label: FASTQ

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.
children.label: qualillumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ Illumina 1.3 short read format.
children.label: FASTQ-illumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format with phred quality.
children.label: FASTQ-sanger

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)
children.label: qualsolexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ Solexa/Illumina 1.0 short read format.
children.label: FASTQ-solexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)
children.label: qualsolexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.
children.label: qualillumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for SOLiD data.
