children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity characters.
children.label: unambiguous sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.label: dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.label: rna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for example for gaps.
children.label: nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible unknown positions but without ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence with possible ambiguity and unknown positions but without non-sequence characters.
children.label: pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a protein sequence with possible ambiguity, unknown positions and non-sequence characters.
children.comment: Non-sequence characters may be used for gaps and translation stop.
children.label: protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
children.label: consensus

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions but possibly with non-sequence characters.
children.label: unpure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for the consensus of two or more molecular sequences.
children.label: consensus

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence with possible unknown positions and possible ambiguity characters.
children.label: ambiguous

children.hasDefinition: Raw sequence format with no non-sequence characters.
children.label: raw

children.comment: 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioXSD in XML' is the XML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioXSD (XML)

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a nucleotide sequence (characters ACGTU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters .
children.label: completely unambiguous pure nucleotide

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a DNA sequence (characters ACGT only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure dna

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for an RNA sequence (characters ACGU only) without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure rna sequence

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for any protein sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure protein

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without unknown positions, ambiguity or non-sequence characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous pure

children.hasDefinition: Alphabet for a molecular sequence without any unknown positions or ambiguity characters.
children.label: completely unambiguous

children.hasDefinition: 2bit binary format of nucleotide sequences using 2 bits per nucleotide. In addition encodes unknown nucleotides and lower-case 'masking'.
children.label: 2bit

children.hasDefinition: .nib (nibble) binary format of a nucleotide sequence using 4 bits per nucleotide (including unknown) and its lower-case 'masking'.
children.label: .nib

children.comment: Work in progress. 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioJSON' is the JSON format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioJSON is a BioXSD-schema-based JSON format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web applications and APIs, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioJSON (BioXSD)

children.comment: Work in progress. 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioYAML' is the YAML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioYAML is a BioXSD-schema-based YAML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web APIs, human readability and editting, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioYAML

children.hasDefinition: BpForms is a string format for concretely representing the primary structures of biopolymers, including DNA, RNA, and proteins that include non-canonical nucleic and amino acids. See https://www.bpforms.org for more information.
children.label: BpForms

children.hasDefinition: Mash sketch is a format for sequence / sequence checksum information. To make a sketch, each k-mer in a sequence is hashed, which creates a pseudo-random identifier. By sorting these hashes, a small subset from the top of the sorted list can represent the entire sequence.
children.label: msh

children.hasDefinition: A Docker image is a file, comprised of multiple layers, that is used to execute code in a Docker container. An image is essentially built from the instructions for a complete and executable version of an application, which relies on the host OS kernel.
children.label: Docker image format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a raw molecular sequence (i.e. the alphabet used).
children.label: Raw sequence format

children.hasDefinition: Format for sequence positions (feature location) as used in DDBJ/EMBL/GenBank database.
children.label: EMBL feature location

children.hasDefinition: Cytoband format for chromosome cytobands.
children.comment: Reflects a UCSC Browser DB table.
children.label: Cytoband format

children.hasDefinition: Format used to specify range(s) of sequence positions.
children.label: Sequence range format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre quicktandem program).
children.label: quicktandem

children.hasDefinition: Report format for inverted repeats in a nucleotide sequence (format generated by the Sanger Centre inverted program).
children.label: Sanger inverted repeats

children.hasDefinition: Report format for tandem repeats in a sequence (an EMBOSS report format).
children.label: EMBOSS repeat

children.hasDefinition: Format used for map of repeats in molecular (typically nucleotide) sequences.
children.label: Sequence features (repeats) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on exon-intron structure generated by EMBOSS est2genome.
children.label: est2genome format

children.hasDefinition: OrthoXML is designed broadly to allow the storage and comparison of orthology data from any ortholog database. It establishes a structure for describing orthology relationships while still allowing flexibility for database-specific information to be encapsulated in the same format.
children.label: OrthoXML

children.hasDefinition: WEGO native format used by the Web Gene Ontology Annotation Plot application.   Tab-delimited format with gene names and others GO IDs (columns) with one annotation record per line.
children.label: WEGO

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on a particular locus, gene, gene system or groups of genes.
children.label: Gene annotation format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restrict program.
children.label: restrict format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by EMBOSS restover program.
children.label: restover format

children.hasDefinition: Report format for restriction enzyme recognition sites used by REBASE database.
children.label: REBASE restriction sites

children.hasDefinition: Format used for report on restriction enzyme recognition sites in nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (restriction sites) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using FASTA.
children.comment: This includes (typically) score data, alignment data and a histogram (of observed and expected distribution of E values.)
children.label: FASTA search results format

children.hasDefinition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package
children.label: BLAST XML results format

children.hasDefinition: XML format as produced by the NCBI Blast package v2.
children.label: BLAST XML v2 results format

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of BLAST.
children.comment: This includes score data, alignment data and summary table.
children.label: BLAST results

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of MSPCrunch.
children.label: mspcrunch

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a sequence database search using some variant of Smith Waterman.
children.label: Smith-Waterman format

children.hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY domain hits file (DHF) of hits (sequences) with domain classification information.
children.comment: The hits are relatives to a SCOP or CATH family and are found from a search of a sequence database.
children.label: dhf

children.hasDefinition: Format of EMBASSY ligand hits file (LHF) of database hits (sequences) with ligand classification information.
children.comment: The hits are putative ligand-binding sequences and are found from a search of a sequence database.
children.label: lhf

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches of query protein sequence(s) to InterPro entries.
children.comment: The report includes a classification of regions in a query protein sequence which are assigned to a known InterPro protein family or group.
children.label: InterPro protein view report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of results of a search of the InterPro database showing matches between protein sequence(s) and signatures for an InterPro entry.
children.comment: The table presents matches between query proteins (rows) and signature methods (columns) for this entry. Alternatively the sequence(s) might be from from the InterPro entry itself. The match position in the protein sequence and match status (true positive, false positive etc) are indicated.
children.label: InterPro match table format

children.hasDefinition: Results format for searches of the InterPro database.
children.label: InterPro hits format

children.hasDefinition: EBI Application Result XML is a format returned by sequence similarity search Web services at EBI.
children.label: EBI Application Result XML

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on sequence hits and associated data from searching a sequence database.
children.label: Database hits (sequence) format

children.hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution HMMER format.
children.label: HMMER Dirichlet prior

children.hasDefinition: Dirichlet distribution MEME format.
children.label: MEME Dirichlet prior

children.hasDefinition: Data format of a dirichlet distribution.
children.label: Dirichlet distribution format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report from the HMMER package on the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.
children.label: HMMER emission and transition

children.hasDefinition: Data format for the emission and transition counts of a hidden Markov model.
children.label: HMM emission and transition counts format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a regular expression pattern from the Prosite database.
children.label: prosite-pattern

children.hasDefinition: Format of an EMBOSS sequence pattern.
children.label: EMBOSS sequence pattern

children.hasDefinition: A motif in the format generated by the MEME program.
children.label: meme-motif

children.hasDefinition: Format of a sequence motif.
children.label: Sequence motif format

children.hasDefinition: Sequence profile (sequence classifier) format used in the PROSITE database.
children.label: prosite-profile

children.hasDefinition: A profile (sequence classifier) in the format used in the JASPAR database.
children.label: JASPAR format

children.hasDefinition: Format of the model of random sequences used by MEME.
children.label: MEME background Markov model

children.hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 2.x
children.label: HMMER2

children.hasDefinition: HMMER profile HMM file for HMMER versions 3.x
children.label: HMMER3

children.hasDefinition: Format of a hidden Markov model representation used by the HMMER package.
children.label: HMMER format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a hidden Markov model.
children.label: Hidden Markov model format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a sequence profile.
children.label: Sequence profile format

children.hasDefinition: Format for alignment of molecular sequences to MEME profiles (position-dependent scoring matrices) as generated by the MAST tool from the MEME package.
children.label: Sequence-MEME profile alignment

children.hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for an alignment of a sequence against a hidden Markov model database.
children.label: HMMER profile alignment (sequences versus HMMs)

children.hasDefinition: Format used by the HMMER package for of an alignment of a hidden Markov model against a sequence database.
children.label: HMMER profile alignment (HMM versus sequences)

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a sequence-profile alignment.
children.label: Sequence-profile alignment format

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP phylogenetic distance matrix data.
children.comment: Data Type must include the distance matrix, probably as pairs of sequence identifiers with a distance (integer or float).
children.label: Phylip distance matrix

children.hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of genetic distances between molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence distance matrix format

children.hasDefinition: Format for distances, such as Branch Score distance, between two or more phylogenetic trees as used by the Phylip package.
children.label: Phylip tree distance format

children.hasDefinition: Format for phylogenetic tree distance data.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (tree distances) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry from the DSSP database (Dictionary of Secondary Structure in Proteins).
children.comment: The DSSP database is built using the DSSP application which defines secondary structure, geometrical features and solvent exposure of proteins, given atomic coordinates in PDB format.
children.label: dssp

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of the HSSP database (Homology-derived Secondary Structure in Proteins).
children.label: hssp

children.hasDefinition: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of a protein molecule.
children.label: Protein secondary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Format of local RNA secondary structure components with free energy values, generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.label: Vienna local RNA secondary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Format of RNA secondary structure in dot-bracket notation, originally generated by the Vienna RNA package/server.
children.label: Dot-bracket format

children.hasDefinition: File format of a CT (Connectivity Table) file from the RNAstructure package.
children.label: CT

children.hasDefinition: XRNA old input style format.
children.label: SS

children.hasDefinition: RNA Markup Language.
children.label: RNAML

children.hasDefinition: Format for secondary structure (predicted or real) of an RNA molecule.
children.label: RNA secondary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in PDB format.
children.label: PDB

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in mmCIF format.
children.label: mmCIF

children.hasDefinition: Entry format of PDB database in PDBML (XML) format.
children.label: PDBML

children.hasDefinition: PDB sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdb format in EMBOSS.
children.label: pdbatom

children.hasDefinition: PDB nucleotide sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdbnuc format in EMBOSS.
children.label: pdbatomnuc

children.hasDefinition: PDB nucleotide sequence format (SEQRES lines).
children.comment: pdbnucseq format in EMBOSS.
children.label: pdbseqresnuc

children.hasDefinition: PDB sequence format (SEQRES lines).
children.comment: pdbseq format in EMBOSS.
children.label: pdbseqres

children.hasDefinition: Format of an entry (or part of an entry) from the PDB database.
children.label: PDB database entry format

children.hasDefinition: The XYZ chemical file format is widely supported by many programs, although many slightly different XYZ file formats coexist (Tinker XYZ, UniChem XYZ, etc.). Basic information stored for each atom in the system are x, y and z coordinates and atom element/atomic number.
children.comment: XYZ files are structured in this way:  First line contains the number of atoms in the file.  Second line contains a title, comment, or filename. Remaining lines contain atom information. Each line starts with the element symbol, followed by x, y and z coordinates in angstroms separated by whitespace. Multiple molecules or frames can be contained within one file, so it supports trajectory storage. XYZ files can be directly represented by a molecular viewer, as they contain all the basic information needed to build the 3D model.
children.label: XYZ

children.hasDefinition: AMBER trajectory (also called mdcrd), with 10 coordinates per line and format F8.3 (fixed point notation with field width 8 and 3 decimal places).
children.label: mdcrd

children.hasDefinition: GROMACS MD package top textual files define an entire structure system topology, either directly, or by including itp files.
children.comment: There is currently no tool available for conversion between GROMACS topology format and other formats, due to the internal differences in both approaches. There is, however, a method to convert small molecules parameterized with AMBER force-field into GROMACS format, allowing simulations of these systems with GROMACS MD package.
children.label: GROMACS top

children.hasDefinition: AMBER Prmtop file (version 7) is a structure topology text file divided in several sections designed to be parsed easily using simple Fortran code. Each section contains particular topology information, such as atom name, charge, mass, angles, dihedrals, etc.
comment: It can be modified manually, but as the size of the system increases, the hand-editing becomes increasingly complex. AMBER Parameter-Topology file format is used extensively by the AMBER software suite and is referred to as the Prmtop file for short.

version 7 is written to distinguish it from old versions of AMBER Prmtop. Similarly to HDF5, it is a completely different format, according to AMBER group: a drastic change to the file format occurred with the 2004 release of Amber 7 (http://ambermd.org/prmtop.pdf)
children.label: AMBER top

children.hasDefinition: X-Plor Protein Structure Files (PSF) are structure topology files used by NAMD and CHARMM molecular simulations programs. PSF files contain six main sections of interest: atoms, bonds, angles, dihedrals, improper dihedrals (force terms used to maintain planarity) and cross-terms.
children.comment: The high similarity in the functional form of the two potential energy functions used by AMBER and CHARMM force-fields gives rise to the possible use of one force-field within the other MD engine. Therefore, the conversion of PSF files to AMBER Prmtop format is possible with the use of AMBER chamber (CHARMM - AMBER) program.
children.label: PSF

children.hasDefinition: GROMACS itp files (include topology) contain structure topology information, and are tipically included in GROMACS topology files (GROMACS top). Itp files are used to define individual (or multiple) components of a topology as a separate file. This is particularly useful if there is a molecule that is used frequently, and also reduces the size of the system topology file, splitting it in different parts.
children.comment: GROMACS itp files are used also to define position restrictions on the molecule, or to define the force field parameters for a particular ligand.
children.label: GROMACS itp

children.hasDefinition: AMBER coordinate/restart file with 6 coordinates per line and decimal format F12.7 (fixed point notation with field width 12 and 7 decimal places)
children.label: RST

children.hasDefinition: Format of CHARMM Residue Topology Files (RTF), which define groups by including the atoms, the properties of the group, and bond and charge information.
children.comment: There is currently no tool available for conversion between GROMACS topology format and other formats, due to the internal differences in both approaches. There is, however, a method to convert small molecules parameterized with AMBER force-field into GROMACS format, allowing simulations of these systems with GROMACS MD package.
children.label: CHARMM rtf

children.comment: The first 4 bytes of any trr file containing 1993. See https://github.com/galaxyproject/galaxy/pull/6597/files#diff-409951594551183dbf886e24de6cb129R760
children.hasDefinition: Format of trr files that contain the trajectory of a simulation experiment used by GROMACS.
children.label: trr

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a molecular tertiary structure.
children.label: Tertiary structure format

children.hasDefinition: Format of output of the Pcons Model Quality Assessment Program (MQAP).
children.comment: Pcons ranks protein models by assessing their quality based on the occurrence of recurring common three-dimensional structural patterns. Pcons returns a score reflecting the overall global quality and a score for each individual residue in the protein reflecting the local residue quality.
children.label: Pcons report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of output of the ProQ protein model quality predictor.
children.comment: ProQ is a neural network-based predictor that predicts the quality of a protein model based on the number of structural features.
children.label: ProQ report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on the quality of a protein three-dimensional model.
children.label: Protein structure report (quality evaluation) format

children.hasDefinition: A report format for the kinetics of enzyme-catalysed reaction(s) in a format generated by EMBOSS findkm. This includes Michaelis Menten plot, Hanes Woolf plot, Michaelis Menten constant (Km) and maximum velocity (Vmax).
children.label: findkm

children.hasDefinition: Data format for reports on enzyme kinetics.
children.label: Enzyme kinetics report format

children.hasDefinition: Report format on PCR primers and hybridisation oligos as generated by Whitehead primer3 program.
children.label: Primer3 primer

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on PCR primers or hybridisation oligos in a nucleic acid sequence.
children.label: Nucleic acid features (primers) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of raw image data.
children.label: dat

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (raw) expression levels of the individual probes.
children.label: cel

children.hasDefinition: Format of Affymetrix data file of information about (normalised) expression levels of the individual probes.
children.label: CHP

children.hasDefinition: MAGE-ML XML format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
children.label: MAGE-ML

children.hasDefinition: MAGE-TAB textual format for microarray expression data, standardised by MGED (now FGED).
children.label: MAGE-TAB

children.hasDefinition: Format of the cytoscape input file of gene expression ratios or values are specified over one or more experiments.
children.label: Cytoscape input file format

children.hasDefinition: Proprietary file format for (raw) BeadArray data used by genomewide profiling platforms from Illumina Inc. This format is output directly from the scanner and stores summary intensities for each probe-type on an array.
children.label: IDAT

children.hasDefinition: Reporter Code Count-A data file (.csv) output by the Nanostring nCounter Digital Analyzer, which contains gene sample information, probe information and probe counts.
children.label: rcc

children.hasDefinition: The Investigation / Study / Assay (ISA) tab-delimited (TAB) format incorporates metadata fromexperiments employing a combination of technologies.
children.comment: ISA-TAB is based on MAGE-TAB. Other than tabular, the ISA model can also be represented in RDF, and in JSON (compliable with a set of defined JSON Schemata).
children.label: ISA-TAB

children.hasDefinition: Tab-delimited text files of GenePattern that contain a column for each sample, a row for each gene, and an expression value for each gene in each sample.
children.label: GCT/Res format

children.hasDefinition: The Loom file format is based on HDF5, a standard for storing large numerical datasets. The Loom format is designed to efficiently hold large omics datasets. Typically, such data takes the form of a large matrix of numbers, along with metadata for the rows and columns.
children.label: Loom

children.hasDefinition: The Zarr format is an implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays for storing data.
children.label: Zarr

children.hasDefinition: The Matrix Market matrix (MTX) format stores numerical or pattern matrices in a dense (array format) or sparse (coordinate format) representation.
children.label: MTX

children.hasDefinition: Tab-delimited format for gene expression levels table, calculated as Reads Per Kilobase per Million (RPKM) mapped reads.
children.comment: For example a 1kb transcript with 1000 alignments in a sample of 10 million reads (out of which 8 million reads can be mapped) will have RPKM = 1000/(1 * 8) = 125
children.label: RPKM

children.hasDefinition: Format of a file of gene expression data, e.g. a gene expression matrix or profile.
children.label: Gene expression report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of Taverna workflows.
children.label: Taverna workflow format

children.hasDefinition: Data table formatted such that it can be passed/streamed within the KNIME platform.
children.label: KNIME datatable format

children.hasDefinition: Common Workflow Language (CWL) format for description of command-line tools and workflows.
children.label: CWL

children.hasDefinition: An emerging format for high-level Galaxy workflow description.
children.label: gxformat2

children.hasDefinition: Format for scripts writtenin Python - a widely used high-level programming language for general-purpose programming.
children.label: Python script

children.hasDefinition: Format for scripts written in Perl - a family of high-level, general-purpose, interpreted, dynamic programming languages.
children.label: Perl script

children.hasDefinition: Format for scripts written in the R language - an open source programming language and software environment for statistical computing and graphics that is supported by the R Foundation for Statistical Computing.
children.label: R script

children.hasDefinition: A file format for making dynamic documents (R Markdown scripts) with the R language.
children.label: R markdown

children.hasDefinition: The file format for MATLAB scripts or functions.
children.label: MATLAB script

children.hasDefinition: Format of a workflow.
children.label: Workflow format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the HET group dictionary (HET groups from PDB files).
children.label: HET group dictionary entry format

children.hasDefinition: SDF is one of a family of chemical-data file formats developed by MDL Information Systems; it is intended especially for structural information.
children.label: SDF

children.hasDefinition: An MDL Molfile is a file format for holding information about the atoms, bonds, connectivity and coordinates of a molecule.
children.label: Molfile

children.hasDefinition: Complete, portable representation of a SYBYL molecule. ASCII file which contains all the information needed to reconstruct a SYBYL molecule.
children.label: Mol2

children.hasDefinition: BcForms is a format for abstractly describing the molecular structure (atoms and bonds) of macromolecular complexes as a collection of subunits and crosslinks. Each subunit can be described with BpForms (http://edamontology.org/format_3909) or SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301). BcForms uses an ontology of crosslinks to abstract the chemical details of crosslinks from the descriptions of complexes (see https://bpforms.org/crosslink.html).
children.comment: BcForms is related to http://edamontology.org/format_3909. (BcForms uses BpForms to describe subunits which are DNA, RNA, or protein polymers.) However, that format isn't the parent of BcForms. BcForms is similarly related to SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301).
children.label: BcForms

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report on a chemical compound.
children.label: Chemical data format

children.hasDefinition: Format of bibliographic reference as used by the PubMed database.
children.label: PubMed citation

children.hasDefinition: Format for abstracts of scientific articles from the Medline database.
children.comment: Bibliographic reference information including citation information is included
children.label: Medline Display Format

children.hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'core' citation format including title, journal, authors and abstract.
children.label: CiteXplore-core

children.hasDefinition: CiteXplore 'all' citation format includes all known details such as Mesh terms and cross-references.
children.label: CiteXplore-all

children.hasDefinition: XML format for collected entries from biobliographic databases MEDLINE and PubMed.
children.label: PubMed XML

children.hasDefinition: Format of a bibliographic reference.
children.label: Bibliographic reference format

children.hasDefinition: Article format of the PubMed Central database.
children.label: pmc

children.hasDefinition: Abstract format used by MedLine database.
children.label: medline

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a full-text scientific article.
children.label: Article format

children.hasDefinition: The format of iHOP (Information Hyperlinked over Proteins) text-mining result.
children.label: iHOP format

children.hasDefinition: Data format of a report from text mining.
children.label: Text mining report format

children.hasDefinition: OSCAR format of annotated chemical text.
children.comment: OSCAR (Open-Source Chemistry Analysis Routines) software performs chemistry-specific parsing of chemical documents. It attempts to identify chemical names, ontology concepts, and chemical data from a document.
children.label: OSCAR format

children.hasDefinition: JSON format of annotated scientific text used by PubAnnotations and other tools.
children.label: PubAnnotation format

children.hasDefinition: BioC is a standardised XML format for sharing and integrating text data and annotations.
children.label: BioC

children.hasDefinition: Native textual export format of annotated scientific text from PubTator.
children.label: PubTator format

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: A family of similar formats of text annotation, used by BRAT and other tools, known as BioNLP Shared Task format (BioNLP 2009 Shared Task on Event Extraction, BioNLP Shared Task 2011, BioNLP Shared Task 2013), BRAT format, BRAT standoff format, and similar.
children.label: BioNLP Shared Task format

children.hasDefinition: Data format of an annotated text, e.g. with recognised entities, concepts, and relations.
children.label: Annotated text format

children.hasDefinition: Map of a plasmid (circular DNA) in PlasMapper TextMap format.
children.label: PlasMapper TextMap

children.hasDefinition: Format of a map of (typically one) molecular sequence annotated with features.
children.label: Map format

children.hasDefinition: A format of raw sequence read data from an Applied Biosystems sequencing machine.
children.label: ABI

children.hasDefinition: Format of MIRA sequence trace information file.
children.label: mira

children.hasDefinition: Staden Chromatogram Files format (SCF) of base-called sequence reads, qualities, and other metadata.
children.label: SCF

children.hasDefinition: PHD sequence trace format to store serialised chromatogram data (reads).
children.label: PHD

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format ignoring quality scores.
children.label: FASTQ

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.
children.label: qualillumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ Illumina 1.3 short read format.
children.label: FASTQ-illumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ short read format with phred quality.
children.label: FASTQ-sanger

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)
children.label: qualsolexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ Solexa/Illumina 1.0 short read format.
children.label: FASTQ-solexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format.
children.comment: Solexa/Illumina 1.0 format can encode a Solexa/Illumina quality score from -5 to 62 using ASCII 59 to 126 (although in raw read data Solexa scores from -5 to 40 only are expected)
children.label: qualsolexa

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8.
children.comment: Starting in Illumina 1.5 and before Illumina 1.8, the Phred scores 0 to 2 have a slightly different meaning. The values 0 and 1 are no longer used and the value 2, encoded by ASCII 66 "B", is used also at the end of reads as a Read Segment Quality Control Indicator.
children.label: qualillumina

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) for SOLiD data.
children.comment: For SOLiD data, the sequence is in color space, except the first position. The quality values are those of the Sanger format.
children.label: qualsolid

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences) from 454 sequencers.
children.label: qual454

children.hasDefinition: FASTQ format subset for Phred sequencing quality score data only (no sequences).
children.comment: Phred quality scores  are defined as a property which is logarithmically related to the base-calling error probabilities.
children.label: qual

children.hasDefinition: A text format resembling FASTQ short read format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.
children.label: FASTQ-like format (text)

children.hasDefinition: A format resembling FASTQ short read format.
children.comment: This concept may be used for non-standard FASTQ short read-like formats.
children.label: FASTQ-like format

children.hasDefinition: BAM format, the binary, BGZF-formatted compressed version of SAM format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
children.label: BAM

children.hasDefinition: Sequence Alignment/Map (SAM) format for alignment of nucleotide sequences (e.g. sequencing reads) to (a) reference sequence(s). May contain base-call and alignment qualities and other data.
children.comment: The format supports short and long reads (up to 128Mbp) produced by different sequencing platforms and is used to hold mapped data within the GATK and across the Broad Institute, the Sanger Centre, and throughout the 1000 Genomes project.
children.label: SAM

children.hasDefinition: AB1 binary format of raw DNA sequence reads (output of Applied Biosystems' sequencing analysis software). Contains an electropherogram and the DNA base sequence.
children.comment: AB1 uses the generic binary Applied Biosystems, Inc. Format (ABIF).
children.label: AB1

children.hasDefinition: Sequence Read Format (SRF) of sequence trace data. Supports submission to the NCBI Short Read Archive.
children.label: SRF

children.hasDefinition: ZTR format for storing chromatogram data from DNA sequencing instruments.
children.label: ZTR

children.hasDefinition: Standard flowgram format (SFF) is a binary file format used to encode results of pyrosequencing from the 454 Life Sciences platform for high-throughput sequencing.
children.label: SFF

children.hasDefinition: . proBAM is an adaptation of BAM (format_2572), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.
children.label: proBAM

children.hasDefinition: Format for sequence trace data (i.e. including base call information).
children.label: Sequence trace format

children.hasDefinition: ACEDB sequence format.
children.label: acedb

children.hasDefinition: Codata entry format.
children.label: codata

children.hasDefinition: Staden experiment file format.
children.label: Staden experiment format

children.hasDefinition: Fitch program format.
children.label: fitch program

children.hasDefinition: GCG sequence file format.
children.comment: GCG SSF (single sequence file) file format.
children.label: GCG

children.hasDefinition: GCG MSF (multiple sequence file) file format.
children.label: GCG MSF

children.hasDefinition: Rich sequence format.
children.comment: RSF-format files contain one or more sequences that may or may not be related. In addition to the sequence data, each sequence can be annotated with descriptive sequence information (from the GCG manual).
children.label: RSF

children.hasDefinition: Some format based on the GCG format.
children.label: GCG format variant

children.hasDefinition: GFF feature file format with sequence in the header.
children.label: GFF2-seq

children.hasDefinition: GFF3 feature file format with sequence.
children.label: GFF3-seq

children.hasDefinition: Hennig86 output sequence format.
children.label: hennig86

children.hasDefinition: Intelligenetics sequence format.
children.label: ig

children.hasDefinition: Intelligenetics sequence format (strict version).
children.label: igstrict

children.hasDefinition: Jackknifer interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.
children.label: jackknifer

children.hasDefinition: Mase program sequence format.
children.label: mase format

children.hasDefinition: Mega interleaved and non-interleaved sequence format.
children.label: mega-seq

children.hasDefinition: Nexus/paup interleaved sequence format.
children.label: nexus-seq

children.hasDefinition: PDB sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdb format in EMBOSS.
children.label: pdbatom

children.hasDefinition: PDB nucleotide sequence format (ATOM lines).
children.comment: pdbnuc format in EMBOSS.

children.hasDefinition: Reference-based compression of alignment format

children.hasDefinition: . proBAM is an adaptation of BAM (format_2572), which was extended to meet specific requirements entailed by proteomics data.
children.label: proBAM

children.hasDefinition: The CHAIN format describes a pairwise alignment that allow gaps in both sequences simultaneously and is used by the UCSC Genome Browser.
children.label: CHAIN

children.hasDefinition: Compact Idiosyncratic Gapped Alignment Report format is a compressed (run-length encoded) pairwise alignment format. It is useful for representing long (e.g. genomic) pairwise alignments.
children.label: CIGAR format

children.hasDefinition: Data format for molecular sequence alignment information that can hold sequence alignment(s) of only 2 sequences.
children.label: Alignment format (pair only)

children.comment: 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioXSD in XML' is the XML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioXSD-schema-based XML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, Web services, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioXSD (XML)

children.hasDefinition: An alignment format generated by PRANK/PRANKSTER consisting of four elements: newick, nodes, selection and model.
children.label: HSAML

children.hasDefinition: XML format for molecular sequence alignment information.
children.label: Alignment format (XML)

children.hasDefinition: RNA Markup Language.
children.label: RNAML

children.comment: Work in progress. 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioJSON' is the JSON format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioJSON is a BioXSD-schema-based JSON format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web applications and APIs, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioJSON (BioXSD)

children.comment: Work in progress. 'BioXSD' belongs to the 'BioXSD|GTrack' ecosystem of generic formats. 'BioYAML' is the YAML format based on the common, unified 'BioXSD data model', a.k.a. 'BioXSD|BioJSON|BioYAML'.
children.hasDefinition: BioYAML is a BioXSD-schema-based YAML format of sequence-based data and some other common data - sequence records, alignments, feature records, references to resources, and more - optimised for integrative bioinformatics, web APIs, human readability and editting, and object-oriented programming.
children.label: BioYAML

children.hasDefinition: BioJSON is a JSON format of single multiple sequence alignments, with their annotations, features, and custom visualisation and application settings for the Jalview workbench.
children.label: BioJSON (Jalview)

children.hasDefinition: Binary format used by the ARB software suite
children.label: ARB

children.hasDefinition: A set of XML compliant markup components for describing multiple sequence alignments.
children.label: MSAML

children.hasDefinition: Data format for molecular sequence alignment information.
children.label: Alignment format

children.hasDefinition: Dendrogram (tree file) format generated by ClustalW.
children.label: ClustalW dendrogram

children.hasDefinition: Raw data file format used by Phylip from which a phylogenetic tree is directly generated or plotted.
children.label: Phylip tree raw

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree data format used by the PHYLIP program.
children.label: Phylip tree format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeBASE database of phylogenetic data.
children.label: TreeBASE format

children.hasDefinition: The format of an entry from the TreeFam database of phylogenetic data.
children.label: TreeFam format

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree Newick (text) format.
children.label: newick

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree TreeCon (text) format.
children.label: TreeCon format

children.hasDefinition: Phylogenetic tree Nexus (text) format.
children.label: Nexus format

children.hasDefinition: Text format for a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree format (text)

children.hasDefinition: phyloXML is a standardised XML format for phylogenetic trees, networks, and associated data.
children.label: phyloXML

children.hasDefinition: NeXML is a standardised XML format for rich phyloinformatic data.
children.label: NeXML

children.hasDefinition: XML format for a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree format (XML)

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a phylogenetic tree.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree format

children.hasDefinition: Systems Biology Markup Language (SBML), the standard XML format for models of biological processes such as for example metabolism, cell signaling, and gene regulation.
children.label: SBML

children.hasDefinition: BioPAX is an exchange format for pathway data, with its data model defined in OWL.
children.label: BioPAX

children.hasDefinition: CopasiML, the native format of COPASI.
children.label: CopasiML

children.hasDefinition: CellML, the format for mathematical models of biological and other networks.
children.label: CellML

children.hasDefinition: SIF (simple interaction file) Format - a network/pathway format used for instance in cytoscape.
children.label: sif

children.hasDefinition: Graphical Pathway Markup Language (GPML) is an XML format used for exchanging biological pathways.
children.label: GPML

children.hasDefinition: Open Modeling EXchange format (OMEX) is a ZIPped format for encapsulating all information necessary for a modeling and simulation project in systems biology.
children.comment: An OMEX file is a ZIP container that includes a manifest file, listing the content of the archive, an optional metadata file adding information about the archive and its content, and the files describing the model. OMEX is one of the standardised formats within COMBINE (Computational Modeling in Biology Network).
children.label: COMBINE OMEX

children.hasDefinition: SBtab is a tabular format for biochemical network models.
children.label: SBtab

children.hasDefinition: Biological Connection Markup Language (BCML) is an XML format for biological pathways.
children.label: BCML

children.hasDefinition: SBGN-ML is an XML format for Systems Biology Graphical Notation (SBGN) diagrams of biological pathways or networks.
children.label: SBGN-ML

children.hasDefinition: Default XML format of VisANT, containing all the network information.
children.label: VisML

children.hasDefinition: GML (Graph Modeling Language) is a text file format supporting network data with a very easy syntax. It is used by Graphlet, Pajek, yEd, LEDA and NetworkX.
children.label: GML

children.hasDefinition: The KEGG Markup Language (KGML) is an exchange format of the KEGG pathway maps, which is converted from internally used KGML+ (KGML+SVG) format.
children.label: KGML

children.hasDefinition: A model description language for computational neuroscience.
children.label: NeuroML

children.hasDefinition: BioNetGen is a format for the specification and simulation of rule-based models of biochemical systems, including signal transduction, metabolic, and genetic regulatory networks.
children.label: BNGL

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a biological pathway or network.
children.label: Biological pathway or network format

children.hasDefinition: Amino acid index format used by the AAindex database.
children.label: aaindex

children.hasDefinition: Data format for an amino acid index.
children.label: Amino acid index format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a matrix of 3D-1D scores (amino acid environment probabilities).
children.label: 3D-1D scoring matrix format

children.hasDefinition: Binary format used by MATLAB files to store workspace variables.
children.label: MAT

children.hasDefinition: The Zarr format is an implementation of chunked, compressed, N-dimensional arrays for storing data.
children.label: Zarr

children.hasDefinition: The Matrix Market matrix (MTX) format stores numerical or pattern matrices in a dense (array format) or sparse (coordinate format) representation.
children.label: MTX

children.hasDefinition: Format of a matrix (array) of numerical values.
children.label: Matrix format

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for continuous quantitative character data.
children.label: Phylip continuous quantitative characters

children.hasDefinition: PHYLIP file format for phylogenetics character frequency data.
children.label: Phylip character frequencies format

children.hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic continuous quantitative character data.
children.label: Phylogenetic continuous quantitative character format

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP discrete states data.
children.label: Phylip discrete states format

children.hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic discrete states data.
children.label: Phylogenetic discrete states format

children.hasDefinition: Format of PHYLIP cliques data.
children.label: Phylip cliques format

children.hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic cliques data.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (cliques) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of phylogenetic invariants data.
children.label: Phylogenetic tree report (invariants) format

children.hasDefinition: Format of raw (unplotted) phylogenetic data.
children.label: Phylogenetic character data format

children.hasDefinition: Format for reports on a protein family.
children.label: Protein family report format

children.hasDefinition: Entry format (XML) for the STRING database of protein interaction.
children.label: STRING entry format (XML)

children.hasDefinition: Protein affinity format (PSI-PAR), standardised by HUPO PSI MI. It is compatible with PSI MI XML (MIF) and uses the same XML Schema.
children.label: PSI-PAR

children.hasDefinition: XML Molecular Interaction Format (MIF), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
children.label: PSI MI XML (MIF)

children.hasDefinition: Tabular Molecular Interaction format (MITAB), standardised by HUPO PSI MI.
children.label: PSI MI TAB (MITAB)

children.hasDefinition: Format for molecular interaction data.
children.label: Protein interaction format

children.hasDefinition: Common Assembly Format (CAF). A sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata.
children.label: CAF

children.hasDefinition: Sequence assembly project file EXP format.
children.label: EXP

children.hasDefinition: AFG is a single text-based file assembly format  that holds read and consensus information together
children.label: afg

children.hasDefinition: Tab-delimited text file format used by Eland - the read-mapping program distributed by Illumina with its sequencing analysis pipeline - which maps short Solexa sequence reads to the human reference genome.
children.label: ELAND format

children.hasDefinition: FASTG is a format for faithfully representing genome assemblies in the face of allelic polymorphism and assembly uncertainty.
children.comment: It is called FASTG, like FASTA, but the G stands for "graph".
children.label: FASTG

children.hasDefinition: Graphical Fragment Assembly captures sequence graphs as the product of an assembly, a representation of variation in genomes, splice graphs in genes, or even overlap between reads from long-read sequencing technology.
children.label: GFA 1

children.hasDefinition: Graphical Fragment Assembly captures sequence graphs as the product of an assembly, a representation of variation in genomes, splice graphs in genes, or even overlap between reads from long-read sequencing technology.
children.label: GFA 2

children.hasDefinition: Text format for sequence assembly data.
children.label: Sequence assembly format (text)

children.hasDefinition: ACE sequence assembly format including contigs, base-call qualities, and other metadata (version Aug 1998 and onwards).
children.label: ACE

children.hasDefinition: AGP is a tabular format for a sequence assembly (a contig, a scaffold/supercontig, or a chromosome).
children.label: AGP

children.hasDefinition: Format for sequence assembly data.
children.label: Sequence assembly format

children.hasDefinition: Affymetrix data file format for information about experimental conditions and protocols.
children.hasExactSynonym: Affymetrix experimental conditions data file format
children.label: affymetrix-exp

children.hasDefinition: Format for information about a microarray experimental per se (not the data generated from that experiment).
children.label: Microarray experiment data format

children.hasDefinition: GCDML XML format for genome and metagenome metadata according to MIGS/MIMS/MIMARKS information standards, standardised by the Genomic Standards Consortium (GSC).
children.label: GCDML

children.hasDefinition: GelML is the format for describing the process of gel electrophoresis, standardised by HUPO PSI PS.
children.label: GelML

children.hasDefinition: spML is the format for describing proteomics sample processing, other than using gels, prior to mass spectrometric protein identification, standardised by HUPO PSI PS. It may also be applicable for metabolomics.
children.label: spML

children.hasDefinition: qcML is an XML format for quality-related data of mass spectrometry and other high-throughput measurements.
children.comment: The focus of qcML is towards mass spectrometry based proteomics, but the format is suitable for metabolomics and sequencing as well.
children.label: qcML

children.hasDefinition: PRIDE XML is an XML format for mass spectra, peptide and protein identifications, and metadata about a corresponding measurement, sample, experiment.
children.label: PRIDE XML

children.hasDefinition: Simulation Experiment Description Markup Language (SED-ML) is an XML format for encoding simulation setups, according to the MIASE (Minimum Information About a Simulation Experiment) requirements.
children.label: SED-ML

children.hasDefinition: Open Modeling EXchange format (OMEX) is a ZIPped format for encapsulating all information necessary for a modeling and simulation project in systems biology.
children.comment: An OMEX file is a ZIP container that includes a manifest file, listing the content of the archive, an optional metadata file adding information about the archive and its content, and the files describing the model. OMEX is one of the standardised formats within COMBINE (Computational Modeling in Biology Network).
children.label: COMBINE OMEX

children.hasDefinition: The Investigation / Study / Assay (ISA) tab-delimited (TAB) format incorporates metadata fromexperiments employing a combination of technologies.
children.comment: ISA-TAB is based on MAGE-TAB. Other than tabular, the ISA model can also be represented in RDF, and in JSON (compliable with a set of defined JSON Schemata).
children.label: ISA-TAB

children.hasDefinition: Data format for annotation on a laboratory experiment.
children.label: Experiment annotation format

children.hasDefinition: BcForms is a format for abstractly describing the molecular structure (atoms and bonds) of macromolecular complexes as a collection of subunits and crosslinks. Each subunit can be described with BpForms (http://edamontology.org/format_3909) or SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301). BcForms uses an ontology of crosslinks to abstract the chemical details of crosslinks from the descriptions of complexes (see https://bpforms.org/crosslink.html).
children.comment: BcForms is related to http://edamontology.org/format_3909. (BcForms uses BpForms to describe subunits which are DNA, RNA, or protein polymers.) However, that format isn't the parent of BcForms. BcForms is similarly related to SMILES (http://edamontology.org/data_2301).
children.label: BcForms

children.hasDefinition: Format of a report of general information about a specific protein.
children.label: Protein report format

children.hasDefinition: Format of affymetrix gene cluster files (hc-genes.txt, hc-chips.txt) from hierarchical clustering.
children.label: affymetrix

children.hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of nucleotide sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster format (nucleic acid)

children.hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of protein sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster format (protein)

children.hasDefinition: Format used for clusters of molecular sequences.
children.label: Sequence cluster format

children.hasDefinition: OBO ontology text format.
children.label: OBO

children.hasDefinition: OBO ontology XML format.
children.label: OBO-XML

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Open Biomedical Ontologies (OBO) model.
children.label: OBO format

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
children.label: OWL Functional Syntax

children.hasDefinition: A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
children.comment: This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.
children.label: Manchester OWL Syntax

children.hasDefinition: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.
children.label: OWL/XML

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Web Ontology Language (OWL) model.
children.label: OWL format

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
children.label: OWL Functional Syntax

children.hasDefinition: A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
children.comment: This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.
children.label: Manchester OWL Syntax

children.hasDefinition: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.
children.label: OWL/XML

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Web Ontology Language (OWL) model.
children.label: OWL format

children.hasDefinition: The Terse RDF Triple Language (Turtle) is a human-friendly serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs.
children.comment: The SPARQL Query Language incorporates a very similar syntax.
children.label: Turtle

children.hasDefinition: A plain text serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs, and a subset of the Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) format.
children.comment: N-Triples should not be confused with Notation 3 which is a superset of Turtle.
children.label: N-Triples

children.hasDefinition: A shorthand non-XML serialisation of Resource Description Framework model, designed with human-readability in mind.
children.label: Notation3

children.hasDefinition: Resource Description Framework (RDF) XML format.
children.comment: RDF/XML is a serialisation syntax for OWL DL, but not for OWL Full.
children.label: RDF/XML

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: JSON-LD, or JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data, is a method of encoding Linked Data using JSON.
children.hasExactSynonym: JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data
children.label: JSON-LD

children.hasDefinition: UniProtKB RDF sequence features format is an RDF format available for downloading UniProt entries (in RDF/XML).
children.label: UniProtKB RDF

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: N-Quads is a line-based, plain text format for encoding an RDF dataset. It includes information about the graph each triple belongs to.
children.comment: N-Quads should not be confused with N-Triples which does not contain graph information.
children.label: N-Quads

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Resource Description Framework (RDF) model.
children.label: RDF format

children.hasDefinition: A superset of the "Description-Logic Knowledge Representation System Specification from the KRSS Group of the ARPA Knowledge Sharing Effort".
children.comment: This format is used in Protege 4.
children.label: KRSS2 Syntax

children.hasDefinition: Format used for ontologies.
children.label: Ontology format

children.hasDefinition: A human-readable encoding for the Web Ontology Language (OWL).
children.label: OWL Functional Syntax

children.hasDefinition: A syntax for writing OWL class expressions.
children.comment: This format was influenced by the OWL Abstract Syntax and the DL style syntax.
children.label: Manchester OWL Syntax

children.hasDefinition: OWL ontology XML serialisation format.
children.label: OWL/XML

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Web Ontology Language (OWL) model.
children.label: OWL format

children.hasDefinition: The Terse RDF Triple Language (Turtle) is a human-friendly serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs.
children.comment: The SPARQL Query Language incorporates a very similar syntax.
children.label: Turtle

children.hasDefinition: A plain text serialisation format for RDF (Resource Description Framework) graphs, and a subset of the Turtle (Terse RDF Triple Language) format.
children.comment: N-Triples should not be confused with Notation 3 which is a superset of Turtle.
children.label: N-Triples

children.hasDefinition: A shorthand non-XML serialisation of Resource Description Framework model, designed with human-readability in mind.
children.label: Notation3

children.hasDefinition: Resource Description Framework (RDF) XML format.
children.comment: RDF/XML is a serialisation syntax for OWL DL, but not for OWL Full.
children.label: RDF/XML

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: JSON-LD, or JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data, is a method of encoding Linked Data using JSON.
children.hasExactSynonym: JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data
children.label: JSON-LD

children.hasDefinition: UniProtKB RDF sequence features format is an RDF format available for downloading UniProt entries (in RDF/XML).
children.label: UniProtKB RDF

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: N-Quads is a line-based, plain text format for encoding an RDF dataset. It includes information about the graph each triple belongs to.
children.comment: N-Quads should not be confused with N-Triples which does not contain graph information.
children.label: N-Quads

children.hasDefinition: A serialisation format conforming to the Resource Description Framework (RDF) model.
children.label: RDF format

children.hasDefinition: A format of text annotation using the linked-data Open Annotation Data Model, serialised typically in RDF or JSON-LD.
children.label: Open Annotation format

children.hasDefinition: JSON-LD, or JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data, is a method of encoding Linked Data using JSON.
children.hasExactSynonym: JavaScript Object Notation for Linked Data
children.label: JSON-LD

children.hasDefinition: A linked data format enables publishing structured data as linked data (Linked Data), so that the data can be interlinked and become more useful through semantic queries.
children.label: Linked data format

children.hasDefinition: Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).
children.label: VCF

children.hasDefinition: Genome Variation Format (GVF). A GFF3-compatible format with defined header and attribute tags for sequence variation.
children.label: GVF

children.hasDefinition: BCF, the binary version of Variant Call Format (VCF) for sequence variation (indels, polymorphisms, structural variation).
children.label: BCF

children.hasDefinition: Ensembl standard format for variation data.
children.label: Ensembl variation file format

children.hasDefinition: Data format used by the SQLite database conformant to the Gemini schema.
children.label: Gemini SQLite format

children.hasDefinition: Format of sequence variation annotation.
children.label: Sequence variation annotation format

children.hasDefinition: Format of raw SCOP domain classification data files.
children.comment: These are the parsable data files provided by SCOP.
children.label: Raw SCOP domain classification format

children.hasDefinition: Format of raw CATH domain classification data files.
children.comment: These are the parsable data files provided by CATH.
children.label: Raw CATH domain classification format

children.hasDefinition: Format of summary of domain classification information for a CATH domain.
children.comment: The report (for example http://www.cathdb.info/domain/1cukA01) includes CATH codes for levels in the hierarchy for the domain, level descriptions and relevant data and links.
children.label: CATH domain report format

children.hasDefinition: Output xml file from the InterProScan sequence analysis application.
children.label: InterProScan XML

children.hasDefinition: Format of data concerning the classification of the sequences and/or structures of protein structural domain(s).
children.label: Protein domain classification format

children.hasDefinition: Systems Biology Result Markup Language (SBRML), the standard XML format for simulated or calculated results (e.g. trajectories) of systems biology models.
children.label: SBRML

children.hasDefinition: CopasiML, the native format of COPASI.
children.label: CopasiML

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a report of information derived from a biological pathway or network.
children.label: Biological pathway or network report format

children.hasDefinition: mzML format for raw spectrometer output data, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
children.comment: mzML is the successor and unifier of the mzData format developed by PSI and mzXML developed at the Seattle Proteome Center.
children.label: mzML

children.hasDefinition: TraML (Transition Markup Language) is the format for mass spectrometry transitions, standardised by HUPO PSI MSS.
children.label: TraML

children.hasDefinition: mzIdentML is the exchange format for peptides and proteins identified from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of proteomics search engines.
children.label: mzIdentML

children.hasDefinition: mzQuantML is the format for quantitation values associated with peptides, proteins and small molecules from mass spectra, standardised by HUPO PSI PI. It can be used for outputs of quantitation software for proteomics.
children.label: mzQuantML

children.comment: Network Common Data Form (NetCDF) library is supported by AMBER MD package from version 9.
children.hasDefinition: Format used by netCDF software  library for writing and reading chromatography-MS data files.  Also used to store trajectory atom coordinates information, such as the ones obtained by Molecular Dynamics simulations.
children.label: netCDF

children.hasDefinition: Mascot Generic Format.  Encodes multiple MS/MS spectra in a single file.
children.comment: Files includes *m*/*z*, intensity pairs separated by headers; headers can contain a bit more information, including search engine instructions.
children.label: MGF

children.hasDefinition: Spectral data format file where each spectrum is written to a separate file.
children.comment: Each file contains one header line for the known or assumed charge and the mass of the precursor peptide ion, calculated from the measured *m*/*z* and the charge. This one line was then followed by all the *m*/*z*, intensity pairs that represent the spectrum.
children.label: dta

children.hasDefinition: Spectral data file similar to dta.
children.comment: Differ from .dta only in subtleties of the header line format and content and support the added feature of being able to.
children.label: pkl

children.hasDefinition: Common file format for proteomics mass spectrometric data developed at the Seattle Proteome Center/Institute for Systems Biology.
children.label: mzXML

children.hasDefinition: Open data format for the storage, exchange, and processing of peptide sequence assignments of MS/MS scans, intended to provide a common data output format for many different MS/MS search engines and subsequent peptide-level analyses.
children.label: pepXML

children.hasDefinition: mzTab is a tab-delimited format for mass spectrometry-based proteomics and metabolomics results.
children.label: mzTab

children.hasDefinition: imzML metadata is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging metadata.
children.comment: imzML data are recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra. This entry is for the metadata XML file
children.label: imzML metadata file

children.hasDefinition: qcML is an XML format for quality-related data of mass spectrometry and other high-throughput measurements.
children.comment: The focus of qcML is towards mass spectrometry based proteomics, but the format is suitable for metabolomics and sequencing as well.
children.label: qcML

children.hasDefinition: PRIDE XML is an XML format for mass spectra, peptide and protein identifications, and metadata about a corresponding measurement, sample, experiment.
children.label: PRIDE XML

children.hasDefinition: Proprietary mass-spectrometry format of Thermo Scientific's ProteomeDiscoverer software.
children.comment: This format corresponds to an SQLite database, and you can look into the files with e.g. SQLiteStudio3. There are also some readers (http://doi.org/10.1021/pr2005154) and converters (http://doi.org/10.1016/j.jprot.2015.06.015) for this format available, which re-engineered the database schema, but there is no official DB schema specification of Thermo Scientific for the format.
children.label: MSF

children.hasDefinition: Mass spectrum file format from QSTAR and QTRAP instruments (ABI/Sciex).
children.label: WIFF format

children.hasDefinition: Output format used by X! series search engines that is based on the XML language BIOML.
children.label: X!Tandem XML

children.hasDefinition: Proprietary file format for mass spectrometry data from Thermo Scientific.
children.comment: Proprietary format for which documentation is not available.
children.label: Thermo RAW

children.hasDefinition: "Raw" result file from Mascot database search.
children.label: Mascot .dat file

children.hasDefinition: Format of peak list files from Andromeda search engine (MaxQuant) that consist of arbitrarily many spectra.
children.label: MaxQuant APL peaklist format

children.hasDefinition: A format for storage, exchange, and processing of protein identifications created from ms/ms-derived peptide sequence data.
children.comment: No human-consumable information about this format is available (see http://tools.proteomecenter.org/wiki/index.php?title=Formats:protXML).
children.label: protXML

children.hasDefinition: "Raw" result file from SEQUEST database search.
children.label: SEQUEST .out file

children.hasDefinition: XML file format for files containing information about peptide identifications from mass spectrometry data analysis carried out with OpenMS.
children.label: idXML

children.hasDefinition: OpenMS format for grouping features in one map or across several maps.
children.label: consensusXML

children.hasDefinition: OpenMS format for quantitation results (LC/MS features).
children.label: featureXML

children.hasDefinition: Now deprecated data format of the HUPO Proteomics Standards Initiative.  Replaced by mzML (format_3244).
children.label: mzData

children.hasDefinition: Format supported by the Tide tool for identifying peptides from tandem mass spectra.
children.label: TIDE TXT

children.hasDefinition: ibd is a data format for mass spectrometry imaging data.
children.comment: imzML data is recorded in 2 files: '.imzXML' is a metadata XML file based on mzML by HUPO-PSI, and '.ibd' is a binary file containing the mass spectra.
children.label: ibd

children.hasDefinition: Proprietary file format for mass spectrometry data from Waters.
children.comment: Proprietary format for which documentation is not available, but used by multiple tools.
children.label: Waters RAW

children.hasDefinition: A standardized file format for data exchange in mass spectrometry, initially developed for infrared spectrometry.
children.comment: JCAMP-DX is an ASCII based format and therefore not very compact even though it includes standards for file compression.
children.label: JCAMP-DX

children.hasDefinition: Format for mass pectra and derived data, include peptide sequences etc.
children.label: Mass spectrometry data format

children.hasDefinition: The MAP file describes SNPs and is used by the Plink package.
children.label: MAP

children.hasDefinition: The PED file describes individuals and genetic data and is used by the Plink package.
children.label: PED

children.hasDefinition: The PED/MAP file describes data used by the Plink package.
children.label: PED/MAP

children.hasDefinition: Data format for a metadata on an individual and their genetic data.
children.label: Individual genetic data format

children.hasDefinition: BAM indexing format
children.label: BAI

children.hasDefinition: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "small" genomes.
children.label: ebwt

children.hasDefinition: Bowtie format for indexed reference genome for "large" genomes.
children.label: ebwtl

children.hasDefinition: An index of a genome database, indexed for use by the snpeff tool.
children.label: snpeffdb

children.hasDefinition: Index file format used by the samtools package to index TAB-delimited genome position files.
children.label: Tabix index file format

children.hasDefinition: Format of a data index of some type.
children.label: Data index format

children.hasDefinition: Microsoft Excel spreadsheet format.
children.label: xls

children.hasDefinition: Microsoft Word format.
children.label: docx

children.hasDefinition: Portable Document Format
children.label: PDF

children.hasDefinition: ObjTables is a toolkit for creating re-usable datasets that are both human and machine-readable, combining the ease of spreadsheets (e.g., Excel workbooks) with the rigor of schemas (classes, their attributes, the type of each attribute, and the possible relationships between instances of classes). ObjTables consists of a format for describing schemas for spreadsheets, numerous data types for science, a syntax for indicating the class and attribute represented by each table and column in a workbook, and software for using schemas to rigorously validate, merge, split, compare, and revision datasets.
children.label: ObjTables

children.hasDefinition: MS Excel spreadsheet format consisting of a set of XML documents stored in a ZIP-compressed file.
children.label: xlsx

children.hasDefinition: format for the LaTeX document preparation system
children.comment: uses the TeX typesetting program format
children.label: latex

children.hasDefinition: Format of documents including word processor, spreadsheet and presentation.
children.label: Document format

children.hasDefinition: Medical image format corresponding to the Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine (DICOM) standard.
children.label: DICOM format

children.hasDefinition: Medical image and metadata format of the Neuroimaging Informatics Technology Initiative.
children.label: nii

children.hasDefinition: Text-based tagged file format for medical images generated using the MetaImage software package.
children.label: mhd

children.hasDefinition: Nearly Raw Rasta Data format designed to support scientific visualisation and image processing involving N-dimensional raster data.
children.label: nrrd

children.hasDefinition: Joint Picture Group file format for lossy graphics file.
children.comment: Sequence of segments with markers. Begins with byte of 0xFF and follows by marker type.
children.label: JPG

children.hasDefinition: A versatile bitmap format.
